      <title>The Tragedy of Hamlet, Prince of Denmark</title>

      <article class="book" id="R.1">
         <header class="book-titlepage">
            <h1>The Tragedy of Hamlet, Prince of Denmark</h1>
         </header>

         <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
            <header class="preface-titlepage">
               <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
            </header>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">CLAUDIUS, king of Denmark. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">HAMLET, son to the late, and nephew to the present king.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">POLONIUS, lord chamberlain. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">HORATIO, friend to Hamlet.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">LAERTES, son to Polonius.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">LUCIANUS, nephew to the king.</span>
            </p>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">VOLTIMAND</span>
                        <span class="personname">CORNELIUS</span>
                        <span class="personname">ROSENCRANTZ</span>
                        <span class="personname">GUILDENSTERN</span>
                        <span class="personname">OSRIC</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">courtiers.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">A Gentleman</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">A Priest. </span>
            </p>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">MARCELLUS</span>
                        <span class="personname">BERNARDO</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">officers.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">FRANCISCO, a soldier.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">REYNALDO, servant to Polonius.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Players.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Two Clowns, grave-diggers.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">FORTINBRAS, prince of Norway. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">A Captain.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">English Ambassadors. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">GERTRUDE, queen of Denmark, and mother to Hamlet. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">OPHELIA, daughter to Polonius.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Lords, Ladies, Officers, Soldiers, Sailors, Messengers, and other Attendants.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Ghost of Hamlet's Father. </span>
            </p>
            <p>SCENE  Denmark.</p>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.4">3. SCENE III.  A room in Polonius' house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.5">4. SCENE IV.  The platform.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.6">5. SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>FRANCISCO at his post. Enter to him BERNARDO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERNARDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Who's there?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRANCISCO</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, answer me: stand, and unfold yourself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERNARDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Long live the king!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRANCISCO</div>
                     <div class="line">Bernardo?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERNARDO</div>
                     <div class="line">He.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRANCISCO</div>
                     <div class="line">You come most carefully upon your hour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERNARDO</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis now struck twelve; get thee to bed, Francisco.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRANCISCO</div>
                     <div class="line">For this relief much thanks: 'tis bitter cold,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I am sick at heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERNARDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Have you had quiet guard?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRANCISCO</div>
                     <div class="line">Not a mouse stirring.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERNARDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, good night.</div>
                     <div class="line">If you do meet Horatio and Marcellus,</div>
                     <div class="line">The rivals of my watch, bid them make haste.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRANCISCO</div>
                     <div class="line">I think I hear them. Stand, ho! Who's there?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter HORATIO and MARCELLUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Friends to this ground.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">And liegemen to the Dane.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRANCISCO</div>
                     <div class="line">Give you good night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">O, farewell, honest soldier:</div>
                     <div class="line">Who hath relieved you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRANCISCO</div>
                     <div class="line">Bernardo has my place.</div>
                     <div class="line">Give you good night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Holla! Bernardo!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERNARDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Say,</div>
                     <div class="line">What, is Horatio there?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">A piece of him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERNARDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Welcome, Horatio: welcome, good Marcellus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What, has this thing appear'd again to-night?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERNARDO</div>
                     <div class="line">I have seen nothing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Horatio says 'tis but our fantasy,</div>
                     <div class="line">And will not let belief take hold of him</div>
                     <div class="line">Touching this dreaded sight, twice seen of us:</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore I have entreated him along</div>
                     <div class="line">With us to watch the minutes of this night;</div>
                     <div class="line">That if again this apparition come,</div>
                     <div class="line">He may approve our eyes and speak to it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Tush, tush, 'twill not appear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERNARDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sit down awhile;</div>
                     <div class="line">And let us once again assail your ears,</div>
                     <div class="line">That are so fortified against our story</div>
                     <div class="line">What we have two nights seen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, sit we down,</div>
                     <div class="line">And let us hear Bernardo speak of this.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERNARDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Last night of all,</div>
                     <div class="line">When yond same star that's westward from the pole</div>
                     <div class="line">Had made his course to illume that part of heaven</div>
                     <div class="line">Where now it burns, Marcellus and myself,</div>
                     <div class="line">The bell then beating one,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Ghost</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, break thee off; look, where it comes again!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERNARDO</div>
                     <div class="line">In the same figure, like the king that's dead.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art a scholar; speak to it, Horatio.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERNARDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Looks it not like the king?  mark it, Horatio.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Most like: it harrows me with fear and wonder.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERNARDO</div>
                     <div class="line">It would be spoke to.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Question it, Horatio.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">What art thou that usurp'st this time of night,</div>
                     <div class="line">Together with that fair and warlike form</div>
                     <div class="line">In which the majesty of buried Denmark</div>
                     <div class="line">Did sometimes march? by heaven I charge thee, speak!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">It is offended.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERNARDO</div>
                     <div class="line">See, it stalks away!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay! speak, speak! I charge thee, speak!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit Ghost</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis gone, and will not answer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERNARDO</div>
                     <div class="line">How now, Horatio! you tremble and look pale:</div>
                     <div class="line">Is not this something more than fantasy?</div>
                     <div class="line">What think you on't?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Before my God, I might not this believe</div>
                     <div class="line">Without the sensible and true avouch</div>
                     <div class="line">Of mine own eyes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Is it not like the king?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">As thou art to thyself:</div>
                     <div class="line">Such was the very armour he had on</div>
                     <div class="line">When he the ambitious Norway combated;</div>
                     <div class="line">So frown'd he once, when, in an angry parle,</div>
                     <div class="line">He smote the sledded Polacks on the ice.</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis strange.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus twice before, and jump at this dead hour,</div>
                     <div class="line">With martial stalk hath he gone by our watch.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">In what particular thought to work I know not;</div>
                     <div class="line">But in the gross and scope of my opinion,</div>
                     <div class="line">This bodes some strange eruption to our state.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Good now, sit down, and tell me, he that knows,</div>
                     <div class="line">Why this same strict and most observant watch</div>
                     <div class="line">So nightly toils the subject of the land,</div>
                     <div class="line">And why such daily cast of brazen cannon,</div>
                     <div class="line">And foreign mart for implements of war;</div>
                     <div class="line">Why such impress of shipwrights, whose sore task</div>
                     <div class="line">Does not divide the Sunday from the week;</div>
                     <div class="line">What might be toward, that this sweaty haste</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth make the night joint-labourer with the day:</div>
                     <div class="line">Who is't that can inform me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">That can I;</div>
                     <div class="line">At least, the whisper goes so. Our last king,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose image even but now appear'd to us,</div>
                     <div class="line">Was, as you know, by Fortinbras of Norway,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thereto prick'd on by a most emulate pride,</div>
                     <div class="line">Dared to the combat; in which our valiant Hamlet--</div>
                     <div class="line">For so this side of our known world esteem'd him--</div>
                     <div class="line">Did slay this Fortinbras; who by a seal'd compact,</div>
                     <div class="line">Well ratified by law and heraldry,</div>
                     <div class="line">Did forfeit, with his life, all those his lands</div>
                     <div class="line">Which he stood seized of, to the conqueror:</div>
                     <div class="line">Against the which, a moiety competent</div>
                     <div class="line">Was gaged by our king; which had return'd</div>
                     <div class="line">To the inheritance of Fortinbras,</div>
                     <div class="line">Had he been vanquisher; as, by the same covenant,</div>
                     <div class="line">And carriage of the article design'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">His fell to Hamlet. Now, sir, young Fortinbras,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of unimproved mettle hot and full,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath in the skirts of Norway here and there</div>
                     <div class="line">Shark'd up a list of lawless resolutes,</div>
                     <div class="line">For food and diet, to some enterprise</div>
                     <div class="line">That hath a stomach in't; which is no other--</div>
                     <div class="line">As it doth well appear unto our state--</div>
                     <div class="line">But to recover of us, by strong hand</div>
                     <div class="line">And terms compulsatory, those foresaid lands</div>
                     <div class="line">So by his father lost: and this, I take it,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is the main motive of our preparations,</div>
                     <div class="line">The source of this our watch and the chief head</div>
                     <div class="line">Of this post-haste and romage in the land.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERNARDO</div>
                     <div class="line">I think it be no other but e'en so:</div>
                     <div class="line">Well may it sort that this portentous figure</div>
                     <div class="line">Comes armed through our watch; so like the king</div>
                     <div class="line">That was and is the question of these wars.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">A mote it is to trouble the mind's eye.</div>
                     <div class="line">In the most high and palmy state of Rome,</div>
                     <div class="line">A little ere the mightiest Julius fell,</div>
                     <div class="line">The graves stood tenantless and the sheeted dead</div>
                     <div class="line">Did squeak and gibber in the Roman streets:</div>
                     <div class="line">As stars with trains of fire and dews of blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Disasters in the sun; and the moist star</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon whose influence Neptune's empire stands</div>
                     <div class="line">Was sick almost to doomsday with eclipse:</div>
                     <div class="line">And even the like precurse of fierce events,</div>
                     <div class="line">As harbingers preceding still the fates</div>
                     <div class="line">And prologue to the omen coming on,</div>
                     <div class="line">Have heaven and earth together demonstrated</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto our climatures and countrymen.--</div>
                     <div class="line">But soft, behold! lo, where it comes again!</div>
                     <p>Re-enter Ghost</p>
                     <div class="line">I'll cross it, though it blast me. Stay, illusion!</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou hast any sound, or use of voice,</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak to me:</div>
                     <div class="line">If there be any good thing to be done,</div>
                     <div class="line">That may to thee do ease and grace to me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak to me:</div>
                     <p>Cock crows</p>
                     <div class="line">If thou art privy to thy country's fate,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, happily, foreknowing may avoid, O, speak!</div>
                     <div class="line">Or if thou hast uphoarded in thy life</div>
                     <div class="line">Extorted treasure in the womb of earth,</div>
                     <div class="line">For which, they say, you spirits oft walk in death,</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak of it: stay, and speak! Stop it, Marcellus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall I strike at it with my partisan?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Do, if it will not stand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERNARDO</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis here!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis here!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis gone!</div>
                     <p>Exit Ghost</p>
                     <div class="line">We do it wrong, being so majestical,</div>
                     <div class="line">To offer it the show of violence;</div>
                     <div class="line">For it is, as the air, invulnerable,</div>
                     <div class="line">And our vain blows malicious mockery.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERNARDO</div>
                     <div class="line">It was about to speak, when the cock crew.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">And then it started like a guilty thing</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon a fearful summons. I have heard,</div>
                     <div class="line">The cock, that is the trumpet to the morn,</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth with his lofty and shrill-sounding throat</div>
                     <div class="line">Awake the god of day; and, at his warning,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whether in sea or fire, in earth or air,</div>
                     <div class="line">The extravagant and erring spirit hies</div>
                     <div class="line">To his confine: and of the truth herein</div>
                     <div class="line">This present object made probation.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">It faded on the crowing of the cock.</div>
                     <div class="line">Some say that ever 'gainst that season comes</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherein our Saviour's birth is celebrated,</div>
                     <div class="line">The bird of dawning singeth all night long:</div>
                     <div class="line">And then, they say, no spirit dares stir abroad;</div>
                     <div class="line">The nights are wholesome; then no planets strike,</div>
                     <div class="line">No fairy takes, nor witch hath power to charm,</div>
                     <div class="line">So hallow'd and so gracious is the time.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">So have I heard and do in part believe it.</div>
                     <div class="line">But, look, the morn, in russet mantle clad,</div>
                     <div class="line">Walks o'er the dew of yon high eastward hill:</div>
                     <div class="line">Break we our watch up; and by my advice,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let us impart what we have seen to-night</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto young Hamlet; for, upon my life,</div>
                     <div class="line">This spirit, dumb to us, will speak to him.</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you consent we shall acquaint him with it,</div>
                     <div class="line">As needful in our loves, fitting our duty?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Let's do't, I pray; and I this morning know</div>
                     <div class="line">Where we shall find him most conveniently.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter KING CLAUDIUS, QUEEN GERTRUDE, HAMLET,
POLONIUS, LAERTES, VOLTIMAND, CORNELIUS, Lords,
and Attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Though yet of Hamlet our dear brother's death</div>
                     <div class="line">The memory be green, and that it us befitted</div>
                     <div class="line">To bear our hearts in grief and our whole kingdom</div>
                     <div class="line">To be contracted in one brow of woe,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet so far hath discretion fought with nature</div>
                     <div class="line">That we with wisest sorrow think on him,</div>
                     <div class="line">Together with remembrance of ourselves.</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore our sometime sister, now our queen,</div>
                     <div class="line">The imperial jointress to this warlike state,</div>
                     <div class="line">Have we, as 'twere with a defeated joy,--</div>
                     <div class="line">With an auspicious and a dropping eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">With mirth in funeral and with dirge in marriage,</div>
                     <div class="line">In equal scale weighing delight and dole,--</div>
                     <div class="line">Taken to wife: nor have we herein barr'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Your better wisdoms, which have freely gone</div>
                     <div class="line">With this affair along. For all, our thanks.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now follows, that you know, young Fortinbras,</div>
                     <div class="line">Holding a weak supposal of our worth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or thinking by our late dear brother's death</div>
                     <div class="line">Our state to be disjoint and out of frame,</div>
                     <div class="line">Colleagued with the dream of his advantage,</div>
                     <div class="line">He hath not fail'd to pester us with message,</div>
                     <div class="line">Importing the surrender of those lands</div>
                     <div class="line">Lost by his father, with all bonds of law,</div>
                     <div class="line">To our most valiant brother. So much for him.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now for ourself and for this time of meeting:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus much the business is: we have here writ</div>
                     <div class="line">To Norway, uncle of young Fortinbras,--</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, impotent and bed-rid, scarcely hears</div>
                     <div class="line">Of this his nephew's purpose,--to suppress</div>
                     <div class="line">His further gait herein; in that the levies,</div>
                     <div class="line">The lists and full proportions, are all made</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of his subject: and we here dispatch</div>
                     <div class="line">You, good Cornelius, and you, Voltimand,</div>
                     <div class="line">For bearers of this greeting to old Norway;</div>
                     <div class="line">Giving to you no further personal power</div>
                     <div class="line">To business with the king, more than the scope</div>
                     <div class="line">Of these delated articles allow.</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell, and let your haste commend your duty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORNELIUS</div>
                     <div class="speaker">VOLTIMAND</div>
                     <div class="line">In that and all things will we show our duty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">We doubt it nothing: heartily farewell.</div>
                     <p>Exeunt VOLTIMAND and CORNELIUS</p>
                     <div class="line">And now, Laertes, what's the news with you?</div>
                     <div class="line">You told us of some suit; what is't, Laertes?</div>
                     <div class="line">You cannot speak of reason to the Dane,</div>
                     <div class="line">And loose your voice: what wouldst thou beg, Laertes,</div>
                     <div class="line">That shall not be my offer, not thy asking?</div>
                     <div class="line">The head is not more native to the heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">The hand more instrumental to the mouth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Than is the throne of Denmark to thy father.</div>
                     <div class="line">What wouldst thou have, Laertes?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">My dread lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your leave and favour to return to France;</div>
                     <div class="line">From whence though willingly I came to Denmark,</div>
                     <div class="line">To show my duty in your coronation,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet now, I must confess, that duty done,</div>
                     <div class="line">My thoughts and wishes bend again toward France</div>
                     <div class="line">And bow them to your gracious leave and pardon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Have you your father's leave? What says Polonius?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">He hath, my lord, wrung from me my slow leave</div>
                     <div class="line">By laboursome petition, and at last</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon his will I seal'd my hard consent:</div>
                     <div class="line">I do beseech you, give him leave to go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Take thy fair hour, Laertes; time be thine,</div>
                     <div class="line">And thy best graces spend it at thy will!</div>
                     <div class="line">But now, my cousin Hamlet, and my son,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  A little more than kin, and less than kind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">How is it that the clouds still hang on you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Not so, my lord; I am too much i' the sun.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">Good Hamlet, cast thy nighted colour off,</div>
                     <div class="line">And let thine eye look like a friend on Denmark.</div>
                     <div class="line">Do not for ever with thy vailed lids</div>
                     <div class="line">Seek for thy noble father in the dust:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou know'st 'tis common; all that lives must die,</div>
                     <div class="line">Passing through nature to eternity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, madam, it is common.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">If it be,</div>
                     <div class="line">Why seems it so particular with thee?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Seems, madam! nay it is; I know not 'seems.'</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis not alone my inky cloak, good mother,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor customary suits of solemn black,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor windy suspiration of forced breath,</div>
                     <div class="line">No, nor the fruitful river in the eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor the dejected 'havior of the visage,</div>
                     <div class="line">Together with all forms, moods, shapes of grief,</div>
                     <div class="line">That can denote me truly: these indeed seem,</div>
                     <div class="line">For they are actions that a man might play:</div>
                     <div class="line">But I have that within which passeth show;</div>
                     <div class="line">These but the trappings and the suits of woe.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis sweet and commendable in your nature, Hamlet,</div>
                     <div class="line">To give these mourning duties to your father:</div>
                     <div class="line">But, you must know, your father lost a father;</div>
                     <div class="line">That father lost, lost his, and the survivor bound</div>
                     <div class="line">In filial obligation for some term</div>
                     <div class="line">To do obsequious sorrow: but to persever</div>
                     <div class="line">In obstinate condolement is a course</div>
                     <div class="line">Of impious stubbornness; 'tis unmanly grief;</div>
                     <div class="line">It shows a will most incorrect to heaven,</div>
                     <div class="line">A heart unfortified, a mind impatient,</div>
                     <div class="line">An understanding simple and unschool'd:</div>
                     <div class="line">For what we know must be and is as common</div>
                     <div class="line">As any the most vulgar thing to sense,</div>
                     <div class="line">Why should we in our peevish opposition</div>
                     <div class="line">Take it to heart? Fie! 'tis a fault to heaven,</div>
                     <div class="line">A fault against the dead, a fault to nature,</div>
                     <div class="line">To reason most absurd: whose common theme</div>
                     <div class="line">Is death of fathers, and who still hath cried,</div>
                     <div class="line">From the first corse till he that died to-day,</div>
                     <div class="line">'This must be so.' We pray you, throw to earth</div>
                     <div class="line">This unprevailing woe, and think of us</div>
                     <div class="line">As of a father: for let the world take note,</div>
                     <div class="line">You are the most immediate to our throne;</div>
                     <div class="line">And with no less nobility of love</div>
                     <div class="line">Than that which dearest father bears his son,</div>
                     <div class="line">Do I impart toward you. For your intent</div>
                     <div class="line">In going back to school in Wittenberg,</div>
                     <div class="line">It is most retrograde to our desire:</div>
                     <div class="line">And we beseech you, bend you to remain</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, in the cheer and comfort of our eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">Our chiefest courtier, cousin, and our son.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">Let not thy mother lose her prayers, Hamlet:</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray thee, stay with us; go not to Wittenberg.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall in all my best obey you, madam.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, 'tis a loving and a fair reply:</div>
                     <div class="line">Be as ourself in Denmark. Madam, come;</div>
                     <div class="line">This gentle and unforced accord of Hamlet</div>
                     <div class="line">Sits smiling to my heart: in grace whereof,</div>
                     <div class="line">No jocund health that Denmark drinks to-day,</div>
                     <div class="line">But the great cannon to the clouds shall tell,</div>
                     <div class="line">And the king's rouse the heavens all bruit again,</div>
                     <div class="line">Re-speaking earthly thunder. Come away.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt all but HAMLET</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">O, that this too too solid flesh would melt</div>
                     <div class="line">Thaw and resolve itself into a dew!</div>
                     <div class="line">Or that the Everlasting had not fix'd</div>
                     <div class="line">His canon 'gainst self-slaughter! O God! God!</div>
                     <div class="line">How weary, stale, flat and unprofitable,</div>
                     <div class="line">Seem to me all the uses of this world!</div>
                     <div class="line">Fie on't! ah fie! 'tis an unweeded garden,</div>
                     <div class="line">That grows to seed; things rank and gross in nature</div>
                     <div class="line">Possess it merely. That it should come to this!</div>
                     <div class="line">But two months dead: nay, not so much, not two:</div>
                     <div class="line">So excellent a king; that was, to this,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hyperion to a satyr; so loving to my mother</div>
                     <div class="line">That he might not beteem the winds of heaven</div>
                     <div class="line">Visit her face too roughly. Heaven and earth!</div>
                     <div class="line">Must I remember? why, she would hang on him,</div>
                     <div class="line">As if increase of appetite had grown</div>
                     <div class="line">By what it fed on: and yet, within a month--</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me not think on't--Frailty, thy name is woman!--</div>
                     <div class="line">A little month, or ere those shoes were old</div>
                     <div class="line">With which she follow'd my poor father's body,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like Niobe, all tears:--why she, even she--</div>
                     <div class="line">O, God! a beast, that wants discourse of reason,</div>
                     <div class="line">Would have mourn'd longer--married with my uncle,</div>
                     <div class="line">My father's brother, but no more like my father</div>
                     <div class="line">Than I to Hercules: within a month:</div>
                     <div class="line">Ere yet the salt of most unrighteous tears</div>
                     <div class="line">Had left the flushing in her galled eyes,</div>
                     <div class="line">She married. O, most wicked speed, to post</div>
                     <div class="line">With such dexterity to incestuous sheets!</div>
                     <div class="line">It is not nor it cannot come to good:</div>
                     <div class="line">But break, my heart; for I must hold my tongue.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter HORATIO, MARCELLUS, and BERNARDO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Hail to your lordship!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">I am glad to see you well:</div>
                     <div class="line">Horatio,--or I do forget myself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">The same, my lord, and your poor servant ever.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, my good friend; I'll change that name with you:</div>
                     <div class="line">And what make you from Wittenberg, Horatio? Marcellus?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">My good lord--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">I am very glad to see you. Good even, sir.</div>
                     <div class="line">But what, in faith, make you from Wittenberg?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">A truant disposition, good my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">I would not hear your enemy say so,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor shall you do mine ear that violence,</div>
                     <div class="line">To make it truster of your own report</div>
                     <div class="line">Against yourself: I know you are no truant.</div>
                     <div class="line">But what is your affair in Elsinore?</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll teach you to drink deep ere you depart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, I came to see your father's funeral.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray thee, do not mock me, fellow-student;</div>
                     <div class="line">I think it was to see my mother's wedding.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed, my lord, it follow'd hard upon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Thrift, thrift, Horatio! the funeral baked meats</div>
                     <div class="line">Did coldly furnish forth the marriage tables.</div>
                     <div class="line">Would I had met my dearest foe in heaven</div>
                     <div class="line">Or ever I had seen that day, Horatio!</div>
                     <div class="line">My father!--methinks I see my father.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Where, my lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">In my mind's eye, Horatio.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I saw him once; he was a goodly king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">He was a man, take him for all in all,</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall not look upon his like again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, I think I saw him yesternight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Saw? who?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, the king your father.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">The king my father!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Season your admiration for awhile</div>
                     <div class="line">With an attent ear, till I may deliver,</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the witness of these gentlemen,</div>
                     <div class="line">This marvel to you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">For God's love, let me hear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Two nights together had these gentlemen,</div>
                     <div class="line">Marcellus and Bernardo, on their watch,</div>
                     <div class="line">In the dead vast and middle of the night,</div>
                     <div class="line">Been thus encounter'd. A figure like your father,</div>
                     <div class="line">Armed at point exactly, cap-a-pe,</div>
                     <div class="line">Appears before them, and with solemn march</div>
                     <div class="line">Goes slow and stately by them: thrice he walk'd</div>
                     <div class="line">By their oppress'd and fear-surprised eyes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Within his truncheon's length; whilst they, distilled</div>
                     <div class="line">Almost to jelly with the act of fear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Stand dumb and speak not to him. This to me</div>
                     <div class="line">In dreadful secrecy impart they did;</div>
                     <div class="line">And I with them the third night kept the watch;</div>
                     <div class="line">Where, as they had deliver'd, both in time,</div>
                     <div class="line">Form of the thing, each word made true and good,</div>
                     <div class="line">The apparition comes: I knew your father;</div>
                     <div class="line">These hands are not more like.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">But where was this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, upon the platform where we watch'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Did you not speak to it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, I did;</div>
                     <div class="line">But answer made it none: yet once methought</div>
                     <div class="line">It lifted up its head and did address</div>
                     <div class="line">Itself to motion, like as it would speak;</div>
                     <div class="line">But even then the morning cock crew loud,</div>
                     <div class="line">And at the sound it shrunk in haste away,</div>
                     <div class="line">And vanish'd from our sight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis very strange.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">As I do live, my honour'd lord, 'tis true;</div>
                     <div class="line">And we did think it writ down in our duty</div>
                     <div class="line">To let you know of it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed, indeed, sirs, but this troubles me.</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold you the watch to-night?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="speaker">BERNARDO</div>
                     <div class="line">We do, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Arm'd, say you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="speaker">BERNARDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Arm'd, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">From top to toe?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="speaker">BERNARDO</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, from head to foot.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Then saw you not his face?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">O, yes, my lord; he wore his beaver up.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">What, look'd he frowningly?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">A countenance more in sorrow than in anger.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Pale or red?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, very pale.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">And fix'd his eyes upon you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Most constantly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">I would I had been there.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">It would have much amazed you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Very like, very like. Stay'd it long?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">While one with moderate haste might tell a hundred.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="speaker">BERNARDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Longer, longer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Not when I saw't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">His beard was grizzled--no?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">It was, as I have seen it in his life,</div>
                     <div class="line">A sable silver'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">I will watch to-night;</div>
                     <div class="line">Perchance 'twill walk again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I warrant it will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">If it assume my noble father's person,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll speak to it, though hell itself should gape</div>
                     <div class="line">And bid me hold my peace. I pray you all,</div>
                     <div class="line">If you have hitherto conceal'd this sight,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let it be tenable in your silence still;</div>
                     <div class="line">And whatsoever else shall hap to-night,</div>
                     <div class="line">Give it an understanding, but no tongue:</div>
                     <div class="line">I will requite your loves. So, fare you well:</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the platform, 'twixt eleven and twelve,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll visit you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">All</div>
                     <div class="line">Our duty to your honour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Your loves, as mine to you: farewell.</div>
                     <p>Exeunt all but HAMLET</p>
                     <div class="line">My father's spirit in arms! all is not well;</div>
                     <div class="line">I doubt some foul play: would the night were come!</div>
                     <div class="line">Till then sit still, my soul: foul deeds will rise,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though all the earth o'erwhelm them, to men's eyes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  A room in Polonius' house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter LAERTES and OPHELIA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">My necessaries are embark'd: farewell:</div>
                     <div class="line">And, sister, as the winds give benefit</div>
                     <div class="line">And convoy is assistant, do not sleep,</div>
                     <div class="line">But let me hear from you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you doubt that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">For Hamlet and the trifling of his favour,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold it a fashion and a toy in blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">A violet in the youth of primy nature,</div>
                     <div class="line">Forward, not permanent, sweet, not lasting,</div>
                     <div class="line">The perfume and suppliance of a minute; No more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">No more but so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">Think it no more;</div>
                     <div class="line">For nature, crescent, does not grow alone</div>
                     <div class="line">In thews and bulk, but, as this temple waxes,</div>
                     <div class="line">The inward service of the mind and soul</div>
                     <div class="line">Grows wide withal. Perhaps he loves you now,</div>
                     <div class="line">And now no soil nor cautel doth besmirch</div>
                     <div class="line">The virtue of his will: but you must fear,</div>
                     <div class="line">His greatness weigh'd, his will is not his own;</div>
                     <div class="line">For he himself is subject to his birth:</div>
                     <div class="line">He may not, as unvalued persons do,</div>
                     <div class="line">Carve for himself; for on his choice depends</div>
                     <div class="line">The safety and health of this whole state;</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore must his choice be circumscribed</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto the voice and yielding of that body</div>
                     <div class="line">Whereof he is the head. Then if he says he loves you,</div>
                     <div class="line">It fits your wisdom so far to believe it</div>
                     <div class="line">As he in his particular act and place</div>
                     <div class="line">May give his saying deed; which is no further</div>
                     <div class="line">Than the main voice of Denmark goes withal.</div>
                     <div class="line">Then weigh what loss your honour may sustain,</div>
                     <div class="line">If with too credent ear you list his songs,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or lose your heart, or your chaste treasure open</div>
                     <div class="line">To his unmaster'd importunity.</div>
                     <div class="line">Fear it, Ophelia, fear it, my dear sister,</div>
                     <div class="line">And keep you in the rear of your affection,</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of the shot and danger of desire.</div>
                     <div class="line">The chariest maid is prodigal enough,</div>
                     <div class="line">If she unmask her beauty to the moon:</div>
                     <div class="line">Virtue itself 'scapes not calumnious strokes:</div>
                     <div class="line">The canker galls the infants of the spring,</div>
                     <div class="line">Too oft before their buttons be disclosed,</div>
                     <div class="line">And in the morn and liquid dew of youth</div>
                     <div class="line">Contagious blastments are most imminent.</div>
                     <div class="line">Be wary then; best safety lies in fear:</div>
                     <div class="line">Youth to itself rebels, though none else near.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall the effect of this good lesson keep,</div>
                     <div class="line">As watchman to my heart. But, good my brother,</div>
                     <div class="line">Do not, as some ungracious pastors do,</div>
                     <div class="line">Show me the steep and thorny way to heaven;</div>
                     <div class="line">Whiles, like a puff'd and reckless libertine,</div>
                     <div class="line">Himself the primrose path of dalliance treads,</div>
                     <div class="line">And recks not his own rede.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">O, fear me not.</div>
                     <div class="line">I stay too long: but here my father comes.</div>
                     <p>Enter POLONIUS</p>
                     <div class="line">A double blessing is a double grace,</div>
                     <div class="line">Occasion smiles upon a second leave.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet here, Laertes! aboard, aboard, for shame!</div>
                     <div class="line">The wind sits in the shoulder of your sail,</div>
                     <div class="line">And you are stay'd for. There; my blessing with thee!</div>
                     <div class="line">And these few precepts in thy memory</div>
                     <div class="line">See thou character. Give thy thoughts no tongue,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor any unproportioned thought his act.</div>
                     <div class="line">Be thou familiar, but by no means vulgar.</div>
                     <div class="line">Those friends thou hast, and their adoption tried,</div>
                     <div class="line">Grapple them to thy soul with hoops of steel;</div>
                     <div class="line">But do not dull thy palm with entertainment</div>
                     <div class="line">Of each new-hatch'd, unfledged comrade. Beware</div>
                     <div class="line">Of entrance to a quarrel, but being in,</div>
                     <div class="line">Bear't that the opposed may beware of thee.</div>
                     <div class="line">Give every man thy ear, but few thy voice;</div>
                     <div class="line">Take each man's censure, but reserve thy judgment.</div>
                     <div class="line">Costly thy habit as thy purse can buy,</div>
                     <div class="line">But not express'd in fancy; rich, not gaudy;</div>
                     <div class="line">For the apparel oft proclaims the man,</div>
                     <div class="line">And they in France of the best rank and station</div>
                     <div class="line">Are of a most select and generous chief in that.</div>
                     <div class="line">Neither a borrower nor a lender be;</div>
                     <div class="line">For loan oft loses both itself and friend,</div>
                     <div class="line">And borrowing dulls the edge of husbandry.</div>
                     <div class="line">This above all: to thine ownself be true,</div>
                     <div class="line">And it must follow, as the night the day,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou canst not then be false to any man.</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell: my blessing season this in thee!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">Most humbly do I take my leave, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The time invites you; go; your servants tend.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
