                     <div class="line">Farewell, Ophelia; and remember well</div>
                     <div class="line">What I have said to you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis in my memory lock'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">And you yourself shall keep the key of it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What is't, Ophelia, be hath said to you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">So please you, something touching the Lord Hamlet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, well bethought:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis told me, he hath very oft of late</div>
                     <div class="line">Given private time to you; and you yourself</div>
                     <div class="line">Have of your audience been most free and bounteous:</div>
                     <div class="line">If it be so, as so 'tis put on me,</div>
                     <div class="line">And that in way of caution, I must tell you,</div>
                     <div class="line">You do not understand yourself so clearly</div>
                     <div class="line">As it behoves my daughter and your honour.</div>
                     <div class="line">What is between you? give me up the truth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">He hath, my lord, of late made many tenders</div>
                     <div class="line">Of his affection to me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Affection! pooh! you speak like a green girl,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unsifted in such perilous circumstance.</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you believe his tenders, as you call them?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I do not know, my lord, what I should think.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, I'll teach you: think yourself a baby;</div>
                     <div class="line">That you have ta'en these tenders for true pay,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which are not sterling. Tender yourself more dearly;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or--not to crack the wind of the poor phrase,</div>
                     <div class="line">Running it thus--you'll tender me a fool.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, he hath importuned me with love</div>
                     <div class="line">In honourable fashion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, fashion you may call it; go to, go to.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">And hath given countenance to his speech, my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">With almost all the holy vows of heaven.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, springes to catch woodcocks. I do know,</div>
                     <div class="line">When the blood burns, how prodigal the soul</div>
                     <div class="line">Lends the tongue vows: these blazes, daughter,</div>
                     <div class="line">Giving more light than heat, extinct in both,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even in their promise, as it is a-making,</div>
                     <div class="line">You must not take for fire. From this time</div>
                     <div class="line">Be somewhat scanter of your maiden presence;</div>
                     <div class="line">Set your entreatments at a higher rate</div>
                     <div class="line">Than a command to parley. For Lord Hamlet,</div>
                     <div class="line">Believe so much in him, that he is young</div>
                     <div class="line">And with a larger tether may he walk</div>
                     <div class="line">Than may be given you: in few, Ophelia,</div>
                     <div class="line">Do not believe his vows; for they are brokers,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not of that dye which their investments show,</div>
                     <div class="line">But mere implorators of unholy suits,</div>
                     <div class="line">Breathing like sanctified and pious bawds,</div>
                     <div class="line">The better to beguile. This is for all:</div>
                     <div class="line">I would not, in plain terms, from this time forth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Have you so slander any moment leisure,</div>
                     <div class="line">As to give words or talk with the Lord Hamlet.</div>
                     <div class="line">Look to't, I charge you: come your ways.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall obey, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  The platform.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter HAMLET, HORATIO, and MARCELLUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">The air bites shrewdly; it is very cold.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">It is a nipping and an eager air.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">What hour now?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I think it lacks of twelve.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">No, it is struck.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed? I heard it not: then it draws near the season</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherein the spirit held his wont to walk.</div>
                     <p>A flourish of trumpets, and ordnance shot off, within</p>
                     <div class="line">What does this mean, my lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">The king doth wake to-night and takes his rouse,</div>
                     <div class="line">Keeps wassail, and the swaggering up-spring reels;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, as he drains his draughts of Rhenish down,</div>
                     <div class="line">The kettle-drum and trumpet thus bray out</div>
                     <div class="line">The triumph of his pledge.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Is it a custom?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, marry, is't:</div>
                     <div class="line">But to my mind, though I am native here</div>
                     <div class="line">And to the manner born, it is a custom</div>
                     <div class="line">More honour'd in the breach than the observance.</div>
                     <div class="line">This heavy-headed revel east and west</div>
                     <div class="line">Makes us traduced and tax'd of other nations:</div>
                     <div class="line">They clepe us drunkards, and with swinish phrase</div>
                     <div class="line">Soil our addition; and indeed it takes</div>
                     <div class="line">From our achievements, though perform'd at height,</div>
                     <div class="line">The pith and marrow of our attribute.</div>
                     <div class="line">So, oft it chances in particular men,</div>
                     <div class="line">That for some vicious mole of nature in them,</div>
                     <div class="line">As, in their birth--wherein they are not guilty,</div>
                     <div class="line">Since nature cannot choose his origin--</div>
                     <div class="line">By the o'ergrowth of some complexion,</div>
                     <div class="line">Oft breaking down the pales and forts of reason,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or by some habit that too much o'er-leavens</div>
                     <div class="line">The form of plausive manners, that these men,</div>
                     <div class="line">Carrying, I say, the stamp of one defect,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being nature's livery, or fortune's star,--</div>
                     <div class="line">Their virtues else--be they as pure as grace,</div>
                     <div class="line">As infinite as man may undergo--</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall in the general censure take corruption</div>
                     <div class="line">From that particular fault: the dram of eale</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth all the noble substance of a doubt</div>
                     <div class="line">To his own scandal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Look, my lord, it comes!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Ghost</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Angels and ministers of grace defend us!</div>
                     <div class="line">Be thou a spirit of health or goblin damn'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Bring with thee airs from heaven or blasts from hell,</div>
                     <div class="line">Be thy intents wicked or charitable,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou comest in such a questionable shape</div>
                     <div class="line">That I will speak to thee: I'll call thee Hamlet,</div>
                     <div class="line">King, father, royal Dane: O, answer me!</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me not burst in ignorance; but tell</div>
                     <div class="line">Why thy canonized bones, hearsed in death,</div>
                     <div class="line">Have burst their cerements; why the sepulchre,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherein we saw thee quietly inurn'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath oped his ponderous and marble jaws,</div>
                     <div class="line">To cast thee up again. What may this mean,</div>
                     <div class="line">That thou, dead corse, again in complete steel</div>
                     <div class="line">Revisit'st thus the glimpses of the moon,</div>
                     <div class="line">Making night hideous; and we fools of nature</div>
                     <div class="line">So horridly to shake our disposition</div>
                     <div class="line">With thoughts beyond the reaches of our souls?</div>
                     <div class="line">Say, why is this? wherefore? what should we do?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Ghost beckons HAMLET</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">It beckons you to go away with it,</div>
                     <div class="line">As if it some impartment did desire</div>
                     <div class="line">To you alone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Look, with what courteous action</div>
                     <div class="line">It waves you to a more removed ground:</div>
                     <div class="line">But do not go with it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">No, by no means.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">It will not speak; then I will follow it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Do not, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, what should be the fear?</div>
                     <div class="line">I do not set my life in a pin's fee;</div>
                     <div class="line">And for my soul, what can it do to that,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being a thing immortal as itself?</div>
                     <div class="line">It waves me forth again: I'll follow it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">What if it tempt you toward the flood, my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or to the dreadful summit of the cliff</div>
                     <div class="line">That beetles o'er his base into the sea,</div>
                     <div class="line">And there assume some other horrible form,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which might deprive your sovereignty of reason</div>
                     <div class="line">And draw you into madness? think of it:</div>
                     <div class="line">The very place puts toys of desperation,</div>
                     <div class="line">Without more motive, into every brain</div>
                     <div class="line">That looks so many fathoms to the sea</div>
                     <div class="line">And hears it roar beneath.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">It waves me still.</div>
                     <div class="line">Go on; I'll follow thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">You shall not go, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold off your hands.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Be ruled; you shall not go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">My fate cries out,</div>
                     <div class="line">And makes each petty artery in this body</div>
                     <div class="line">As hardy as the Nemean lion's nerve.</div>
                     <div class="line">Still am I call'd. Unhand me, gentlemen.</div>
                     <div class="line">By heaven, I'll make a ghost of him that lets me!</div>
                     <div class="line">I say, away! Go on; I'll follow thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt Ghost and HAMLET</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">He waxes desperate with imagination.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Let's follow; 'tis not fit thus to obey him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Have after. To what issue will this come?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Something is rotten in the state of Denmark.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Heaven will direct it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, let's follow him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.6">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>5. SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter GHOST and HAMLET</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Where wilt thou lead me? speak; I'll go no further.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Ghost</div>
                     <div class="line">Mark me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">I will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Ghost</div>
                     <div class="line">My hour is almost come,</div>
                     <div class="line">When I to sulphurous and tormenting flames</div>
                     <div class="line">Must render up myself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, poor ghost!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Ghost</div>
                     <div class="line">Pity me not, but lend thy serious hearing</div>
                     <div class="line">To what I shall unfold.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak; I am bound to hear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Ghost</div>
                     <div class="line">So art thou to revenge, when thou shalt hear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">What?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Ghost</div>
                     <div class="line">I am thy father's spirit,</div>
                     <div class="line">Doom'd for a certain term to walk the night,</div>
                     <div class="line">And for the day confined to fast in fires,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till the foul crimes done in my days of nature</div>
                     <div class="line">Are burnt and purged away. But that I am forbid</div>
                     <div class="line">To tell the secrets of my prison-house,</div>
                     <div class="line">I could a tale unfold whose lightest word</div>
                     <div class="line">Would harrow up thy soul, freeze thy young blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Make thy two eyes, like stars, start from their spheres,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy knotted and combined locks to part</div>
                     <div class="line">And each particular hair to stand on end,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like quills upon the fretful porpentine:</div>
                     <div class="line">But this eternal blazon must not be</div>
                     <div class="line">To ears of flesh and blood. List, list, O, list!</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou didst ever thy dear father love--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">O God!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Ghost</div>
                     <div class="line">Revenge his foul and most unnatural murder.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Murder!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Ghost</div>
                     <div class="line">Murder most foul, as in the best it is;</div>
                     <div class="line">But this most foul, strange and unnatural.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Haste me to know't, that I, with wings as swift</div>
                     <div class="line">As meditation or the thoughts of love,</div>
                     <div class="line">May sweep to my revenge.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Ghost</div>
                     <div class="line">I find thee apt;</div>
                     <div class="line">And duller shouldst thou be than the fat weed</div>
                     <div class="line">That roots itself in ease on Lethe wharf,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wouldst thou not stir in this. Now, Hamlet, hear:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis given out that, sleeping in my orchard,</div>
                     <div class="line">A serpent stung me; so the whole ear of Denmark</div>
                     <div class="line">Is by a forged process of my death</div>
                     <div class="line">Rankly abused: but know, thou noble youth,</div>
                     <div class="line">The serpent that did sting thy father's life</div>
                     <div class="line">Now wears his crown.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">O my prophetic soul! My uncle!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Ghost</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, that incestuous, that adulterate beast,</div>
                     <div class="line">With witchcraft of his wit, with traitorous gifts,--</div>
                     <div class="line">O wicked wit and gifts, that have the power</div>
                     <div class="line">So to seduce!--won to his shameful lust</div>
                     <div class="line">The will of my most seeming-virtuous queen:</div>
                     <div class="line">O Hamlet, what a falling-off was there!</div>
                     <div class="line">From me, whose love was of that dignity</div>
                     <div class="line">That it went hand in hand even with the vow</div>
                     <div class="line">I made to her in marriage, and to decline</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon a wretch whose natural gifts were poor</div>
                     <div class="line">To those of mine!</div>
                     <div class="line">But virtue, as it never will be moved,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though lewdness court it in a shape of heaven,</div>
                     <div class="line">So lust, though to a radiant angel link'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Will sate itself in a celestial bed,</div>
                     <div class="line">And prey on garbage.</div>
                     <div class="line">But, soft! methinks I scent the morning air;</div>
                     <div class="line">Brief let me be. Sleeping within my orchard,</div>
                     <div class="line">My custom always of the afternoon,</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon my secure hour thy uncle stole,</div>
                     <div class="line">With juice of cursed hebenon in a vial,</div>
                     <div class="line">And in the porches of my ears did pour</div>
                     <div class="line">The leperous distilment; whose effect</div>
                     <div class="line">Holds such an enmity with blood of man</div>
                     <div class="line">That swift as quicksilver it courses through</div>
                     <div class="line">The natural gates and alleys of the body,</div>
                     <div class="line">And with a sudden vigour doth posset</div>
                     <div class="line">And curd, like eager droppings into milk,</div>
                     <div class="line">The thin and wholesome blood: so did it mine;</div>
                     <div class="line">And a most instant tetter bark'd about,</div>
                     <div class="line">Most lazar-like, with vile and loathsome crust,</div>
                     <div class="line">All my smooth body.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus was I, sleeping, by a brother's hand</div>
                     <div class="line">Of life, of crown, of queen, at once dispatch'd:</div>
                     <div class="line">Cut off even in the blossoms of my sin,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unhousel'd, disappointed, unanel'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">No reckoning made, but sent to my account</div>
                     <div class="line">With all my imperfections on my head:</div>
                     <div class="line">O, horrible! O, horrible! most horrible!</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou hast nature in thee, bear it not;</div>
                     <div class="line">Let not the royal bed of Denmark be</div>
                     <div class="line">A couch for luxury and damned incest.</div>
                     <div class="line">But, howsoever thou pursuest this act,</div>
                     <div class="line">Taint not thy mind, nor let thy soul contrive</div>
                     <div class="line">Against thy mother aught: leave her to heaven</div>
                     <div class="line">And to those thorns that in her bosom lodge,</div>
                     <div class="line">To prick and sting her. Fare thee well at once!</div>
                     <div class="line">The glow-worm shows the matin to be near,</div>
                     <div class="line">And 'gins to pale his uneffectual fire:</div>
                     <div class="line">Adieu, adieu! Hamlet, remember me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">O all you host of heaven! O earth! what else?</div>
                     <div class="line">And shall I couple hell? O, fie! Hold, hold, my heart;</div>
                     <div class="line">And you, my sinews, grow not instant old,</div>
                     <div class="line">But bear me stiffly up. Remember thee!</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, thou poor ghost, while memory holds a seat</div>
                     <div class="line">In this distracted globe. Remember thee!</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, from the table of my memory</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll wipe away all trivial fond records,</div>
                     <div class="line">All saws of books, all forms, all pressures past,</div>
                     <div class="line">That youth and observation copied there;</div>
                     <div class="line">And thy commandment all alone shall live</div>
                     <div class="line">Within the book and volume of my brain,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unmix'd with baser matter: yes, by heaven!</div>
                     <div class="line">O most pernicious woman!</div>
                     <div class="line">O villain, villain, smiling, damned villain!</div>
                     <div class="line">My tables,--meet it is I set it down,</div>
                     <div class="line">That one may smile, and smile, and be a villain;</div>
                     <div class="line">At least I'm sure it may be so in Denmark:</div>
                     <p>Writing</p>
                     <div class="line">So, uncle, there you are. Now to my word;</div>
                     <div class="line">It is 'Adieu, adieu! remember me.'</div>
                     <div class="line">I have sworn 't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>  My lord, my lord,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span> Lord Hamlet,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span> Heaven secure him!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">So be it!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>  Hillo, ho, ho, my lord!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Hillo, ho, ho, boy! come, bird, come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter HORATIO and MARCELLUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">How is't, my noble lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">What news, my lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">O, wonderful!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Good my lord, tell it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">No; you'll reveal it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Not I, my lord, by heaven.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor I, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">How say you, then; would heart of man once think it?</div>
                     <div class="line">But you'll be secret?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, by heaven, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">There's ne'er a villain dwelling in all Denmark</div>
                     <div class="line">But he's an arrant knave.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">There needs no ghost, my lord, come from the grave</div>
                     <div class="line">To tell us this.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, right; you are i' the right;</div>
                     <div class="line">And so, without more circumstance at all,</div>
                     <div class="line">I hold it fit that we shake hands and part:</div>
                     <div class="line">You, as your business and desire shall point you;</div>
                     <div class="line">For every man has business and desire,</div>
                     <div class="line">Such as it is; and for mine own poor part,</div>
                     <div class="line">Look you, I'll go pray.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">These are but wild and whirling words, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">I'm sorry they offend you, heartily;</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, 'faith heartily.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">There's no offence, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, by Saint Patrick, but there is, Horatio,</div>
                     <div class="line">And much offence too. Touching this vision here,</div>
                     <div class="line">It is an honest ghost, that let me tell you:</div>
                     <div class="line">For your desire to know what is between us,</div>
                     <div class="line">O'ermaster 't as you may. And now, good friends,</div>
                     <div class="line">As you are friends, scholars and soldiers,</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me one poor request.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">What is't, my lord? we will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Never make known what you have seen to-night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, we will not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, but swear't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">In faith,</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, not I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor I, my lord, in faith.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon my sword.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCELLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">We have sworn, my lord, already.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed, upon my sword, indeed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Ghost</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Beneath</span>  Swear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, ha, boy! say'st thou so? art thou there,</div>
                     <div class="line">truepenny?</div>
                     <div class="line">Come on--you hear this fellow in the cellarage--</div>
                     <div class="line">Consent to swear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Propose the oath, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Never to speak of this that you have seen,</div>
                     <div class="line">Swear by my sword.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Ghost</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Beneath</span>  Swear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Hic et ubique? then we'll shift our ground.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come hither, gentlemen,</div>
                     <div class="line">And lay your hands again upon my sword:</div>
                     <div class="line">Never to speak of this that you have heard,</div>
                     <div class="line">Swear by my sword.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Ghost</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Beneath</span>  Swear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Well said, old mole! canst work i' the earth so fast?</div>
                     <div class="line">A worthy pioner! Once more remove, good friends.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">O day and night, but this is wondrous strange!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore as a stranger give it welcome.</div>
                     <div class="line">There are more things in heaven and earth, Horatio,</div>
                     <div class="line">Than are dreamt of in your philosophy. But come;</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, as before, never, so help you mercy,</div>
                     <div class="line">How strange or odd soe'er I bear myself,</div>
                     <div class="line">As I perchance hereafter shall think meet</div>
                     <div class="line">To put an antic disposition on,</div>
                     <div class="line">That you, at such times seeing me, never shall,</div>
                     <div class="line">With arms encumber'd thus, or this headshake,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or by pronouncing of some doubtful phrase,</div>
                     <div class="line">As 'Well, well, we know,' or 'We could, an if we would,'</div>
                     <div class="line">Or 'If we list to speak,' or 'There be, an if they might,'</div>
                     <div class="line">Or such ambiguous giving out, to note</div>
                     <div class="line">That you know aught of me: this not to do,</div>
                     <div class="line">So grace and mercy at your most need help you, Swear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Ghost</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Beneath</span>  Swear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Rest, rest, perturbed spirit!</div>
                     <p>They swear</p>
                     <div class="line">So, gentlemen,</div>
                     <div class="line">With all my love I do commend me to you:</div>
                     <div class="line">And what so poor a man as Hamlet is</div>
                     <div class="line">May do, to express his love and friending to you,</div>
                     <div class="line">God willing, shall not lack. Let us go in together;</div>
                     <div class="line">And still your fingers on your lips, I pray.</div>
                     <div class="line">The time is out of joint: O cursed spite,</div>
                     <div class="line">That ever I was born to set it right!</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, come, let's go together.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.4">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 2. ACT II</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.2">1. SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.3">2. SCENE II.  A room in the castle.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter POLONIUS and REYNALDO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Give him this money and these notes, Reynaldo.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REYNALDO</div>
                     <div class="line">I will, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">You shall do marvellous wisely, good Reynaldo,</div>
                     <div class="line">Before you visit him, to make inquire</div>
                     <div class="line">Of his behavior.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REYNALDO</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, I did intend it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, well said; very well said. Look you, sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">Inquire me first what Danskers are in Paris;</div>
                     <div class="line">And how, and who, what means, and where they keep,</div>
                     <div class="line">What company, at what expense; and finding</div>
                     <div class="line">By this encompassment and drift of question</div>
                     <div class="line">That they do know my son, come you more nearer</div>
                     <div class="line">Than your particular demands will touch it:</div>
                     <div class="line">Take you, as 'twere, some distant knowledge of him;</div>
                     <div class="line">As thus, 'I know his father and his friends,</div>
                     <div class="line">And in part him: ' do you mark this, Reynaldo?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REYNALDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, very well, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">'And in part him; but' you may say 'not well:</div>
                     <div class="line">But, if't be he I mean, he's very wild;</div>
                     <div class="line">Addicted so and so:' and there put on him</div>
                     <div class="line">What forgeries you please; marry, none so rank</div>
                     <div class="line">As may dishonour him; take heed of that;</div>
                     <div class="line">But, sir, such wanton, wild and usual slips</div>
                     <div class="line">As are companions noted and most known</div>
                     <div class="line">To youth and liberty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REYNALDO</div>
                     <div class="line">As gaming, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, or drinking, fencing, swearing, quarrelling,</div>
                     <div class="line">Drabbing: you may go so far.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REYNALDO</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, that would dishonour him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">'Faith, no; as you may season it in the charge</div>
                     <div class="line">You must not put another scandal on him,</div>
                     <div class="line">That he is open to incontinency;</div>
                     <div class="line">That's not my meaning: but breathe his faults so quaintly</div>
                     <div class="line">That they may seem the taints of liberty,</div>
                     <div class="line">The flash and outbreak of a fiery mind,</div>
                     <div class="line">A savageness in unreclaimed blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of general assault.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REYNALDO</div>
                     <div class="line">But, my good lord,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherefore should you do this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REYNALDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">I would know that.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, sir, here's my drift;</div>
                     <div class="line">And I believe, it is a fetch of wit:</div>
                     <div class="line">You laying these slight sullies on my son,</div>
                     <div class="line">As 'twere a thing a little soil'd i' the working, Mark you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your party in converse, him you would sound,</div>
                     <div class="line">Having ever seen in the prenominate crimes</div>
                     <div class="line">The youth you breathe of guilty, be assured</div>
                     <div class="line">He closes with you in this consequence;</div>
                     <div class="line">'Good sir,' or so, or 'friend,' or 'gentleman,'</div>
                     <div class="line">According to the phrase or the addition</div>
                     <div class="line">Of man and country.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REYNALDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Very good, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">And then, sir, does he this--he does--what was I</div>
                     <div class="line">about to say? By the mass, I was about to say</div>
                     <div class="line">something: where did I leave?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REYNALDO</div>
                     <div class="line">At 'closes in the consequence,' at 'friend or so,'</div>
                     <div class="line">and 'gentleman.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">At 'closes in the consequence,' ay, marry;</div>
                     <div class="line">He closes thus: 'I know the gentleman;</div>
                     <div class="line">I saw him yesterday, or t' other day,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or then, or then; with such, or such; and, as you say,</div>
                     <div class="line">There was a' gaming; there o'ertook in's rouse;</div>
                     <div class="line">There falling out at tennis:' or perchance,</div>
                     <div class="line">'I saw him enter such a house of sale,'</div>
                     <div class="line">Videlicet, a brothel, or so forth.</div>
                     <div class="line">See you now;</div>
                     <div class="line">Your bait of falsehood takes this carp of truth:</div>
                     <div class="line">And thus do we of wisdom and of reach,</div>
                     <div class="line">With windlasses and with assays of bias,</div>
                     <div class="line">By indirections find directions out:</div>
                     <div class="line">So by my former lecture and advice,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall you my son. You have me, have you not?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REYNALDO</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, I have.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">God be wi' you; fare you well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REYNALDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Good my lord!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Observe his inclination in yourself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REYNALDO</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">And let him ply his music.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REYNALDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell!</div>
                     <p>Exit REYNALDO</p>
                     <p>Enter OPHELIA</p>
                     <div class="line">How now, Ophelia! what's the matter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">O, my lord, my lord, I have been so affrighted!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">With what, i' the name of God?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, as I was sewing in my closet,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord Hamlet, with his doublet all unbraced;</div>
                     <div class="line">No hat upon his head; his stockings foul'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Ungarter'd, and down-gyved to his ancle;</div>
                     <div class="line">Pale as his shirt; his knees knocking each other;</div>
                     <div class="line">And with a look so piteous in purport</div>
                     <div class="line">As if he had been loosed out of hell</div>
                     <div class="line">To speak of horrors,--he comes before me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Mad for thy love?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, I do not know;</div>
                     <div class="line">But truly, I do fear it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What said he?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">He took me by the wrist and held me hard;</div>
                     <div class="line">Then goes he to the length of all his arm;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, with his other hand thus o'er his brow,</div>
                     <div class="line">He falls to such perusal of my face</div>
                     <div class="line">As he would draw it. Long stay'd he so;</div>
                     <div class="line">At last, a little shaking of mine arm</div>
                     <div class="line">And thrice his head thus waving up and down,</div>
                     <div class="line">He raised a sigh so piteous and profound</div>
                     <div class="line">As it did seem to shatter all his bulk</div>
                     <div class="line">And end his being: that done, he lets me go:</div>
                     <div class="line">And, with his head over his shoulder turn'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">He seem'd to find his way without his eyes;</div>
                     <div class="line">For out o' doors he went without their helps,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, to the last, bended their light on me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, go with me: I will go seek the king.</div>
                     <div class="line">This is the very ecstasy of love,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose violent property fordoes itself</div>
                     <div class="line">And leads the will to desperate undertakings</div>
                     <div class="line">As oft as any passion under heaven</div>
                     <div class="line">That does afflict our natures. I am sorry.</div>
                     <div class="line">What, have you given him any hard words of late?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">No, my good lord, but, as you did command,</div>
                     <div class="line">I did repel his fetters and denied</div>
                     <div class="line">His access to me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">That hath made him mad.</div>
                     <div class="line">I am sorry that with better heed and judgment</div>
                     <div class="line">I had not quoted him: I fear'd he did but trifle,</div>
                     <div class="line">And meant to wreck thee; but, beshrew my jealousy!</div>
                     <div class="line">By heaven, it is as proper to our age</div>
                     <div class="line">To cast beyond ourselves in our opinions</div>
                     <div class="line">As it is common for the younger sort</div>
                     <div class="line">To lack discretion. Come, go we to the king:</div>
                     <div class="line">This must be known; which, being kept close, might</div>
                     <div class="line">move</div>
                     <div class="line">More grief to hide than hate to utter love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  A room in the castle.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter KING CLAUDIUS, QUEEN GERTRUDE, ROSENCRANTZ,
GUILDENSTERN, and Attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Welcome, dear Rosencrantz and Guildenstern!</div>
                     <div class="line">Moreover that we much did long to see you,</div>
                     <div class="line">The need we have to use you did provoke</div>
                     <div class="line">Our hasty sending. Something have you heard</div>
                     <div class="line">Of Hamlet's transformation; so call it,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sith nor the exterior nor the inward man</div>
                     <div class="line">Resembles that it was. What it should be,</div>
                     <div class="line">More than his father's death, that thus hath put him</div>
                     <div class="line">So much from the understanding of himself,</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot dream of: I entreat you both,</div>
                     <div class="line">That, being of so young days brought up with him,</div>
                     <div class="line">And sith so neighbour'd to his youth and havior,</div>
                     <div class="line">That you vouchsafe your rest here in our court</div>
                     <div class="line">Some little time: so by your companies</div>
                     <div class="line">To draw him on to pleasures, and to gather,</div>
                     <div class="line">So much as from occasion you may glean,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whether aught, to us unknown, afflicts him thus,</div>
                     <div class="line">That, open'd, lies within our remedy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">Good gentlemen, he hath much talk'd of you;</div>
                     <div class="line">And sure I am two men there are not living</div>
                     <div class="line">To whom he more adheres. If it will please you</div>
                     <div class="line">To show us so much gentry and good will</div>
                     <div class="line">As to expend your time with us awhile,</div>
                     <div class="line">For the supply and profit of our hope,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your visitation shall receive such thanks</div>
                     <div class="line">As fits a king's remembrance.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">Both your majesties</div>
                     <div class="line">Might, by the sovereign power you have of us,</div>
                     <div class="line">Put your dread pleasures more into command</div>
                     <div class="line">Than to entreaty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                     <div class="line">But we both obey,</div>
                     <div class="line">And here give up ourselves, in the full bent</div>
                     <div class="line">To lay our service freely at your feet,</div>
                     <div class="line">To be commanded.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Thanks, Rosencrantz and gentle Guildenstern.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">Thanks, Guildenstern and gentle Rosencrantz:</div>
                     <div class="line">And I beseech you instantly to visit</div>
                     <div class="line">My too much changed son. Go, some of you,</div>
                     <div class="line">And bring these gentlemen where Hamlet is.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                     <div class="line">Heavens make our presence and our practises</div>
                     <div class="line">Pleasant and helpful to him!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, amen!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt ROSENCRANTZ, GUILDENSTERN, and some
Attendants</p>
               <p>Enter POLONIUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The ambassadors from Norway, my good lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">Are joyfully return'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou still hast been the father of good news.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Have I, my lord? I assure my good liege,</div>
                     <div class="line">I hold my duty, as I hold my soul,</div>
                     <div class="line">Both to my God and to my gracious king:</div>
                     <div class="line">And I do think, or else this brain of mine</div>
                     <div class="line">Hunts not the trail of policy so sure</div>
                     <div class="line">As it hath used to do, that I have found</div>
                     <div class="line">The very cause of Hamlet's lunacy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">O, speak of that; that do I long to hear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Give first admittance to the ambassadors;</div>
                     <div class="line">My news shall be the fruit to that great feast.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Thyself do grace to them, and bring them in.</div>
                     <p>Exit POLONIUS</p>
                     <div class="line">He tells me, my dear Gertrude, he hath found</div>
                     <div class="line">The head and source of all your son's distemper.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">I doubt it is no other but the main;</div>
                     <div class="line">His father's death, and our o'erhasty marriage.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, we shall sift him.</div>
                     <p>Re-enter POLONIUS, with VOLTIMAND and CORNELIUS</p>
                     <div class="line">Welcome, my good friends!</div>
                     <div class="line">Say, Voltimand, what from our brother Norway?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLTIMAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Most fair return of greetings and desires.</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon our first, he sent out to suppress</div>
                     <div class="line">His nephew's levies; which to him appear'd</div>
                     <div class="line">To be a preparation 'gainst the Polack;</div>
                     <div class="line">But, better look'd into, he truly found</div>
                     <div class="line">It was against your highness: whereat grieved,</div>
                     <div class="line">That so his sickness, age and impotence</div>
                     <div class="line">Was falsely borne in hand, sends out arrests</div>
                     <div class="line">On Fortinbras; which he, in brief, obeys;</div>
                     <div class="line">Receives rebuke from Norway, and in fine</div>
                     <div class="line">Makes vow before his uncle never more</div>
                     <div class="line">To give the assay of arms against your majesty.</div>
                     <div class="line">Whereon old Norway, overcome with joy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Gives him three thousand crowns in annual fee,</div>
