                     <div class="line">And his commission to employ those soldiers,</div>
                     <div class="line">So levied as before, against the Polack:</div>
                     <div class="line">With an entreaty, herein further shown,</div>
                     <p>Giving a paper</p>
                     <div class="line">That it might please you to give quiet pass</div>
                     <div class="line">Through your dominions for this enterprise,</div>
                     <div class="line">On such regards of safety and allowance</div>
                     <div class="line">As therein are set down.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">It likes us well;</div>
                     <div class="line">And at our more consider'd time well read,</div>
                     <div class="line">Answer, and think upon this business.</div>
                     <div class="line">Meantime we thank you for your well-took labour:</div>
                     <div class="line">Go to your rest; at night we'll feast together:</div>
                     <div class="line">Most welcome home!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt VOLTIMAND and CORNELIUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">This business is well ended.</div>
                     <div class="line">My liege, and madam, to expostulate</div>
                     <div class="line">What majesty should be, what duty is,</div>
                     <div class="line">Why day is day, night night, and time is time,</div>
                     <div class="line">Were nothing but to waste night, day and time.</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore, since brevity is the soul of wit,</div>
                     <div class="line">And tediousness the limbs and outward flourishes,</div>
                     <div class="line">I will be brief: your noble son is mad:</div>
                     <div class="line">Mad call I it; for, to define true madness,</div>
                     <div class="line">What is't but to be nothing else but mad?</div>
                     <div class="line">But let that go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">More matter, with less art.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, I swear I use no art at all.</div>
                     <div class="line">That he is mad, 'tis true: 'tis true 'tis pity;</div>
                     <div class="line">And pity 'tis 'tis true: a foolish figure;</div>
                     <div class="line">But farewell it, for I will use no art.</div>
                     <div class="line">Mad let us grant him, then: and now remains</div>
                     <div class="line">That we find out the cause of this effect,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or rather say, the cause of this defect,</div>
                     <div class="line">For this effect defective comes by cause:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus it remains, and the remainder thus. Perpend.</div>
                     <div class="line">I have a daughter--have while she is mine--</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, in her duty and obedience, mark,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath given me this: now gather, and surmise.</div>
                     <p>Reads</p>
                     <div class="line">'To the celestial and my soul's idol, the most</div>
                     <div class="line">beautified Ophelia,'--</div>
                     <div class="line">That's an ill phrase, a vile phrase; 'beautified' is</div>
                     <div class="line">a vile phrase: but you shall hear. Thus:</div>
                     <p>Reads</p>
                     <div class="line">'In her excellent white bosom, these, &c.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">Came this from Hamlet to her?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Good madam, stay awhile; I will be faithful.</div>
                     <p>Reads</p>
                     <div class="line">'Doubt thou the stars are fire;</div>
                     <div class="line">Doubt that the sun doth move;</div>
                     <div class="line">Doubt truth to be a liar;</div>
                     <div class="line">But never doubt I love.</div>
                     <div class="line">'O dear Ophelia, I am ill at these numbers;</div>
                     <div class="line">I have not art to reckon my groans: but that</div>
                     <div class="line">I love thee best, O most best, believe it. Adieu.</div>
                     <div class="line">'Thine evermore most dear lady, whilst</div>
                     <div class="line">this machine is to him, HAMLET.'</div>
                     <div class="line">This, in obedience, hath my daughter shown me,</div>
                     <div class="line">And more above, hath his solicitings,</div>
                     <div class="line">As they fell out by time, by means and place,</div>
                     <div class="line">All given to mine ear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">But how hath she</div>
                     <div class="line">Received his love?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What do you think of me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">As of a man faithful and honourable.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I would fain prove so. But what might you think,</div>
                     <div class="line">When I had seen this hot love on the wing--</div>
                     <div class="line">As I perceived it, I must tell you that,</div>
                     <div class="line">Before my daughter told me--what might you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or my dear majesty your queen here, think,</div>
                     <div class="line">If I had play'd the desk or table-book,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or given my heart a winking, mute and dumb,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or look'd upon this love with idle sight;</div>
                     <div class="line">What might you think? No, I went round to work,</div>
                     <div class="line">And my young mistress thus I did bespeak:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Lord Hamlet is a prince, out of thy star;</div>
                     <div class="line">This must not be:' and then I precepts gave her,</div>
                     <div class="line">That she should lock herself from his resort,</div>
                     <div class="line">Admit no messengers, receive no tokens.</div>
                     <div class="line">Which done, she took the fruits of my advice;</div>
                     <div class="line">And he, repulsed--a short tale to make--</div>
                     <div class="line">Fell into a sadness, then into a fast,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thence to a watch, thence into a weakness,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thence to a lightness, and, by this declension,</div>
                     <div class="line">Into the madness wherein now he raves,</div>
                     <div class="line">And all we mourn for.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you think 'tis this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">It may be, very likely.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath there been such a time--I'd fain know that--</div>
                     <div class="line">That I have positively said 'Tis so,'</div>
                     <div class="line">When it proved otherwise?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Not that I know.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Pointing to his head and shoulder</span>
                     </div>
                     <div class="line">Take this from this, if this be otherwise:</div>
                     <div class="line">If circumstances lead me, I will find</div>
                     <div class="line">Where truth is hid, though it were hid indeed</div>
                     <div class="line">Within the centre.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">How may we try it further?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">You know, sometimes he walks four hours together</div>
                     <div class="line">Here in the lobby.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">So he does indeed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">At such a time I'll loose my daughter to him:</div>
                     <div class="line">Be you and I behind an arras then;</div>
                     <div class="line">Mark the encounter: if he love her not</div>
                     <div class="line">And be not from his reason fall'n thereon,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me be no assistant for a state,</div>
                     <div class="line">But keep a farm and carters.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">We will try it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">But, look, where sadly the poor wretch comes reading.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Away, I do beseech you, both away:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll board him presently.</div>
                     <p>Exeunt KING CLAUDIUS, QUEEN GERTRUDE, and
Attendants</p>
                     <p>Enter HAMLET, reading</p>
                     <div class="line">O, give me leave:</div>
                     <div class="line">How does my good Lord Hamlet?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, God-a-mercy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you know me, my lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Excellent well; you are a fishmonger.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Not I, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Then I would you were so honest a man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Honest, my lord!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, sir; to be honest, as this world goes, is to be</div>
                     <div class="line">one man picked out of ten thousand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">That's very true, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">For if the sun breed maggots in a dead dog, being a</div>
                     <div class="line">god kissing carrion,--Have you a daughter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I have, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Let her not walk i' the sun: conception is a</div>
                     <div class="line">blessing: but not as your daughter may conceive.</div>
                     <div class="line">Friend, look to 't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  How say you by that? Still harping on my</div>
                     <div class="line">daughter: yet he knew me not at first; he said I</div>
                     <div class="line">was a fishmonger: he is far gone, far gone: and</div>
                     <div class="line">truly in my youth I suffered much extremity for</div>
                     <div class="line">love; very near this. I'll speak to him again.</div>
                     <div class="line">What do you read, my lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Words, words, words.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What is the matter, my lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Between who?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I mean, the matter that you read, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Slanders, sir: for the satirical rogue says here</div>
                     <div class="line">that old men have grey beards, that their faces are</div>
                     <div class="line">wrinkled, their eyes purging thick amber and</div>
                     <div class="line">plum-tree gum and that they have a plentiful lack of</div>
                     <div class="line">wit, together with most weak hams: all which, sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">though I most powerfully and potently believe, yet</div>
                     <div class="line">I hold it not honesty to have it thus set down, for</div>
                     <div class="line">yourself, sir, should be old as I am, if like a crab</div>
                     <div class="line">you could go backward.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  Though this be madness, yet there is method</div>
                     <div class="line">in 't. Will you walk out of the air, my lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Into my grave.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed, that is out o' the air.</div>
                     <p>Aside</p>
                     <div class="line">How pregnant sometimes his replies are! a happiness</div>
                     <div class="line">that often madness hits on, which reason and sanity</div>
                     <div class="line">could not so prosperously be delivered of. I will</div>
                     <div class="line">leave him, and suddenly contrive the means of</div>
                     <div class="line">meeting between him and my daughter.--My honourable</div>
                     <div class="line">lord, I will most humbly take my leave of you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">You cannot, sir, take from me any thing that I will</div>
                     <div class="line">more willingly part withal: except my life, except</div>
                     <div class="line">my life, except my life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Fare you well, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">These tedious old fools!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">You go to seek the Lord Hamlet; there he is.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>To POLONIUS</span>  God save you, sir!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit POLONIUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                     <div class="line">My honoured lord!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">My most dear lord!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">My excellent good friends! How dost thou,</div>
                     <div class="line">Guildenstern? Ah, Rosencrantz! Good lads, how do ye both?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">As the indifferent children of the earth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                     <div class="line">Happy, in that we are not over-happy;</div>
                     <div class="line">On fortune's cap we are not the very button.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor the soles of her shoe?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">Neither, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Then you live about her waist, or in the middle of</div>
                     <div class="line">her favours?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                     <div class="line">'Faith, her privates we.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">In the secret parts of fortune? O, most true; she</div>
                     <div class="line">is a strumpet. What's the news?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">None, my lord, but that the world's grown honest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Then is doomsday near: but your news is not true.</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me question more in particular: what have you,</div>
                     <div class="line">my good friends, deserved at the hands of fortune,</div>
                     <div class="line">that she sends you to prison hither?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                     <div class="line">Prison, my lord!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Denmark's a prison.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">Then is the world one.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">A goodly one; in which there are many confines,</div>
                     <div class="line">wards and dungeons, Denmark being one o' the worst.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">We think not so, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then, 'tis none to you; for there is nothing</div>
                     <div class="line">either good or bad, but thinking makes it so: to me</div>
                     <div class="line">it is a prison.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">Why then, your ambition makes it one; 'tis too</div>
                     <div class="line">narrow for your mind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">O God, I could be bounded in a nut shell and count</div>
                     <div class="line">myself a king of infinite space, were it not that I</div>
                     <div class="line">have bad dreams.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                     <div class="line">Which dreams indeed are ambition, for the very</div>
                     <div class="line">substance of the ambitious is merely the shadow of a dream.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">A dream itself is but a shadow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">Truly, and I hold ambition of so airy and light a</div>
                     <div class="line">quality that it is but a shadow's shadow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Then are our beggars bodies, and our monarchs and</div>
                     <div class="line">outstretched heroes the beggars' shadows. Shall we</div>
                     <div class="line">to the court? for, by my fay, I cannot reason.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll wait upon you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">No such matter: I will not sort you with the rest</div>
                     <div class="line">of my servants, for, to speak to you like an honest</div>
                     <div class="line">man, I am most dreadfully attended. But, in the</div>
                     <div class="line">beaten way of friendship, what make you at Elsinore?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">To visit you, my lord; no other occasion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Beggar that I am, I am even poor in thanks; but I</div>
                     <div class="line">thank you: and sure, dear friends, my thanks are</div>
                     <div class="line">too dear a halfpenny. Were you not sent for? Is it</div>
                     <div class="line">your own inclining? Is it a free visitation? Come,</div>
                     <div class="line">deal justly with me: come, come; nay, speak.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                     <div class="line">What should we say, my lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, any thing, but to the purpose. You were sent</div>
                     <div class="line">for; and there is a kind of confession in your looks</div>
                     <div class="line">which your modesties have not craft enough to colour:</div>
                     <div class="line">I know the good king and queen have sent for you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">To what end, my lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">That you must teach me. But let me conjure you, by</div>
                     <div class="line">the rights of our fellowship, by the consonancy of</div>
                     <div class="line">our youth, by the obligation of our ever-preserved</div>
                     <div class="line">love, and by what more dear a better proposer could</div>
                     <div class="line">charge you withal, be even and direct with me,</div>
                     <div class="line">whether you were sent for, or no?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside to GUILDENSTERN</span>  What say you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  Nay, then, I have an eye of you.--If you</div>
                     <div class="line">love me, hold not off.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, we were sent for.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">I will tell you why; so shall my anticipation</div>
                     <div class="line">prevent your discovery, and your secrecy to the king</div>
                     <div class="line">and queen moult no feather. I have of late--but</div>
                     <div class="line">wherefore I know not--lost all my mirth, forgone all</div>
                     <div class="line">custom of exercises; and indeed it goes so heavily</div>
                     <div class="line">with my disposition that this goodly frame, the</div>
                     <div class="line">earth, seems to me a sterile promontory, this most</div>
                     <div class="line">excellent canopy, the air, look you, this brave</div>
                     <div class="line">o'erhanging firmament, this majestical roof fretted</div>
                     <div class="line">with golden fire, why, it appears no other thing to</div>
                     <div class="line">me than a foul and pestilent congregation of vapours.</div>
                     <div class="line">What a piece of work is a man! how noble in reason!</div>
                     <div class="line">how infinite in faculty! in form and moving how</div>
                     <div class="line">express and admirable! in action how like an angel!</div>
                     <div class="line">in apprehension how like a god! the beauty of the</div>
                     <div class="line">world! the paragon of animals! And yet, to me,</div>
                     <div class="line">what is this quintessence of dust? man delights not</div>
                     <div class="line">me: no, nor woman neither, though by your smiling</div>
                     <div class="line">you seem to say so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, there was no such stuff in my thoughts.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Why did you laugh then, when I said 'man delights not me'?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">To think, my lord, if you delight not in man, what</div>
                     <div class="line">lenten entertainment the players shall receive from</div>
                     <div class="line">you: we coted them on the way; and hither are they</div>
                     <div class="line">coming, to offer you service.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">He that plays the king shall be welcome; his majesty</div>
                     <div class="line">shall have tribute of me; the adventurous knight</div>
                     <div class="line">shall use his foil and target; the lover shall not</div>
                     <div class="line">sigh gratis; the humourous man shall end his part</div>
                     <div class="line">in peace; the clown shall make those laugh whose</div>
                     <div class="line">lungs are tickled o' the sere; and the lady shall</div>
                     <div class="line">say her mind freely, or the blank verse shall halt</div>
                     <div class="line">for't. What players are they?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">Even those you were wont to take delight in, the</div>
                     <div class="line">tragedians of the city.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">How chances it they travel? their residence, both</div>
                     <div class="line">in reputation and profit, was better both ways.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">I think their inhibition comes by the means of the</div>
                     <div class="line">late innovation.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Do they hold the same estimation they did when I was</div>
                     <div class="line">in the city? are they so followed?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">No, indeed, are they not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">How comes it? do they grow rusty?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, their endeavour keeps in the wonted pace: but</div>
                     <div class="line">there is, sir, an aery of children, little eyases,</div>
                     <div class="line">that cry out on the top of question, and are most</div>
                     <div class="line">tyrannically clapped for't: these are now the</div>
                     <div class="line">fashion, and so berattle the common stages--so they</div>
                     <div class="line">call them--that many wearing rapiers are afraid of</div>
                     <div class="line">goose-quills and dare scarce come thither.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">What, are they children? who maintains 'em? how are</div>
                     <div class="line">they escoted? Will they pursue the quality no</div>
                     <div class="line">longer than they can sing? will they not say</div>
                     <div class="line">afterwards, if they should grow themselves to common</div>
                     <div class="line">players--as it is most like, if their means are no</div>
                     <div class="line">better--their writers do them wrong, to make them</div>
                     <div class="line">exclaim against their own succession?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">'Faith, there has been much to do on both sides; and</div>
                     <div class="line">the nation holds it no sin to tarre them to</div>
                     <div class="line">controversy: there was, for a while, no money bid</div>
                     <div class="line">for argument, unless the poet and the player went to</div>
                     <div class="line">cuffs in the question.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Is't possible?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                     <div class="line">O, there has been much throwing about of brains.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Do the boys carry it away?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, that they do, my lord; Hercules and his load too.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">It is not very strange; for mine uncle is king of</div>
                     <div class="line">Denmark, and those that would make mows at him while</div>
                     <div class="line">my father lived, give twenty, forty, fifty, an</div>
                     <div class="line">hundred ducats a-piece for his picture in little.</div>
                     <div class="line">'Sblood, there is something in this more than</div>
                     <div class="line">natural, if philosophy could find it out.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Flourish of trumpets within</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                     <div class="line">There are the players.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Gentlemen, you are welcome to Elsinore. Your hands,</div>
                     <div class="line">come then: the appurtenance of welcome is fashion</div>
                     <div class="line">and ceremony: let me comply with you in this garb,</div>
                     <div class="line">lest my extent to the players, which, I tell you,</div>
                     <div class="line">must show fairly outward, should more appear like</div>
                     <div class="line">entertainment than yours. You are welcome: but my</div>
                     <div class="line">uncle-father and aunt-mother are deceived.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                     <div class="line">In what, my dear lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">I am but mad north-north-west: when the wind is</div>
                     <div class="line">southerly I know a hawk from a handsaw.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter POLONIUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Well be with you, gentlemen!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Hark you, Guildenstern; and you too: at each ear a</div>
                     <div class="line">hearer: that great baby you see there is not yet</div>
                     <div class="line">out of his swaddling-clouts.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">Happily he's the second time come to them; for they</div>
                     <div class="line">say an old man is twice a child.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">I will prophesy he comes to tell me of the players;</div>
                     <div class="line">mark it. You say right, sir: o' Monday morning;</div>
                     <div class="line">'twas so indeed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, I have news to tell you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, I have news to tell you.</div>
                     <div class="line">When Roscius was an actor in Rome,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The actors are come hither, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Buz, buz!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon mine honour,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Then came each actor on his ass,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The best actors in the world, either for tragedy,</div>
                     <div class="line">comedy, history, pastoral, pastoral-comical,</div>
                     <div class="line">historical-pastoral, tragical-historical, tragical-</div>
                     <div class="line">comical-historical-pastoral, scene individable, or</div>
                     <div class="line">poem unlimited: Seneca cannot be too heavy, nor</div>
                     <div class="line">Plautus too light. For the law of writ and the</div>
                     <div class="line">liberty, these are the only men.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">O Jephthah, judge of Israel, what a treasure hadst thou!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What a treasure had he, my lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Why,</div>
                     <div class="line">'One fair daughter and no more,</div>
                     <div class="line">The which he loved passing well.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  Still on my daughter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Am I not i' the right, old Jephthah?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">If you call me Jephthah, my lord, I have a daughter</div>
                     <div class="line">that I love passing well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, that follows not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What follows, then, my lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Why,</div>
                     <div class="line">'As by lot, God wot,'</div>
                     <div class="line">and then, you know,</div>
                     <div class="line">'It came to pass, as most like it was,'--</div>
                     <div class="line">the first row of the pious chanson will show you</div>
                     <div class="line">more; for look, where my abridgement comes.</div>
                     <p>Enter four or five Players</p>
                     <div class="line">You are welcome, masters; welcome, all. I am glad</div>
                     <div class="line">to see thee well. Welcome, good friends. O, my old</div>
                     <div class="line">friend! thy face is valenced since I saw thee last:</div>
                     <div class="line">comest thou to beard me in Denmark? What, my young</div>
                     <div class="line">lady and mistress! By'r lady, your ladyship is</div>
                     <div class="line">nearer to heaven than when I saw you last, by the</div>
                     <div class="line">altitude of a chopine. Pray God, your voice, like</div>
                     <div class="line">apiece of uncurrent gold, be not cracked within the</div>
                     <div class="line">ring. Masters, you are all welcome. We'll e'en</div>
                     <div class="line">to't like French falconers, fly at any thing we see:</div>
                     <div class="line">we'll have a speech straight: come, give us a taste</div>
                     <div class="line">of your quality; come, a passionate speech.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Player</div>
                     <div class="line">What speech, my lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">I heard thee speak me a speech once, but it was</div>
                     <div class="line">never acted; or, if it was, not above once; for the</div>
                     <div class="line">play, I remember, pleased not the million; 'twas</div>
                     <div class="line">caviare to the general: but it was--as I received</div>
                     <div class="line">it, and others, whose judgments in such matters</div>
                     <div class="line">cried in the top of mine--an excellent play, well</div>
                     <div class="line">digested in the scenes, set down with as much</div>
                     <div class="line">modesty as cunning. I remember, one said there</div>
                     <div class="line">were no sallets in the lines to make the matter</div>
                     <div class="line">savoury, nor no matter in the phrase that might</div>
                     <div class="line">indict the author of affectation; but called it an</div>
                     <div class="line">honest method, as wholesome as sweet, and by very</div>
                     <div class="line">much more handsome than fine. One speech in it I</div>
                     <div class="line">chiefly loved: 'twas Aeneas' tale to Dido; and</div>
                     <div class="line">thereabout of it especially, where he speaks of</div>
                     <div class="line">Priam's slaughter: if it live in your memory, begin</div>
                     <div class="line">at this line: let me see, let me see--</div>
                     <div class="line">'The rugged Pyrrhus, like the Hyrcanian beast,'--</div>
                     <div class="line">it is not so:--it begins with Pyrrhus:--</div>
                     <div class="line">'The rugged Pyrrhus, he whose sable arms,</div>
                     <div class="line">Black as his purpose, did the night resemble</div>
                     <div class="line">When he lay couched in the ominous horse,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath now this dread and black complexion smear'd</div>
                     <div class="line">With heraldry more dismal; head to foot</div>
                     <div class="line">Now is he total gules; horridly trick'd</div>
                     <div class="line">With blood of fathers, mothers, daughters, sons,</div>
                     <div class="line">Baked and impasted with the parching streets,</div>
                     <div class="line">That lend a tyrannous and damned light</div>
                     <div class="line">To their lord's murder: roasted in wrath and fire,</div>
                     <div class="line">And thus o'er-sized with coagulate gore,</div>
                     <div class="line">With eyes like carbuncles, the hellish Pyrrhus</div>
                     <div class="line">Old grandsire Priam seeks.'</div>
                     <div class="line">So, proceed you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">'Fore God, my lord, well spoken, with good accent and</div>
                     <div class="line">good discretion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Player</div>
                     <div class="line">'Anon he finds him</div>
                     <div class="line">Striking too short at Greeks; his antique sword,</div>
                     <div class="line">Rebellious to his arm, lies where it falls,</div>
                     <div class="line">Repugnant to command: unequal match'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Pyrrhus at Priam drives; in rage strikes wide;</div>
                     <div class="line">But with the whiff and wind of his fell sword</div>
                     <div class="line">The unnerved father falls. Then senseless Ilium,</div>
                     <div class="line">Seeming to feel this blow, with flaming top</div>
                     <div class="line">Stoops to his base, and with a hideous crash</div>
                     <div class="line">Takes prisoner Pyrrhus' ear: for, lo! his sword,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which was declining on the milky head</div>
                     <div class="line">Of reverend Priam, seem'd i' the air to stick:</div>
                     <div class="line">So, as a painted tyrant, Pyrrhus stood,</div>
                     <div class="line">And like a neutral to his will and matter,</div>
                     <div class="line">Did nothing.</div>
                     <div class="line">But, as we often see, against some storm,</div>
                     <div class="line">A silence in the heavens, the rack stand still,</div>
                     <div class="line">The bold winds speechless and the orb below</div>
                     <div class="line">As hush as death, anon the dreadful thunder</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth rend the region, so, after Pyrrhus' pause,</div>
                     <div class="line">Aroused vengeance sets him new a-work;</div>
                     <div class="line">And never did the Cyclops' hammers fall</div>
                     <div class="line">On Mars's armour forged for proof eterne</div>
                     <div class="line">With less remorse than Pyrrhus' bleeding sword</div>
                     <div class="line">Now falls on Priam.</div>
                     <div class="line">Out, out, thou strumpet, Fortune! All you gods,</div>
                     <div class="line">In general synod 'take away her power;</div>
                     <div class="line">Break all the spokes and fellies from her wheel,</div>
                     <div class="line">And bowl the round nave down the hill of heaven,</div>
                     <div class="line">As low as to the fiends!'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">This is too long.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">It shall to the barber's, with your beard. Prithee,</div>
                     <div class="line">say on: he's for a jig or a tale of bawdry, or he</div>
                     <div class="line">sleeps: say on: come to Hecuba.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Player</div>
                     <div class="line">'But who, O, who had seen the mobled queen--'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">'The mobled queen?'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">That's good; 'mobled queen' is good.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Player</div>
                     <div class="line">'Run barefoot up and down, threatening the flames</div>
                     <div class="line">With bisson rheum; a clout upon that head</div>
                     <div class="line">Where late the diadem stood, and for a robe,</div>
                     <div class="line">About her lank and all o'er-teemed loins,</div>
                     <div class="line">A blanket, in the alarm of fear caught up;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who this had seen, with tongue in venom steep'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Gainst Fortune's state would treason have</div>
                     <div class="line">pronounced:</div>
                     <div class="line">But if the gods themselves did see her then</div>
                     <div class="line">When she saw Pyrrhus make malicious sport</div>
                     <div class="line">In mincing with his sword her husband's limbs,</div>
                     <div class="line">The instant burst of clamour that she made,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless things mortal move them not at all,</div>
                     <div class="line">Would have made milch the burning eyes of heaven,</div>
                     <div class="line">And passion in the gods.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Look, whether he has not turned his colour and has</div>
                     <div class="line">tears in's eyes. Pray you, no more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis well: I'll have thee speak out the rest soon.</div>
                     <div class="line">Good my lord, will you see the players well</div>
                     <div class="line">bestowed? Do you hear, let them be well used; for</div>
                     <div class="line">they are the abstract and brief chronicles of the</div>
                     <div class="line">time: after your death you were better have a bad</div>
                     <div class="line">epitaph than their ill report while you live.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, I will use them according to their desert.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">God's bodykins, man, much better: use every man</div>
                     <div class="line">after his desert, and who should 'scape whipping?</div>
                     <div class="line">Use them after your own honour and dignity: the less</div>
                     <div class="line">they deserve, the more merit is in your bounty.</div>
                     <div class="line">Take them in.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, sirs.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Follow him, friends: we'll hear a play to-morrow.</div>
                     <p>Exit POLONIUS with all the Players but the First</p>
                     <div class="line">Dost thou hear me, old friend; can you play the</div>
                     <div class="line">Murder of Gonzago?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Player</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll ha't to-morrow night. You could, for a need,</div>
                     <div class="line">study a speech of some dozen or sixteen lines, which</div>
                     <div class="line">I would set down and insert in't, could you not?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Player</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Very well. Follow that lord; and look you mock him</div>
                     <div class="line">not.</div>
                     <p>Exit First Player</p>
                     <div class="line">My good friends, I'll leave you till night: you are</div>
                     <div class="line">welcome to Elsinore.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">Good my lord!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, so, God be wi' ye;</div>
                     <p>Exeunt ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN</p>
                     <div class="line">Now I am alone.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, what a rogue and peasant slave am I!</div>
                     <div class="line">Is it not monstrous that this player here,</div>
                     <div class="line">But in a fiction, in a dream of passion,</div>
                     <div class="line">Could force his soul so to his own conceit</div>
                     <div class="line">That from her working all his visage wann'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Tears in his eyes, distraction in's aspect,</div>
                     <div class="line">A broken voice, and his whole function suiting</div>
                     <div class="line">With forms to his conceit? and all for nothing!</div>
                     <div class="line">For Hecuba!</div>
                     <div class="line">What's Hecuba to him, or he to Hecuba,</div>
                     <div class="line">That he should weep for her? What would he do,</div>
                     <div class="line">Had he the motive and the cue for passion</div>
                     <div class="line">That I have? He would drown the stage with tears</div>
                     <div class="line">And cleave the general ear with horrid speech,</div>
                     <div class="line">Make mad the guilty and appal the free,</div>
                     <div class="line">Confound the ignorant, and amaze indeed</div>
                     <div class="line">The very faculties of eyes and ears. Yet I,</div>
                     <div class="line">A dull and muddy-mettled rascal, peak,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like John-a-dreams, unpregnant of my cause,</div>
                     <div class="line">And can say nothing; no, not for a king,</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon whose property and most dear life</div>
                     <div class="line">A damn'd defeat was made. Am I a coward?</div>
                     <div class="line">Who calls me villain? breaks my pate across?</div>
                     <div class="line">Plucks off my beard, and blows it in my face?</div>
                     <div class="line">Tweaks me by the nose? gives me the lie i' the throat,</div>
                     <div class="line">As deep as to the lungs? who does me this?</div>
                     <div class="line">Ha!</div>
                     <div class="line">'Swounds, I should take it: for it cannot be</div>
                     <div class="line">But I am pigeon-liver'd and lack gall</div>
                     <div class="line">To make oppression bitter, or ere this</div>
                     <div class="line">I should have fatted all the region kites</div>
                     <div class="line">With this slave's offal: bloody, bawdy villain!</div>
                     <div class="line">Remorseless, treacherous, lecherous, kindless villain!</div>
                     <div class="line">O, vengeance!</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, what an ass am I! This is most brave,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I, the son of a dear father murder'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Prompted to my revenge by heaven and hell,</div>
                     <div class="line">Must, like a whore, unpack my heart with words,</div>
                     <div class="line">And fall a-cursing, like a very drab,</div>
                     <div class="line">A scullion!</div>
                     <div class="line">Fie upon't! foh! About, my brain! I have heard</div>
                     <div class="line">That guilty creatures sitting at a play</div>
                     <div class="line">Have by the very cunning of the scene</div>
                     <div class="line">Been struck so to the soul that presently</div>
                     <div class="line">They have proclaim'd their malefactions;</div>
                     <div class="line">For murder, though it have no tongue, will speak</div>
                     <div class="line">With most miraculous organ. I'll have these players</div>
                     <div class="line">Play something like the murder of my father</div>
                     <div class="line">Before mine uncle: I'll observe his looks;</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll tent him to the quick: if he but blench,</div>
                     <div class="line">I know my course. The spirit that I have seen</div>
                     <div class="line">May be the devil: and the devil hath power</div>
                     <div class="line">To assume a pleasing shape; yea, and perhaps</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of my weakness and my melancholy,</div>
                     <div class="line">As he is very potent with such spirits,</div>
                     <div class="line">Abuses me to damn me: I'll have grounds</div>
                     <div class="line">More relative than this: the play 's the thing</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherein I'll catch the conscience of the king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.5">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 3. ACT III</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.2">1. SCENE I.  A room in the castle.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.3">2. SCENE II.  A hall in the castle.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.4">3. SCENE III.  A room in the castle.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.5">4. SCENE IV.  The Queen's closet.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  A room in the castle.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter KING CLAUDIUS, QUEEN GERTRUDE, POLONIUS,
OPHELIA, ROSENCRANTZ, and GUILDENSTERN</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">And can you, by no drift of circumstance,</div>
                     <div class="line">Get from him why he puts on this confusion,</div>
                     <div class="line">Grating so harshly all his days of quiet</div>
                     <div class="line">With turbulent and dangerous lunacy?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">He does confess he feels himself distracted;</div>
                     <div class="line">But from what cause he will by no means speak.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor do we find him forward to be sounded,</div>
                     <div class="line">But, with a crafty madness, keeps aloof,</div>
                     <div class="line">When we would bring him on to some confession</div>
                     <div class="line">Of his true state.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">Did he receive you well?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">Most like a gentleman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                     <div class="line">But with much forcing of his disposition.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">Niggard of question; but, of our demands,</div>
                     <div class="line">Most free in his reply.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">Did you assay him?</div>
                     <div class="line">To any pastime?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, it so fell out, that certain players</div>
                     <div class="line">We o'er-raught on the way: of these we told him;</div>
                     <div class="line">And there did seem in him a kind of joy</div>
                     <div class="line">To hear of it: they are about the court,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, as I think, they have already order</div>
                     <div class="line">This night to play before him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
