                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">By the mass, and 'tis like a camel, indeed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Methinks it is like a weasel.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">It is backed like a weasel.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Or like a whale?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Very like a whale.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Then I will come to my mother by and by. They fool</div>
                     <div class="line">me to the top of my bent. I will come by and by.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I will say so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">By and by is easily said.</div>
                     <p>Exit POLONIUS</p>
                     <div class="line">Leave me, friends.</div>
                     <p>Exeunt all but HAMLET</p>
                     <div class="line">Tis now the very witching time of night,</div>
                     <div class="line">When churchyards yawn and hell itself breathes out</div>
                     <div class="line">Contagion to this world: now could I drink hot blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">And do such bitter business as the day</div>
                     <div class="line">Would quake to look on. Soft! now to my mother.</div>
                     <div class="line">O heart, lose not thy nature; let not ever</div>
                     <div class="line">The soul of Nero enter this firm bosom:</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me be cruel, not unnatural:</div>
                     <div class="line">I will speak daggers to her, but use none;</div>
                     <div class="line">My tongue and soul in this be hypocrites;</div>
                     <div class="line">How in my words soever she be shent,</div>
                     <div class="line">To give them seals never, my soul, consent!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  A room in the castle.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter KING CLAUDIUS, ROSENCRANTZ, and GUILDENSTERN</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I like him not, nor stands it safe with us</div>
                     <div class="line">To let his madness range. Therefore prepare you;</div>
                     <div class="line">I your commission will forthwith dispatch,</div>
                     <div class="line">And he to England shall along with you:</div>
                     <div class="line">The terms of our estate may not endure</div>
                     <div class="line">Hazard so dangerous as doth hourly grow</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of his lunacies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                     <div class="line">We will ourselves provide:</div>
                     <div class="line">Most holy and religious fear it is</div>
                     <div class="line">To keep those many many bodies safe</div>
                     <div class="line">That live and feed upon your majesty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">The single and peculiar life is bound,</div>
                     <div class="line">With all the strength and armour of the mind,</div>
                     <div class="line">To keep itself from noyance; but much more</div>
                     <div class="line">That spirit upon whose weal depend and rest</div>
                     <div class="line">The lives of many. The cease of majesty</div>
                     <div class="line">Dies not alone; but, like a gulf, doth draw</div>
                     <div class="line">What's near it with it: it is a massy wheel,</div>
                     <div class="line">Fix'd on the summit of the highest mount,</div>
                     <div class="line">To whose huge spokes ten thousand lesser things</div>
                     <div class="line">Are mortised and adjoin'd; which, when it falls,</div>
                     <div class="line">Each small annexment, petty consequence,</div>
                     <div class="line">Attends the boisterous ruin. Never alone</div>
                     <div class="line">Did the king sigh, but with a general groan.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Arm you, I pray you, to this speedy voyage;</div>
                     <div class="line">For we will fetters put upon this fear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which now goes too free-footed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                     <div class="line">We will haste us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN</p>
               <p>Enter POLONIUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, he's going to his mother's closet:</div>
                     <div class="line">Behind the arras I'll convey myself,</div>
                     <div class="line">To hear the process; and warrant she'll tax him home:</div>
                     <div class="line">And, as you said, and wisely was it said,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis meet that some more audience than a mother,</div>
                     <div class="line">Since nature makes them partial, should o'erhear</div>
                     <div class="line">The speech, of vantage. Fare you well, my liege:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll call upon you ere you go to bed,</div>
                     <div class="line">And tell you what I know.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Thanks, dear my lord.</div>
                     <p>Exit POLONIUS</p>
                     <div class="line">O, my offence is rank it smells to heaven;</div>
                     <div class="line">It hath the primal eldest curse upon't,</div>
                     <div class="line">A brother's murder. Pray can I not,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though inclination be as sharp as will:</div>
                     <div class="line">My stronger guilt defeats my strong intent;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, like a man to double business bound,</div>
                     <div class="line">I stand in pause where I shall first begin,</div>
                     <div class="line">And both neglect. What if this cursed hand</div>
                     <div class="line">Were thicker than itself with brother's blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is there not rain enough in the sweet heavens</div>
                     <div class="line">To wash it white as snow? Whereto serves mercy</div>
                     <div class="line">But to confront the visage of offence?</div>
                     <div class="line">And what's in prayer but this two-fold force,</div>
                     <div class="line">To be forestalled ere we come to fall,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or pardon'd being down? Then I'll look up;</div>
                     <div class="line">My fault is past. But, O, what form of prayer</div>
                     <div class="line">Can serve my turn? 'Forgive me my foul murder'?</div>
                     <div class="line">That cannot be; since I am still possess'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Of those effects for which I did the murder,</div>
                     <div class="line">My crown, mine own ambition and my queen.</div>
                     <div class="line">May one be pardon'd and retain the offence?</div>
                     <div class="line">In the corrupted currents of this world</div>
                     <div class="line">Offence's gilded hand may shove by justice,</div>
                     <div class="line">And oft 'tis seen the wicked prize itself</div>
                     <div class="line">Buys out the law: but 'tis not so above;</div>
                     <div class="line">There is no shuffling, there the action lies</div>
                     <div class="line">In his true nature; and we ourselves compell'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even to the teeth and forehead of our faults,</div>
                     <div class="line">To give in evidence. What then? what rests?</div>
                     <div class="line">Try what repentance can: what can it not?</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet what can it when one can not repent?</div>
                     <div class="line">O wretched state! O bosom black as death!</div>
                     <div class="line">O limed soul, that, struggling to be free,</div>
                     <div class="line">Art more engaged! Help, angels! Make assay!</div>
                     <div class="line">Bow, stubborn knees; and, heart with strings of steel,</div>
                     <div class="line">Be soft as sinews of the newborn babe!</div>
                     <div class="line">All may be well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Retires and kneels</p>
               <p>Enter HAMLET</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Now might I do it pat, now he is praying;</div>
                     <div class="line">And now I'll do't. And so he goes to heaven;</div>
                     <div class="line">And so am I revenged. That would be scann'd:</div>
                     <div class="line">A villain kills my father; and for that,</div>
                     <div class="line">I, his sole son, do this same villain send</div>
                     <div class="line">To heaven.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, this is hire and salary, not revenge.</div>
                     <div class="line">He took my father grossly, full of bread;</div>
                     <div class="line">With all his crimes broad blown, as flush as May;</div>
                     <div class="line">And how his audit stands who knows save heaven?</div>
                     <div class="line">But in our circumstance and course of thought,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis heavy with him: and am I then revenged,</div>
                     <div class="line">To take him in the purging of his soul,</div>
                     <div class="line">When he is fit and season'd for his passage?</div>
                     <div class="line">No!</div>
                     <div class="line">Up, sword; and know thou a more horrid hent:</div>
                     <div class="line">When he is drunk asleep, or in his rage,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or in the incestuous pleasure of his bed;</div>
                     <div class="line">At gaming, swearing, or about some act</div>
                     <div class="line">That has no relish of salvation in't;</div>
                     <div class="line">Then trip him, that his heels may kick at heaven,</div>
                     <div class="line">And that his soul may be as damn'd and black</div>
                     <div class="line">As hell, whereto it goes. My mother stays:</div>
                     <div class="line">This physic but prolongs thy sickly days.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Rising</span>  My words fly up, my thoughts remain below:</div>
                     <div class="line">Words without thoughts never to heaven go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  The Queen's closet.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter QUEEN MARGARET and POLONIUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">He will come straight. Look you lay home to him:</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell him his pranks have been too broad to bear with,</div>
                     <div class="line">And that your grace hath screen'd and stood between</div>
                     <div class="line">Much heat and him. I'll sconce me even here.</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray you, be round with him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>  Mother, mother, mother!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll warrant you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Fear me not: withdraw, I hear him coming.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>POLONIUS hides behind the arras</p>
               <p>Enter HAMLET</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, mother, what's the matter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">Hamlet, thou hast thy father much offended.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Mother, you have my father much offended.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, come, you answer with an idle tongue.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, go, you question with a wicked tongue.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, how now, Hamlet!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">What's the matter now?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">Have you forgot me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">No, by the rood, not so:</div>
                     <div class="line">You are the queen, your husband's brother's wife;</div>
                     <div class="line">And--would it were not so!--you are my mother.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, then, I'll set those to you that can speak.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, come, and sit you down; you shall not budge;</div>
                     <div class="line">You go not till I set you up a glass</div>
                     <div class="line">Where you may see the inmost part of you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">What wilt thou do? thou wilt not murder me?</div>
                     <div class="line">Help, help, ho!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Behind</span>  What, ho! help, help, help!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Drawing</span>  How now! a rat? Dead, for a ducat, dead!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Makes a pass through the arras</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Behind</span>  O, I am slain!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Falls and dies</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">O me, what hast thou done?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, I know not:</div>
                     <div class="line">Is it the king?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">O, what a rash and bloody deed is this!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">A bloody deed! almost as bad, good mother,</div>
                     <div class="line">As kill a king, and marry with his brother.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">As kill a king!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, lady, 'twas my word.</div>
                     <p>Lifts up the array and discovers POLONIUS</p>
                     <div class="line">Thou wretched, rash, intruding fool, farewell!</div>
                     <div class="line">I took thee for thy better: take thy fortune;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou find'st to be too busy is some danger.</div>
                     <div class="line">Leave wringing of your hands: peace! sit you down,</div>
                     <div class="line">And let me wring your heart; for so I shall,</div>
                     <div class="line">If it be made of penetrable stuff,</div>
                     <div class="line">If damned custom have not brass'd it so</div>
                     <div class="line">That it is proof and bulwark against sense.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">What have I done, that thou darest wag thy tongue</div>
                     <div class="line">In noise so rude against me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Such an act</div>
                     <div class="line">That blurs the grace and blush of modesty,</div>
                     <div class="line">Calls virtue hypocrite, takes off the rose</div>
                     <div class="line">From the fair forehead of an innocent love</div>
                     <div class="line">And sets a blister there, makes marriage-vows</div>
                     <div class="line">As false as dicers' oaths: O, such a deed</div>
                     <div class="line">As from the body of contraction plucks</div>
                     <div class="line">The very soul, and sweet religion makes</div>
                     <div class="line">A rhapsody of words: heaven's face doth glow:</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, this solidity and compound mass,</div>
                     <div class="line">With tristful visage, as against the doom,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is thought-sick at the act.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay me, what act,</div>
                     <div class="line">That roars so loud, and thunders in the index?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Look here, upon this picture, and on this,</div>
                     <div class="line">The counterfeit presentment of two brothers.</div>
                     <div class="line">See, what a grace was seated on this brow;</div>
                     <div class="line">Hyperion's curls; the front of Jove himself;</div>
                     <div class="line">An eye like Mars, to threaten and command;</div>
                     <div class="line">A station like the herald Mercury</div>
                     <div class="line">New-lighted on a heaven-kissing hill;</div>
                     <div class="line">A combination and a form indeed,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where every god did seem to set his seal,</div>
                     <div class="line">To give the world assurance of a man:</div>
                     <div class="line">This was your husband. Look you now, what follows:</div>
                     <div class="line">Here is your husband; like a mildew'd ear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Blasting his wholesome brother. Have you eyes?</div>
                     <div class="line">Could you on this fair mountain leave to feed,</div>
                     <div class="line">And batten on this moor? Ha! have you eyes?</div>
                     <div class="line">You cannot call it love; for at your age</div>
                     <div class="line">The hey-day in the blood is tame, it's humble,</div>
                     <div class="line">And waits upon the judgment: and what judgment</div>
                     <div class="line">Would step from this to this? Sense, sure, you have,</div>
                     <div class="line">Else could you not have motion; but sure, that sense</div>
                     <div class="line">Is apoplex'd; for madness would not err,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor sense to ecstasy was ne'er so thrall'd</div>
                     <div class="line">But it reserved some quantity of choice,</div>
                     <div class="line">To serve in such a difference. What devil was't</div>
                     <div class="line">That thus hath cozen'd you at hoodman-blind?</div>
                     <div class="line">Eyes without feeling, feeling without sight,</div>
                     <div class="line">Ears without hands or eyes, smelling sans all,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or but a sickly part of one true sense</div>
                     <div class="line">Could not so mope.</div>
                     <div class="line">O shame! where is thy blush? Rebellious hell,</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou canst mutine in a matron's bones,</div>
                     <div class="line">To flaming youth let virtue be as wax,</div>
                     <div class="line">And melt in her own fire: proclaim no shame</div>
                     <div class="line">When the compulsive ardour gives the charge,</div>
                     <div class="line">Since frost itself as actively doth burn</div>
                     <div class="line">And reason panders will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">O Hamlet, speak no more:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou turn'st mine eyes into my very soul;</div>
                     <div class="line">And there I see such black and grained spots</div>
                     <div class="line">As will not leave their tinct.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, but to live</div>
                     <div class="line">In the rank sweat of an enseamed bed,</div>
                     <div class="line">Stew'd in corruption, honeying and making love</div>
                     <div class="line">Over the nasty sty,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">O, speak to me no more;</div>
                     <div class="line">These words, like daggers, enter in mine ears;</div>
                     <div class="line">No more, sweet Hamlet!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">A murderer and a villain;</div>
                     <div class="line">A slave that is not twentieth part the tithe</div>
                     <div class="line">Of your precedent lord; a vice of kings;</div>
                     <div class="line">A cutpurse of the empire and the rule,</div>
                     <div class="line">That from a shelf the precious diadem stole,</div>
                     <div class="line">And put it in his pocket!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">No more!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">A king of shreds and patches,--</div>
                     <p>Enter Ghost</p>
                     <div class="line">Save me, and hover o'er me with your wings,</div>
                     <div class="line">You heavenly guards! What would your gracious figure?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, he's mad!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you not come your tardy son to chide,</div>
                     <div class="line">That, lapsed in time and passion, lets go by</div>
                     <div class="line">The important acting of your dread command? O, say!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Ghost</div>
                     <div class="line">Do not forget: this visitation</div>
                     <div class="line">Is but to whet thy almost blunted purpose.</div>
                     <div class="line">But, look, amazement on thy mother sits:</div>
                     <div class="line">O, step between her and her fighting soul:</div>
                     <div class="line">Conceit in weakest bodies strongest works:</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak to her, Hamlet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">How is it with you, lady?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, how is't with you,</div>
                     <div class="line">That you do bend your eye on vacancy</div>
                     <div class="line">And with the incorporal air do hold discourse?</div>
                     <div class="line">Forth at your eyes your spirits wildly peep;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, as the sleeping soldiers in the alarm,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your bedded hair, like life in excrements,</div>
                     <div class="line">Starts up, and stands on end. O gentle son,</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the heat and flame of thy distemper</div>
                     <div class="line">Sprinkle cool patience. Whereon do you look?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">On him, on him! Look you, how pale he glares!</div>
                     <div class="line">His form and cause conjoin'd, preaching to stones,</div>
                     <div class="line">Would make them capable. Do not look upon me;</div>
                     <div class="line">Lest with this piteous action you convert</div>
                     <div class="line">My stern effects: then what I have to do</div>
                     <div class="line">Will want true colour; tears perchance for blood.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">To whom do you speak this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you see nothing there?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing at all; yet all that is I see.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor did you nothing hear?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">No, nothing but ourselves.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, look you there! look, how it steals away!</div>
                     <div class="line">My father, in his habit as he lived!</div>
                     <div class="line">Look, where he goes, even now, out at the portal!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit Ghost</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">This the very coinage of your brain:</div>
                     <div class="line">This bodiless creation ecstasy</div>
                     <div class="line">Is very cunning in.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Ecstasy!</div>
                     <div class="line">My pulse, as yours, doth temperately keep time,</div>
                     <div class="line">And makes as healthful music: it is not madness</div>
                     <div class="line">That I have utter'd: bring me to the test,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I the matter will re-word; which madness</div>
                     <div class="line">Would gambol from. Mother, for love of grace,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lay not that mattering unction to your soul,</div>
                     <div class="line">That not your trespass, but my madness speaks:</div>
                     <div class="line">It will but skin and film the ulcerous place,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whilst rank corruption, mining all within,</div>
                     <div class="line">Infects unseen. Confess yourself to heaven;</div>
                     <div class="line">Repent what's past; avoid what is to come;</div>
                     <div class="line">And do not spread the compost on the weeds,</div>
                     <div class="line">To make them ranker. Forgive me this my virtue;</div>
                     <div class="line">For in the fatness of these pursy times</div>
                     <div class="line">Virtue itself of vice must pardon beg,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, curb and woo for leave to do him good.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">O Hamlet, thou hast cleft my heart in twain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">O, throw away the worser part of it,</div>
                     <div class="line">And live the purer with the other half.</div>
                     <div class="line">Good night: but go not to mine uncle's bed;</div>
                     <div class="line">Assume a virtue, if you have it not.</div>
                     <div class="line">That monster, custom, who all sense doth eat,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of habits devil, is angel yet in this,</div>
                     <div class="line">That to the use of actions fair and good</div>
                     <div class="line">He likewise gives a frock or livery,</div>
                     <div class="line">That aptly is put on. Refrain to-night,</div>
                     <div class="line">And that shall lend a kind of easiness</div>
                     <div class="line">To the next abstinence: the next more easy;</div>
                     <div class="line">For use almost can change the stamp of nature,</div>
                     <div class="line">And either ... the devil, or throw him out</div>
                     <div class="line">With wondrous potency. Once more, good night:</div>
                     <div class="line">And when you are desirous to be bless'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll blessing beg of you. For this same lord,</div>
                     <p>Pointing to POLONIUS</p>
                     <div class="line">I do repent: but heaven hath pleased it so,</div>
                     <div class="line">To punish me with this and this with me,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I must be their scourge and minister.</div>
                     <div class="line">I will bestow him, and will answer well</div>
                     <div class="line">The death I gave him. So, again, good night.</div>
                     <div class="line">I must be cruel, only to be kind:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus bad begins and worse remains behind.</div>
                     <div class="line">One word more, good lady.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">What shall I do?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Not this, by no means, that I bid you do:</div>
                     <div class="line">Let the bloat king tempt you again to bed;</div>
                     <div class="line">Pinch wanton on your cheek; call you his mouse;</div>
                     <div class="line">And let him, for a pair of reechy kisses,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or paddling in your neck with his damn'd fingers,</div>
                     <div class="line">Make you to ravel all this matter out,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I essentially am not in madness,</div>
                     <div class="line">But mad in craft. 'Twere good you let him know;</div>
                     <div class="line">For who, that's but a queen, fair, sober, wise,</div>
                     <div class="line">Would from a paddock, from a bat, a gib,</div>
                     <div class="line">Such dear concernings hide? who would do so?</div>
                     <div class="line">No, in despite of sense and secrecy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unpeg the basket on the house's top.</div>
                     <div class="line">Let the birds fly, and, like the famous ape,</div>
                     <div class="line">To try conclusions, in the basket creep,</div>
                     <div class="line">And break your own neck down.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">Be thou assured, if words be made of breath,</div>
                     <div class="line">And breath of life, I have no life to breathe</div>
                     <div class="line">What thou hast said to me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">I must to England; you know that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">Alack,</div>
                     <div class="line">I had forgot: 'tis so concluded on.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">There's letters seal'd: and my two schoolfellows,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom I will trust as I will adders fang'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">They bear the mandate; they must sweep my way,</div>
                     <div class="line">And marshal me to knavery. Let it work;</div>
                     <div class="line">For 'tis the sport to have the engineer</div>
                     <div class="line">Hoist with his own petard: and 't shall go hard</div>
                     <div class="line">But I will delve one yard below their mines,</div>
                     <div class="line">And blow them at the moon: O, 'tis most sweet,</div>
                     <div class="line">When in one line two crafts directly meet.</div>
                     <div class="line">This man shall set me packing:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll lug the guts into the neighbour room.</div>
                     <div class="line">Mother, good night. Indeed this counsellor</div>
                     <div class="line">Is now most still, most secret and most grave,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who was in life a foolish prating knave.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, sir, to draw toward an end with you.</div>
                     <div class="line">Good night, mother.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt severally; HAMLET dragging in POLONIUS</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.6">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 4. ACT IV</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.2">1. SCENE I.  A room in the castle.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.3">2. SCENE II.  Another room in the castle.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.4">3. SCENE III.  Another room in the castle.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.5">4. SCENE IV.  A plain in Denmark.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.6">5. SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.7">6. SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.8">7. SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  A room in the castle.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter KING CLAUDIUS, QUEEN GERTRUDE, ROSENCRANTZ,
and GUILDENSTERN</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">There's matter in these sighs, these profound heaves:</div>
                     <div class="line">You must translate: 'tis fit we understand them.</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is your son?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">Bestow this place on us a little while.</div>
                     <p>Exeunt ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN</p>
                     <div class="line">Ah, my good lord, what have I seen to-night!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What, Gertrude? How does Hamlet?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">Mad as the sea and wind, when both contend</div>
                     <div class="line">Which is the mightier: in his lawless fit,</div>
                     <div class="line">Behind the arras hearing something stir,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whips out his rapier, cries, 'A rat, a rat!'</div>
                     <div class="line">And, in this brainish apprehension, kills</div>
                     <div class="line">The unseen good old man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">O heavy deed!</div>
                     <div class="line">It had been so with us, had we been there:</div>
                     <div class="line">His liberty is full of threats to all;</div>
                     <div class="line">To you yourself, to us, to every one.</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, how shall this bloody deed be answer'd?</div>
                     <div class="line">It will be laid to us, whose providence</div>
                     <div class="line">Should have kept short, restrain'd and out of haunt,</div>
                     <div class="line">This mad young man: but so much was our love,</div>
                     <div class="line">We would not understand what was most fit;</div>
                     <div class="line">But, like the owner of a foul disease,</div>
                     <div class="line">To keep it from divulging, let it feed</div>
                     <div class="line">Even on the pith of Life. Where is he gone?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">To draw apart the body he hath kill'd:</div>
                     <div class="line">O'er whom his very madness, like some ore</div>
                     <div class="line">Among a mineral of metals base,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shows itself pure; he weeps for what is done.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">O Gertrude, come away!</div>
                     <div class="line">The sun no sooner shall the mountains touch,</div>
                     <div class="line">But we will ship him hence: and this vile deed</div>
                     <div class="line">We must, with all our majesty and skill,</div>
                     <div class="line">Both countenance and excuse. Ho, Guildenstern!</div>
                     <p>Re-enter ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN</p>
                     <div class="line">Friends both, go join you with some further aid:</div>
                     <div class="line">Hamlet in madness hath Polonius slain,</div>
                     <div class="line">And from his mother's closet hath he dragg'd him:</div>
                     <div class="line">Go seek him out; speak fair, and bring the body</div>
                     <div class="line">Into the chapel. I pray you, haste in this.</div>
                     <p>Exeunt ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN</p>
                     <div class="line">Come, Gertrude, we'll call up our wisest friends;</div>
                     <div class="line">And let them know, both what we mean to do,</div>
                     <div class="line">And what's untimely done...</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose whisper o'er the world's diameter,</div>
                     <div class="line">As level as the cannon to his blank,</div>
                     <div class="line">Transports his poison'd shot, may miss our name,</div>
                     <div class="line">And hit the woundless air. O, come away!</div>
                     <div class="line">My soul is full of discord and dismay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  Another room in the castle.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter HAMLET</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Safely stowed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>  Hamlet! Lord Hamlet!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">What noise? who calls on Hamlet?</div>
                     <div class="line">O, here they come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">What have you done, my lord, with the dead body?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Compounded it with dust, whereto 'tis kin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell us where 'tis, that we may take it thence</div>
                     <div class="line">And bear it to the chapel.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Do not believe it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">Believe what?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">That I can keep your counsel and not mine own.</div>
                     <div class="line">Besides, to be demanded of a sponge! what</div>
                     <div class="line">replication should be made by the son of a king?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">Take you me for a sponge, my lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, sir, that soaks up the king's countenance, his</div>
                     <div class="line">rewards, his authorities. But such officers do the</div>
                     <div class="line">king best service in the end: he keeps them, like</div>
                     <div class="line">an ape, in the corner of his jaw; first mouthed, to</div>
                     <div class="line">be last swallowed: when he needs what you have</div>
                     <div class="line">gleaned, it is but squeezing you, and, sponge, you</div>
                     <div class="line">shall be dry again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">I understand you not, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">I am glad of it: a knavish speech sleeps in a</div>
                     <div class="line">foolish ear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, you must tell us where the body is, and go</div>
                     <div class="line">with us to the king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">The body is with the king, but the king is not with</div>
                     <div class="line">the body. The king is a thing--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                     <div class="line">A thing, my lord!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Of nothing: bring me to him. Hide fox, and all after.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  Another room in the castle.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter KING CLAUDIUS, attended</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I have sent to seek him, and to find the body.</div>
                     <div class="line">How dangerous is it that this man goes loose!</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet must not we put the strong law on him:</div>
                     <div class="line">He's loved of the distracted multitude,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who like not in their judgment, but their eyes;</div>
                     <div class="line">And where tis so, the offender's scourge is weigh'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">But never the offence. To bear all smooth and even,</div>
                     <div class="line">This sudden sending him away must seem</div>
                     <div class="line">Deliberate pause: diseases desperate grown</div>
                     <div class="line">By desperate appliance are relieved,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or not at all.</div>
                     <p>Enter ROSENCRANTZ</p>
                     <div class="line">How now! what hath befall'n?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">Where the dead body is bestow'd, my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">We cannot get from him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">But where is he?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">Without, my lord; guarded, to know your pleasure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Bring him before us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">Ho, Guildenstern! bring in my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter HAMLET and GUILDENSTERN</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, Hamlet, where's Polonius?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">At supper.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">At supper! where?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Not where he eats, but where he is eaten: a certain</div>
                     <div class="line">convocation of politic worms are e'en at him. Your</div>
                     <div class="line">worm is your only emperor for diet: we fat all</div>
                     <div class="line">creatures else to fat us, and we fat ourselves for</div>
                     <div class="line">maggots: your fat king and your lean beggar is but</div>
                     <div class="line">variable service, two dishes, but to one table:</div>
                     <div class="line">that's the end.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, alas!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">A man may fish with the worm that hath eat of a</div>
                     <div class="line">king, and cat of the fish that hath fed of that worm.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What dost you mean by this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing but to show you how a king may go a</div>
                     <div class="line">progress through the guts of a beggar.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is Polonius?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">In heaven; send hither to see: if your messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">find him not there, seek him i' the other place</div>
                     <div class="line">yourself. But indeed, if you find him not within</div>
                     <div class="line">this month, you shall nose him as you go up the</div>
                     <div class="line">stairs into the lobby.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Go seek him there.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>To some Attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">He will stay till ye come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt Attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Hamlet, this deed, for thine especial safety,--</div>
                     <div class="line">Which we do tender, as we dearly grieve</div>
                     <div class="line">For that which thou hast done,--must send thee hence</div>
                     <div class="line">With fiery quickness: therefore prepare thyself;</div>
                     <div class="line">The bark is ready, and the wind at help,</div>
                     <div class="line">The associates tend, and every thing is bent</div>
                     <div class="line">For England.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">For England!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, Hamlet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Good.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">So is it, if thou knew'st our purposes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">I see a cherub that sees them. But, come; for</div>
                     <div class="line">England! Farewell, dear mother.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy loving father, Hamlet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">My mother: father and mother is man and wife; man</div>
                     <div class="line">and wife is one flesh; and so, my mother. Come, for England!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Follow him at foot; tempt him with speed aboard;</div>
                     <div class="line">Delay it not; I'll have him hence to-night:</div>
                     <div class="line">Away! for every thing is seal'd and done</div>
                     <div class="line">That else leans on the affair: pray you, make haste.</div>
                     <p>Exeunt ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN</p>
                     <div class="line">And, England, if my love thou hold'st at aught--</div>
                     <div class="line">As my great power thereof may give thee sense,</div>
                     <div class="line">Since yet thy cicatrice looks raw and red</div>
                     <div class="line">After the Danish sword, and thy free awe</div>
                     <div class="line">Pays homage to us--thou mayst not coldly set</div>
                     <div class="line">Our sovereign process; which imports at full,</div>
                     <div class="line">By letters congruing to that effect,</div>
                     <div class="line">The present death of Hamlet. Do it, England;</div>
                     <div class="line">For like the hectic in my blood he rages,</div>
                     <div class="line">And thou must cure me: till I know 'tis done,</div>
                     <div class="line">Howe'er my haps, my joys were ne'er begun.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  A plain in Denmark.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter FORTINBRAS, a Captain, and Soldiers, marching</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE FORTINBRAS</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, captain, from me greet the Danish king;</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell him that, by his licence, Fortinbras</div>
                     <div class="line">Craves the conveyance of a promised march</div>
                     <div class="line">Over his kingdom. You know the rendezvous.</div>
                     <div class="line">If that his majesty would aught with us,</div>
                     <div class="line">We shall express our duty in his eye;</div>
                     <div class="line">And let him know so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">I will do't, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE FORTINBRAS</div>
                     <div class="line">Go softly on.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt FORTINBRAS and Soldiers</p>
               <p>Enter HAMLET, ROSENCRANTZ, GUILDENSTERN, and others</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Good sir, whose powers are these?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">They are of Norway, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">How purposed, sir, I pray you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">Against some part of Poland.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Who commands them, sir?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">The nephews to old Norway, Fortinbras.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Goes it against the main of Poland, sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or for some frontier?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">Truly to speak, and with no addition,</div>
                     <div class="line">We go to gain a little patch of ground</div>
                     <div class="line">That hath in it no profit but the name.</div>
                     <div class="line">To pay five ducats, five, I would not farm it;</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor will it yield to Norway or the Pole</div>
                     <div class="line">A ranker rate, should it be sold in fee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then the Polack never will defend it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, it is already garrison'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Two thousand souls and twenty thousand ducats</div>
                     <div class="line">Will not debate the question of this straw:</div>
                     <div class="line">This is the imposthume of much wealth and peace,</div>
                     <div class="line">That inward breaks, and shows no cause without</div>
                     <div class="line">Why the man dies. I humbly thank you, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">God be wi' you, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                     <div class="line">Wilt please you go, my lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll be with you straight go a little before.</div>
                     <p>Exeunt all except HAMLET</p>
                     <div class="line">How all occasions do inform against me,</div>
                     <div class="line">And spur my dull revenge! What is a man,</div>
                     <div class="line">If his chief good and market of his time</div>
                     <div class="line">Be but to sleep and feed? a beast, no more.</div>
                     <div class="line">Sure, he that made us with such large discourse,</div>
                     <div class="line">Looking before and after, gave us not</div>
                     <div class="line">That capability and god-like reason</div>
                     <div class="line">To fust in us unused. Now, whether it be</div>
                     <div class="line">Bestial oblivion, or some craven scruple</div>
                     <div class="line">Of thinking too precisely on the event,</div>
                     <div class="line">A thought which, quarter'd, hath but one part wisdom</div>
                     <div class="line">And ever three parts coward, I do not know</div>
                     <div class="line">Why yet I live to say 'This thing's to do;'</div>
                     <div class="line">Sith I have cause and will and strength and means</div>
                     <div class="line">To do't. Examples gross as earth exhort me:</div>
                     <div class="line">Witness this army of such mass and charge</div>
                     <div class="line">Led by a delicate and tender prince,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose spirit with divine ambition puff'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Makes mouths at the invisible event,</div>
                     <div class="line">Exposing what is mortal and unsure</div>
                     <div class="line">To all that fortune, death and danger dare,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even for an egg-shell. Rightly to be great</div>
                     <div class="line">Is not to stir without great argument,</div>
                     <div class="line">But greatly to find quarrel in a straw</div>
                     <div class="line">When honour's at the stake. How stand I then,</div>
                     <div class="line">That have a father kill'd, a mother stain'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Excitements of my reason and my blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">And let all sleep? while, to my shame, I see</div>
                     <div class="line">The imminent death of twenty thousand men,</div>
                     <div class="line">That, for a fantasy and trick of fame,</div>
                     <div class="line">Go to their graves like beds, fight for a plot</div>
                     <div class="line">Whereon the numbers cannot try the cause,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which is not tomb enough and continent</div>
