                     <div class="line">To hide the slain? O, from this time forth,</div>
                     <div class="line">My thoughts be bloody, or be nothing worth!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.6">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>5. SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter QUEEN GERTRUDE, HORATIO, and a Gentleman</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">I will not speak with her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">She is importunate, indeed distract:</div>
                     <div class="line">Her mood will needs be pitied.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">What would she have?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">She speaks much of her father; says she hears</div>
                     <div class="line">There's tricks i' the world; and hems, and beats her heart;</div>
                     <div class="line">Spurns enviously at straws; speaks things in doubt,</div>
                     <div class="line">That carry but half sense: her speech is nothing,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet the unshaped use of it doth move</div>
                     <div class="line">The hearers to collection; they aim at it,</div>
                     <div class="line">And botch the words up fit to their own thoughts;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, as her winks, and nods, and gestures</div>
                     <div class="line">yield them,</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed would make one think there might be thought,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though nothing sure, yet much unhappily.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twere good she were spoken with; for she may strew</div>
                     <div class="line">Dangerous conjectures in ill-breeding minds.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">Let her come in.</div>
                     <p>Exit HORATIO</p>
                     <div class="line">To my sick soul, as sin's true nature is,</div>
                     <div class="line">Each toy seems prologue to some great amiss:</div>
                     <div class="line">So full of artless jealousy is guilt,</div>
                     <div class="line">It spills itself in fearing to be spilt.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter HORATIO, with OPHELIA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is the beauteous majesty of Denmark?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">How now, Ophelia!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Sings</span>
                     </div>
                     <div class="line">How should I your true love know</div>
                     <div class="line">From another one?</div>
                     <div class="line">By his cockle hat and staff,</div>
                     <div class="line">And his sandal shoon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, sweet lady, what imports this song?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Say you? nay, pray you, mark.</div>
                     <p>Sings</p>
                     <div class="line">He is dead and gone, lady,</div>
                     <div class="line">He is dead and gone;</div>
                     <div class="line">At his head a grass-green turf,</div>
                     <div class="line">At his heels a stone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, but, Ophelia,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray you, mark.</div>
                     <p>Sings</p>
                     <div class="line">White his shroud as the mountain snow,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter KING CLAUDIUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, look here, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Sings</span>
                     </div>
                     <div class="line">Larded with sweet flowers</div>
                     <div class="line">Which bewept to the grave did go</div>
                     <div class="line">With true-love showers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">How do you, pretty lady?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, God 'ild you! They say the owl was a baker's</div>
                     <div class="line">daughter. Lord, we know what we are, but know not</div>
                     <div class="line">what we may be. God be at your table!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Conceit upon her father.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray you, let's have no words of this; but when they</div>
                     <div class="line">ask you what it means, say you this:</div>
                     <p>Sings</p>
                     <div class="line">To-morrow is Saint Valentine's day,</div>
                     <div class="line">All in the morning betime,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I a maid at your window,</div>
                     <div class="line">To be your Valentine.</div>
                     <div class="line">Then up he rose, and donn'd his clothes,</div>
                     <div class="line">And dupp'd the chamber-door;</div>
                     <div class="line">Let in the maid, that out a maid</div>
                     <div class="line">Never departed more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Pretty Ophelia!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed, la, without an oath, I'll make an end on't:</div>
                     <p>Sings</p>
                     <div class="line">By Gis and by Saint Charity,</div>
                     <div class="line">Alack, and fie for shame!</div>
                     <div class="line">Young men will do't, if they come to't;</div>
                     <div class="line">By cock, they are to blame.</div>
                     <div class="line">Quoth she, before you tumbled me,</div>
                     <div class="line">You promised me to wed.</div>
                     <div class="line">So would I ha' done, by yonder sun,</div>
                     <div class="line">An thou hadst not come to my bed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">How long hath she been thus?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I hope all will be well. We must be patient: but I</div>
                     <div class="line">cannot choose but weep, to think they should lay him</div>
                     <div class="line">i' the cold ground. My brother shall know of it:</div>
                     <div class="line">and so I thank you for your good counsel. Come, my</div>
                     <div class="line">coach! Good night, ladies; good night, sweet ladies;</div>
                     <div class="line">good night, good night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Follow her close; give her good watch,</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray you.</div>
                     <p>Exit HORATIO</p>
                     <div class="line">O, this is the poison of deep grief; it springs</div>
                     <div class="line">All from her father's death. O Gertrude, Gertrude,</div>
                     <div class="line">When sorrows come, they come not single spies</div>
                     <div class="line">But in battalions. First, her father slain:</div>
                     <div class="line">Next, your son gone; and he most violent author</div>
                     <div class="line">Of his own just remove: the people muddied,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thick and unwholesome in their thoughts and whispers,</div>
                     <div class="line">For good Polonius' death; and we have done but greenly,</div>
                     <div class="line">In hugger-mugger to inter him: poor Ophelia</div>
                     <div class="line">Divided from herself and her fair judgment,</div>
                     <div class="line">Without the which we are pictures, or mere beasts:</div>
                     <div class="line">Last, and as much containing as all these,</div>
                     <div class="line">Her brother is in secret come from France;</div>
                     <div class="line">Feeds on his wonder, keeps himself in clouds,</div>
                     <div class="line">And wants not buzzers to infect his ear</div>
                     <div class="line">With pestilent speeches of his father's death;</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherein necessity, of matter beggar'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Will nothing stick our person to arraign</div>
                     <div class="line">In ear and ear. O my dear Gertrude, this,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like to a murdering-piece, in many places</div>
                     <div class="line">Gives me superfluous death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>A noise within</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">Alack, what noise is this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Where are my Switzers? Let them guard the door.</div>
                     <p>Enter another Gentleman</p>
                     <div class="line">What is the matter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Save yourself, my lord:</div>
                     <div class="line">The ocean, overpeering of his list,</div>
                     <div class="line">Eats not the flats with more impetuous haste</div>
                     <div class="line">Than young Laertes, in a riotous head,</div>
                     <div class="line">O'erbears your officers. The rabble call him lord;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, as the world were now but to begin,</div>
                     <div class="line">Antiquity forgot, custom not known,</div>
                     <div class="line">The ratifiers and props of every word,</div>
                     <div class="line">They cry 'Choose we: Laertes shall be king:'</div>
                     <div class="line">Caps, hands, and tongues, applaud it to the clouds:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Laertes shall be king, Laertes king!'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">How cheerfully on the false trail they cry!</div>
                     <div class="line">O, this is counter, you false Danish dogs!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The doors are broke.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Noise within</p>
               <p>Enter LAERTES, armed; Danes following</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is this king? Sirs, stand you all without.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Danes</div>
                     <div class="line">No, let's come in.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray you, give me leave.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Danes</div>
                     <div class="line">We will, we will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>They retire without the door</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank you: keep the door. O thou vile king,</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me my father!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">Calmly, good Laertes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">That drop of blood that's calm proclaims me bastard,</div>
                     <div class="line">Cries cuckold to my father, brands the harlot</div>
                     <div class="line">Even here, between the chaste unsmirched brow</div>
                     <div class="line">Of my true mother.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What is the cause, Laertes,</div>
                     <div class="line">That thy rebellion looks so giant-like?</div>
                     <div class="line">Let him go, Gertrude; do not fear our person:</div>
                     <div class="line">There's such divinity doth hedge a king,</div>
                     <div class="line">That treason can but peep to what it would,</div>
                     <div class="line">Acts little of his will. Tell me, Laertes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Why thou art thus incensed. Let him go, Gertrude.</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak, man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is my father?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Dead.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">But not by him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Let him demand his fill.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">How came he dead? I'll not be juggled with:</div>
                     <div class="line">To hell, allegiance! vows, to the blackest devil!</div>
                     <div class="line">Conscience and grace, to the profoundest pit!</div>
                     <div class="line">I dare damnation. To this point I stand,</div>
                     <div class="line">That both the worlds I give to negligence,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let come what comes; only I'll be revenged</div>
                     <div class="line">Most thoroughly for my father.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Who shall stay you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">My will, not all the world:</div>
                     <div class="line">And for my means, I'll husband them so well,</div>
                     <div class="line">They shall go far with little.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Good Laertes,</div>
                     <div class="line">If you desire to know the certainty</div>
                     <div class="line">Of your dear father's death, is't writ in your revenge,</div>
                     <div class="line">That, swoopstake, you will draw both friend and foe,</div>
                     <div class="line">Winner and loser?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">None but his enemies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you know them then?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">To his good friends thus wide I'll ope my arms;</div>
                     <div class="line">And like the kind life-rendering pelican,</div>
                     <div class="line">Repast them with my blood.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, now you speak</div>
                     <div class="line">Like a good child and a true gentleman.</div>
                     <div class="line">That I am guiltless of your father's death,</div>
                     <div class="line">And am most sensible in grief for it,</div>
                     <div class="line">It shall as level to your judgment pierce</div>
                     <div class="line">As day does to your eye.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Danes</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>                Let her come in.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">How now! what noise is that?</div>
                     <p>Re-enter OPHELIA</p>
                     <div class="line">O heat, dry up my brains! tears seven times salt,</div>
                     <div class="line">Burn out the sense and virtue of mine eye!</div>
                     <div class="line">By heaven, thy madness shall be paid by weight,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till our scale turn the beam. O rose of May!</div>
                     <div class="line">Dear maid, kind sister, sweet Ophelia!</div>
                     <div class="line">O heavens! is't possible, a young maid's wits</div>
                     <div class="line">Should be as moral as an old man's life?</div>
                     <div class="line">Nature is fine in love, and where 'tis fine,</div>
                     <div class="line">It sends some precious instance of itself</div>
                     <div class="line">After the thing it loves.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Sings</span>
                     </div>
                     <div class="line">They bore him barefaced on the bier;</div>
                     <div class="line">Hey non nonny, nonny, hey nonny;</div>
                     <div class="line">And in his grave rain'd many a tear:--</div>
                     <div class="line">Fare you well, my dove!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">Hadst thou thy wits, and didst persuade revenge,</div>
                     <div class="line">It could not move thus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Sings</span>
                     </div>
                     <div class="line">You must sing a-down a-down,</div>
                     <div class="line">An you call him a-down-a.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, how the wheel becomes it! It is the false</div>
                     <div class="line">steward, that stole his master's daughter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">This nothing's more than matter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">There's rosemary, that's for remembrance; pray,</div>
                     <div class="line">love, remember: and there is pansies. that's for thoughts.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">A document in madness, thoughts and remembrance fitted.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">There's fennel for you, and columbines: there's rue</div>
                     <div class="line">for you; and here's some for me: we may call it</div>
                     <div class="line">herb-grace o' Sundays: O you must wear your rue with</div>
                     <div class="line">a difference. There's a daisy: I would give you</div>
                     <div class="line">some violets, but they withered all when my father</div>
                     <div class="line">died: they say he made a good end,--</div>
                     <p>Sings</p>
                     <div class="line">For bonny sweet Robin is all my joy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">Thought and affliction, passion, hell itself,</div>
                     <div class="line">She turns to favour and to prettiness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Sings</span>
                     </div>
                     <div class="line">And will he not come again?</div>
                     <div class="line">And will he not come again?</div>
                     <div class="line">No, no, he is dead:</div>
                     <div class="line">Go to thy death-bed:</div>
                     <div class="line">He never will come again.</div>
                     <div class="line">His beard was as white as snow,</div>
                     <div class="line">All flaxen was his poll:</div>
                     <div class="line">He is gone, he is gone,</div>
                     <div class="line">And we cast away moan:</div>
                     <div class="line">God ha' mercy on his soul!</div>
                     <div class="line">And of all Christian souls, I pray God. God be wi' ye.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you see this, O God?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Laertes, I must commune with your grief,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or you deny me right. Go but apart,</div>
                     <div class="line">Make choice of whom your wisest friends you will.</div>
                     <div class="line">And they shall hear and judge 'twixt you and me:</div>
                     <div class="line">If by direct or by collateral hand</div>
                     <div class="line">They find us touch'd, we will our kingdom give,</div>
                     <div class="line">Our crown, our life, and all that we can ours,</div>
                     <div class="line">To you in satisfaction; but if not,</div>
                     <div class="line">Be you content to lend your patience to us,</div>
                     <div class="line">And we shall jointly labour with your soul</div>
                     <div class="line">To give it due content.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">Let this be so;</div>
                     <div class="line">His means of death, his obscure funeral--</div>
                     <div class="line">No trophy, sword, nor hatchment o'er his bones,</div>
                     <div class="line">No noble rite nor formal ostentation--</div>
                     <div class="line">Cry to be heard, as 'twere from heaven to earth,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I must call't in question.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">So you shall;</div>
                     <div class="line">And where the offence is let the great axe fall.</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray you, go with me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.7">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>6. SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter HORATIO and a Servant</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">What are they that would speak with me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Sailors, sir: they say they have letters for you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Let them come in.</div>
                     <p>Exit Servant</p>
                     <div class="line">I do not know from what part of the world</div>
                     <div class="line">I should be greeted, if not from Lord Hamlet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Sailors</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Sailor</div>
                     <div class="line">God bless you, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Let him bless thee too.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Sailor</div>
                     <div class="line">He shall, sir, an't please him. There's a letter for</div>
                     <div class="line">you, sir; it comes from the ambassador that was</div>
                     <div class="line">bound for England; if your name be Horatio, as I am</div>
                     <div class="line">let to know it is.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>  'Horatio, when thou shalt have overlooked</div>
                     <div class="line">this, give these fellows some means to the king:</div>
                     <div class="line">they have letters for him. Ere we were two days old</div>
                     <div class="line">at sea, a pirate of very warlike appointment gave us</div>
                     <div class="line">chase. Finding ourselves too slow of sail, we put on</div>
                     <div class="line">a compelled valour, and in the grapple I boarded</div>
                     <div class="line">them: on the instant they got clear of our ship; so</div>
                     <div class="line">I alone became their prisoner. They have dealt with</div>
                     <div class="line">me like thieves of mercy: but they knew what they</div>
                     <div class="line">did; I am to do a good turn for them. Let the king</div>
                     <div class="line">have the letters I have sent; and repair thou to me</div>
                     <div class="line">with as much speed as thou wouldst fly death. I</div>
                     <div class="line">have words to speak in thine ear will make thee</div>
                     <div class="line">dumb; yet are they much too light for the bore of</div>
                     <div class="line">the matter. These good fellows will bring thee</div>
                     <div class="line">where I am. Rosencrantz and Guildenstern hold their</div>
                     <div class="line">course for England: of them I have much to tell</div>
                     <div class="line">thee. Farewell.</div>
                     <div class="line">'He that thou knowest thine, HAMLET.'</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, I will make you way for these your letters;</div>
                     <div class="line">And do't the speedier, that you may direct me</div>
                     <div class="line">To him from whom you brought them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.8">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>7. SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter KING CLAUDIUS and LAERTES</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Now must your conscience my acquaintance seal,</div>
                     <div class="line">And you must put me in your heart for friend,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sith you have heard, and with a knowing ear,</div>
                     <div class="line">That he which hath your noble father slain</div>
                     <div class="line">Pursued my life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">It well appears: but tell me</div>
                     <div class="line">Why you proceeded not against these feats,</div>
                     <div class="line">So crimeful and so capital in nature,</div>
                     <div class="line">As by your safety, wisdom, all things else,</div>
                     <div class="line">You mainly were stirr'd up.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">O, for two special reasons;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which may to you, perhaps, seem much unsinew'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">But yet to me they are strong. The queen his mother</div>
                     <div class="line">Lives almost by his looks; and for myself--</div>
                     <div class="line">My virtue or my plague, be it either which--</div>
                     <div class="line">She's so conjunctive to my life and soul,</div>
                     <div class="line">That, as the star moves not but in his sphere,</div>
                     <div class="line">I could not but by her. The other motive,</div>
                     <div class="line">Why to a public count I might not go,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is the great love the general gender bear him;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, dipping all his faults in their affection,</div>
                     <div class="line">Would, like the spring that turneth wood to stone,</div>
                     <div class="line">Convert his gyves to graces; so that my arrows,</div>
                     <div class="line">Too slightly timber'd for so loud a wind,</div>
                     <div class="line">Would have reverted to my bow again,</div>
                     <div class="line">And not where I had aim'd them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">And so have I a noble father lost;</div>
                     <div class="line">A sister driven into desperate terms,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose worth, if praises may go back again,</div>
                     <div class="line">Stood challenger on mount of all the age</div>
                     <div class="line">For her perfections: but my revenge will come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Break not your sleeps for that: you must not think</div>
                     <div class="line">That we are made of stuff so flat and dull</div>
                     <div class="line">That we can let our beard be shook with danger</div>
                     <div class="line">And think it pastime. You shortly shall hear more:</div>
                     <div class="line">I loved your father, and we love ourself;</div>
                     <div class="line">And that, I hope, will teach you to imagine--</div>
                     <p>Enter a Messenger</p>
                     <div class="line">How now! what news?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">Letters, my lord, from Hamlet:</div>
                     <div class="line">This to your majesty; this to the queen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">From Hamlet! who brought them?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">Sailors, my lord, they say; I saw them not:</div>
                     <div class="line">They were given me by Claudio; he received them</div>
                     <div class="line">Of him that brought them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Laertes, you shall hear them. Leave us.</div>
                     <p>Exit Messenger</p>
                     <p>Reads</p>
                     <div class="line">'High and mighty, You shall know I am set naked on</div>
                     <div class="line">your kingdom. To-morrow shall I beg leave to see</div>
                     <div class="line">your kingly eyes: when I shall, first asking your</div>
                     <div class="line">pardon thereunto, recount the occasion of my sudden</div>
                     <div class="line">and more strange return.                  'HAMLET.'</div>
                     <div class="line">What should this mean? Are all the rest come back?</div>
                     <div class="line">Or is it some abuse, and no such thing?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">Know you the hand?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis Hamlets character. 'Naked!</div>
                     <div class="line">And in a postscript here, he says 'alone.'</div>
                     <div class="line">Can you advise me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">I'm lost in it, my lord. But let him come;</div>
                     <div class="line">It warms the very sickness in my heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I shall live and tell him to his teeth,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Thus didest thou.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">If it be so, Laertes--</div>
                     <div class="line">As how should it be so? how otherwise?--</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you be ruled by me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, my lord;</div>
                     <div class="line">So you will not o'errule me to a peace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">To thine own peace. If he be now return'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">As checking at his voyage, and that he means</div>
                     <div class="line">No more to undertake it, I will work him</div>
                     <div class="line">To an exploit, now ripe in my device,</div>
                     <div class="line">Under the which he shall not choose but fall:</div>
                     <div class="line">And for his death no wind of blame shall breathe,</div>
                     <div class="line">But even his mother shall uncharge the practise</div>
                     <div class="line">And call it accident.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, I will be ruled;</div>
                     <div class="line">The rather, if you could devise it so</div>
                     <div class="line">That I might be the organ.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">It falls right.</div>
                     <div class="line">You have been talk'd of since your travel much,</div>
                     <div class="line">And that in Hamlet's hearing, for a quality</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherein, they say, you shine: your sum of parts</div>
                     <div class="line">Did not together pluck such envy from him</div>
                     <div class="line">As did that one, and that, in my regard,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of the unworthiest siege.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">What part is that, my lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">A very riband in the cap of youth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet needful too; for youth no less becomes</div>
                     <div class="line">The light and careless livery that it wears</div>
                     <div class="line">Than settled age his sables and his weeds,</div>
                     <div class="line">Importing health and graveness. Two months since,</div>
                     <div class="line">Here was a gentleman of Normandy:--</div>
                     <div class="line">I've seen myself, and served against, the French,</div>
                     <div class="line">And they can well on horseback: but this gallant</div>
                     <div class="line">Had witchcraft in't; he grew unto his seat;</div>
                     <div class="line">And to such wondrous doing brought his horse,</div>
                     <div class="line">As he had been incorpsed and demi-natured</div>
                     <div class="line">With the brave beast: so far he topp'd my thought,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I, in forgery of shapes and tricks,</div>
                     <div class="line">Come short of what he did.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">A Norman was't?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">A Norman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon my life, Lamond.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The very same.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">I know him well: he is the brooch indeed</div>
                     <div class="line">And gem of all the nation.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">He made confession of you,</div>
                     <div class="line">And gave you such a masterly report</div>
                     <div class="line">For art and exercise in your defence</div>
                     <div class="line">And for your rapier most especially,</div>
                     <div class="line">That he cried out, 'twould be a sight indeed,</div>
                     <div class="line">If one could match you: the scrimers of their nation,</div>
                     <div class="line">He swore, had had neither motion, guard, nor eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">If you opposed them. Sir, this report of his</div>
                     <div class="line">Did Hamlet so envenom with his envy</div>
                     <div class="line">That he could nothing do but wish and beg</div>
                     <div class="line">Your sudden coming o'er, to play with him.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, out of this,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">What out of this, my lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Laertes, was your father dear to you?</div>
                     <div class="line">Or are you like the painting of a sorrow,</div>
                     <div class="line">A face without a heart?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">Why ask you this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Not that I think you did not love your father;</div>
                     <div class="line">But that I know love is begun by time;</div>
                     <div class="line">And that I see, in passages of proof,</div>
                     <div class="line">Time qualifies the spark and fire of it.</div>
                     <div class="line">There lives within the very flame of love</div>
                     <div class="line">A kind of wick or snuff that will abate it;</div>
                     <div class="line">And nothing is at a like goodness still;</div>
                     <div class="line">For goodness, growing to a plurisy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Dies in his own too much: that we would do</div>
                     <div class="line">We should do when we would; for this 'would' changes</div>
                     <div class="line">And hath abatements and delays as many</div>
                     <div class="line">As there are tongues, are hands, are accidents;</div>
                     <div class="line">And then this 'should' is like a spendthrift sigh,</div>
                     <div class="line">That hurts by easing. But, to the quick o' the ulcer:--</div>
                     <div class="line">Hamlet comes back: what would you undertake,</div>
                     <div class="line">To show yourself your father's son in deed</div>
                     <div class="line">More than in words?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">To cut his throat i' the church.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">No place, indeed, should murder sanctuarize;</div>
                     <div class="line">Revenge should have no bounds. But, good Laertes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you do this, keep close within your chamber.</div>
                     <div class="line">Hamlet return'd shall know you are come home:</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll put on those shall praise your excellence</div>
                     <div class="line">And set a double varnish on the fame</div>
                     <div class="line">The Frenchman gave you, bring you in fine together</div>
                     <div class="line">And wager on your heads: he, being remiss,</div>
                     <div class="line">Most generous and free from all contriving,</div>
                     <div class="line">Will not peruse the foils; so that, with ease,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or with a little shuffling, you may choose</div>
                     <div class="line">A sword unbated, and in a pass of practise</div>
                     <div class="line">Requite him for your father.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">I will do't:</div>
                     <div class="line">And, for that purpose, I'll anoint my sword.</div>
                     <div class="line">I bought an unction of a mountebank,</div>
                     <div class="line">So mortal that, but dip a knife in it,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where it draws blood no cataplasm so rare,</div>
                     <div class="line">Collected from all simples that have virtue</div>
                     <div class="line">Under the moon, can save the thing from death</div>
                     <div class="line">That is but scratch'd withal: I'll touch my point</div>
                     <div class="line">With this contagion, that, if I gall him slightly,</div>
                     <div class="line">It may be death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Let's further think of this;</div>
                     <div class="line">Weigh what convenience both of time and means</div>
                     <div class="line">May fit us to our shape: if this should fail,</div>
                     <div class="line">And that our drift look through our bad performance,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twere better not assay'd: therefore this project</div>
                     <div class="line">Should have a back or second, that might hold,</div>
                     <div class="line">If this should blast in proof. Soft! let me see:</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll make a solemn wager on your cunnings: I ha't.</div>
                     <div class="line">When in your motion you are hot and dry--</div>
                     <div class="line">As make your bouts more violent to that end--</div>
                     <div class="line">And that he calls for drink, I'll have prepared him</div>
                     <div class="line">A chalice for the nonce, whereon but sipping,</div>
                     <div class="line">If he by chance escape your venom'd stuck,</div>
                     <div class="line">Our purpose may hold there.</div>
                     <p>Enter QUEEN GERTRUDE</p>
                     <div class="line">How now, sweet queen!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">One woe doth tread upon another's heel,</div>
                     <div class="line">So fast they follow; your sister's drown'd, Laertes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">Drown'd! O, where?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">There is a willow grows aslant a brook,</div>
                     <div class="line">That shows his hoar leaves in the glassy stream;</div>
                     <div class="line">There with fantastic garlands did she come</div>
                     <div class="line">Of crow-flowers, nettles, daisies, and long purples</div>
                     <div class="line">That liberal shepherds give a grosser name,</div>
                     <div class="line">But our cold maids do dead men's fingers call them:</div>
                     <div class="line">There, on the pendent boughs her coronet weeds</div>
                     <div class="line">Clambering to hang, an envious sliver broke;</div>
                     <div class="line">When down her weedy trophies and herself</div>
                     <div class="line">Fell in the weeping brook. Her clothes spread wide;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, mermaid-like, awhile they bore her up:</div>
                     <div class="line">Which time she chanted snatches of old tunes;</div>
                     <div class="line">As one incapable of her own distress,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or like a creature native and indued</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto that element: but long it could not be</div>
                     <div class="line">Till that her garments, heavy with their drink,</div>
                     <div class="line">Pull'd the poor wretch from her melodious lay</div>
                     <div class="line">To muddy death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, then, she is drown'd?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                     <div class="line">Drown'd, drown'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                     <div class="line">Too much of water hast thou, poor Ophelia,</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore I forbid my tears: but yet</div>
                     <div class="line">It is our trick; nature her custom holds,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let shame say what it will: when these are gone,</div>
                     <div class="line">The woman will be out. Adieu, my lord:</div>
                     <div class="line">I have a speech of fire, that fain would blaze,</div>
                     <div class="line">But that this folly douts it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Let's follow, Gertrude:</div>
                     <div class="line">How much I had to do to calm his rage!</div>
                     <div class="line">Now fear I this will give it start again;</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore let's follow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.7">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 5. ACT V</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  A churchyard.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  A hall in the castle.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  A churchyard.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter two Clowns, with spades, &c</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Is she to be buried in Christian burial that</div>
                     <div class="line">wilfully seeks her own salvation?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">I tell thee she is: and therefore make her grave</div>
                     <div class="line">straight: the crowner hath sat on her, and finds it</div>
                     <div class="line">Christian burial.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">How can that be, unless she drowned herself in her</div>
                     <div class="line">own defence?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, 'tis found so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">It must be 'se offendendo;' it cannot be else. For</div>
                     <div class="line">here lies the point:  if I drown myself wittingly,</div>
                     <div class="line">it argues an act: and an act hath three branches: it</div>
                     <div class="line">is, to act, to do, to perform: argal, she drowned</div>
                     <div class="line">herself wittingly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, but hear you, goodman delver,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me leave. Here lies the water; good: here</div>
                     <div class="line">stands the man; good; if the man go to this water,</div>
                     <div class="line">and drown himself, it is, will he, nill he, he</div>
                     <div class="line">goes,--mark you that; but if the water come to him</div>
                     <div class="line">and drown him, he drowns not himself: argal, he</div>
                     <div class="line">that is not guilty of his own death shortens not his own life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">But is this law?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, marry, is't; crowner's quest law.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you ha' the truth on't? If this had not been</div>
                     <div class="line">a gentlewoman, she should have been buried out o'</div>
                     <div class="line">Christian burial.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, there thou say'st: and the more pity that</div>
                     <div class="line">great folk should have countenance in this world to</div>
                     <div class="line">drown or hang themselves, more than their even</div>
                     <div class="line">Christian. Come, my spade. There is no ancient</div>
                     <div class="line">gentleman but gardeners, ditchers, and grave-makers:</div>
                     <div class="line">they hold up Adam's profession.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Was he a gentleman?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">He was the first that ever bore arms.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, he had none.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">What, art a heathen? How dost thou understand the</div>
                     <div class="line">Scripture? The Scripture says 'Adam digged:'</div>
                     <div class="line">could he dig without arms? I'll put another</div>
                     <div class="line">question to thee: if thou answerest me not to the</div>
                     <div class="line">purpose, confess thyself--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Go to.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">What is he that builds stronger than either the</div>
                     <div class="line">mason, the shipwright, or the carpenter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">The gallows-maker; for that frame outlives a</div>
                     <div class="line">thousand tenants.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">I like thy wit well, in good faith: the gallows</div>
                     <div class="line">does well; but how does it well? it does well to</div>
                     <div class="line">those that do in: now thou dost ill to say the</div>
                     <div class="line">gallows is built stronger than the church: argal,</div>
                     <div class="line">the gallows may do well to thee. To't again, come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">'Who builds stronger than a mason, a shipwright, or</div>
                     <div class="line">a carpenter?'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, tell me that, and unyoke.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, now I can tell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">To't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Mass, I cannot tell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter HAMLET and HORATIO, at a distance</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Cudgel thy brains no more about it, for your dull</div>
                     <div class="line">ass will not mend his pace with beating; and, when</div>
                     <div class="line">you are asked this question next, say 'a</div>
                     <div class="line">grave-maker: 'the houses that he makes last till</div>
                     <div class="line">doomsday. Go, get thee to Yaughan: fetch me a</div>
                     <div class="line">stoup of liquor.</div>
                     <p>Exit Second Clown</p>
                     <p>He digs and sings</p>
                     <div class="line">In youth, when I did love, did love,</div>
                     <div class="line">Methought it was very sweet,</div>
                     <div class="line">To contract, O, the time, for, ah, my behove,</div>
                     <div class="line">O, methought, there was nothing meet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Has this fellow no feeling of his business, that he</div>
                     <div class="line">sings at grave-making?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Custom hath made it in him a property of easiness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis e'en so: the hand of little employment hath</div>
                     <div class="line">the daintier sense.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Sings</span>
                     </div>
                     <div class="line">But age, with his stealing steps,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath claw'd me in his clutch,</div>
                     <div class="line">And hath shipped me intil the land,</div>
                     <div class="line">As if I had never been such.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Throws up a skull</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">That skull had a tongue in it, and could sing once:</div>
                     <div class="line">how the knave jowls it to the ground, as if it were</div>
                     <div class="line">Cain's jaw-bone, that did the first murder! It</div>
                     <div class="line">might be the pate of a politician, which this ass</div>
                     <div class="line">now o'er-reaches; one that would circumvent God,</div>
                     <div class="line">might it not?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">It might, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Or of a courtier; which could say 'Good morrow,</div>
                     <div class="line">sweet lord! How dost thou, good lord?' This might</div>
                     <div class="line">be my lord such-a-one, that praised my lord</div>
                     <div class="line">such-a-one's horse, when he meant to beg it; might it not?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, e'en so: and now my Lady Worm's; chapless, and</div>
                     <div class="line">knocked about the mazzard with a sexton's spade:</div>
                     <div class="line">here's fine revolution, an we had the trick to</div>
                     <div class="line">see't. Did these bones cost no more the breeding,</div>
                     <div class="line">but to play at loggats with 'em? mine ache to think on't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                     <p>Sings</p>
                     <div class="line">A pick-axe, and a spade, a spade,</div>
                     <div class="line">For and a shrouding sheet:</div>
                     <div class="line">O, a pit of clay for to be made</div>
                     <div class="line">For such a guest is meet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Throws up another skull</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                     <div class="line">There's another: why may not that be the skull of a</div>
                     <div class="line">lawyer? Where be his quiddities now, his quillets,</div>
                     <div class="line">his cases, his tenures, and his tricks? why does he</div>
                     <div class="line">suffer this rude knave now to knock him about the</div>
                     <div class="line">sconce with a dirty shovel, and will not tell him of</div>
                     <div class="line">his action of battery? Hum! This fellow might be</div>
                     <div class="line">in's time a great buyer of land, with his statutes,</div>
                     <div class="line">his recognizances, his fines, his double vouchers,</div>
