                              <div class="line">O heavenly powers, restore him!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">I have heard of your paintings too, well enough; God</div>
                              <div class="line">has given you one face, and you make yourselves</div>
                              <div class="line">another: you jig, you amble, and you lisp, and</div>
                              <div class="line">nick-name God's creatures, and make your wantonness</div>
                              <div class="line">your ignorance. Go to, I'll no more on't; it hath</div>
                              <div class="line">made me mad. I say, we will have no more marriages:</div>
                              <div class="line">those that are married already, all but one, shall</div>
                              <div class="line">live; the rest shall keep as they are. To a</div>
                              <div class="line">nunnery, go.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">O, what a noble mind is here o'erthrown!</div>
                              <div class="line">The courtier's, soldier's, scholar's, eye, tongue, sword;</div>
                              <div class="line">The expectancy and rose of the fair state,</div>
                              <div class="line">The glass of fashion and the mould of form,</div>
                              <div class="line">The observed of all observers, quite, quite down!</div>
                              <div class="line">And I, of ladies most deject and wretched,</div>
                              <div class="line">That suck'd the honey of his music vows,</div>
                              <div class="line">Now see that noble and most sovereign reason,</div>
                              <div class="line">Like sweet bells jangled, out of tune and harsh;</div>
                              <div class="line">That unmatch'd form and feature of blown youth</div>
                              <div class="line">Blasted with ecstasy: O, woe is me,</div>
                              <div class="line">To have seen what I have seen, see what I see!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter KING CLAUDIUS and POLONIUS</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Love! his affections do not that way tend;</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor what he spake, though it lack'd form a little,</div>
                              <div class="line">Was not like madness. There's something in his soul,</div>
                              <div class="line">O'er which his melancholy sits on brood;</div>
                              <div class="line">And I do doubt the hatch and the disclose</div>
                              <div class="line">Will be some danger: which for to prevent,</div>
                              <div class="line">I have in quick determination</div>
                              <div class="line">Thus set it down: he shall with speed to England,</div>
                              <div class="line">For the demand of our neglected tribute</div>
                              <div class="line">Haply the seas and countries different</div>
                              <div class="line">With variable objects shall expel</div>
                              <div class="line">This something-settled matter in his heart,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whereon his brains still beating puts him thus</div>
                              <div class="line">From fashion of himself. What think you on't?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">It shall do well: but yet do I believe</div>
                              <div class="line">The origin and commencement of his grief</div>
                              <div class="line">Sprung from neglected love. How now, Ophelia!</div>
                              <div class="line">You need not tell us what Lord Hamlet said;</div>
                              <div class="line">We heard it all. My lord, do as you please;</div>
                              <div class="line">But, if you hold it fit, after the play</div>
                              <div class="line">Let his queen mother all alone entreat him</div>
                              <div class="line">To show his grief: let her be round with him;</div>
                              <div class="line">And I'll be placed, so please you, in the ear</div>
                              <div class="line">Of all their conference. If she find him not,</div>
                              <div class="line">To England send him, or confine him where</div>
                              <div class="line">Your wisdom best shall think.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">It shall be so:</div>
                              <div class="line">Madness in great ones must not unwatch'd go.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.5.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  A hall in the castle.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter HAMLET and Players</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak the speech, I pray you, as I pronounced it to</div>
                              <div class="line">you, trippingly on the tongue: but if you mouth it,</div>
                              <div class="line">as many of your players do, I had as lief the</div>
                              <div class="line">town-crier spoke my lines. Nor do not saw the air</div>
                              <div class="line">too much with your hand, thus, but use all gently;</div>
                              <div class="line">for in the very torrent, tempest, and, as I may say,</div>
                              <div class="line">the whirlwind of passion, you must acquire and beget</div>
                              <div class="line">a temperance that may give it smoothness. O, it</div>
                              <div class="line">offends me to the soul to hear a robustious</div>
                              <div class="line">periwig-pated fellow tear a passion to tatters, to</div>
                              <div class="line">very rags, to split the ears of the groundlings, who</div>
                              <div class="line">for the most part are capable of nothing but</div>
                              <div class="line">inexplicable dumbshows and noise: I would have such</div>
                              <div class="line">a fellow whipped for o'erdoing Termagant; it</div>
                              <div class="line">out-herods Herod: pray you, avoid it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Player</div>
                              <div class="line">I warrant your honour.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Be not too tame neither, but let your own discretion</div>
                              <div class="line">be your tutor: suit the action to the word, the</div>
                              <div class="line">word to the action; with this special o'erstep not</div>
                              <div class="line">the modesty of nature: for any thing so overdone is</div>
                              <div class="line">from the purpose of playing, whose end, both at the</div>
                              <div class="line">first and now, was and is, to hold, as 'twere, the</div>
                              <div class="line">mirror up to nature; to show virtue her own feature,</div>
                              <div class="line">scorn her own image, and the very age and body of</div>
                              <div class="line">the time his form and pressure. Now this overdone,</div>
                              <div class="line">or come tardy off, though it make the unskilful</div>
                              <div class="line">laugh, cannot but make the judicious grieve; the</div>
                              <div class="line">censure of the which one must in your allowance</div>
                              <div class="line">o'erweigh a whole theatre of others. O, there be</div>
                              <div class="line">players that I have seen play, and heard others</div>
                              <div class="line">praise, and that highly, not to speak it profanely,</div>
                              <div class="line">that, neither having the accent of Christians nor</div>
                              <div class="line">the gait of Christian, pagan, nor man, have so</div>
                              <div class="line">strutted and bellowed that I have thought some of</div>
                              <div class="line">nature's journeymen had made men and not made them</div>
                              <div class="line">well, they imitated humanity so abominably.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Player</div>
                              <div class="line">I hope we have reformed that indifferently with us,</div>
                              <div class="line">sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">O, reform it altogether. And let those that play</div>
                              <div class="line">your clowns speak no more than is set down for them;</div>
                              <div class="line">for there be of them that will themselves laugh, to</div>
                              <div class="line">set on some quantity of barren spectators to laugh</div>
                              <div class="line">too; though, in the mean time, some necessary</div>
                              <div class="line">question of the play be then to be considered:</div>
                              <div class="line">that's villanous, and shows a most pitiful ambition</div>
                              <div class="line">in the fool that uses it. Go, make you ready.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt Players</p>
                              <p>Enter POLONIUS, ROSENCRANTZ, and GUILDENSTERN</p>
                              <div class="line">How now, my lord! I will the king hear this piece of work?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">And the queen too, and that presently.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Bid the players make haste.</div>
                              <p>Exit POLONIUS</p>
                              <div class="line">Will you two help to hasten them?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                              <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                              <div class="line">We will, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">What ho! Horatio!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter HORATIO</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Here, sweet lord, at your service.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Horatio, thou art e'en as just a man</div>
                              <div class="line">As e'er my conversation coped withal.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">O, my dear lord,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, do not think I flatter;</div>
                              <div class="line">For what advancement may I hope from thee</div>
                              <div class="line">That no revenue hast but thy good spirits,</div>
                              <div class="line">To feed and clothe thee? Why should the poor be flatter'd?</div>
                              <div class="line">No, let the candied tongue lick absurd pomp,</div>
                              <div class="line">And crook the pregnant hinges of the knee</div>
                              <div class="line">Where thrift may follow fawning. Dost thou hear?</div>
                              <div class="line">Since my dear soul was mistress of her choice</div>
                              <div class="line">And could of men distinguish, her election</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath seal'd thee for herself; for thou hast been</div>
                              <div class="line">As one, in suffering all, that suffers nothing,</div>
                              <div class="line">A man that fortune's buffets and rewards</div>
                              <div class="line">Hast ta'en with equal thanks: and blest are those</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose blood and judgment are so well commingled,</div>
                              <div class="line">That they are not a pipe for fortune's finger</div>
                              <div class="line">To sound what stop she please. Give me that man</div>
                              <div class="line">That is not passion's slave, and I will wear him</div>
                              <div class="line">In my heart's core, ay, in my heart of heart,</div>
                              <div class="line">As I do thee.--Something too much of this.--</div>
                              <div class="line">There is a play to-night before the king;</div>
                              <div class="line">One scene of it comes near the circumstance</div>
                              <div class="line">Which I have told thee of my father's death:</div>
                              <div class="line">I prithee, when thou seest that act afoot,</div>
                              <div class="line">Even with the very comment of thy soul</div>
                              <div class="line">Observe mine uncle: if his occulted guilt</div>
                              <div class="line">Do not itself unkennel in one speech,</div>
                              <div class="line">It is a damned ghost that we have seen,</div>
                              <div class="line">And my imaginations are as foul</div>
                              <div class="line">As Vulcan's stithy. Give him heedful note;</div>
                              <div class="line">For I mine eyes will rivet to his face,</div>
                              <div class="line">And after we will both our judgments join</div>
                              <div class="line">In censure of his seeming.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, my lord:</div>
                              <div class="line">If he steal aught the whilst this play is playing,</div>
                              <div class="line">And 'scape detecting, I will pay the theft.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">They are coming to the play; I must be idle:</div>
                              <div class="line">Get you a place.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Danish march. A flourish. Enter KING CLAUDIUS,
QUEEN GERTRUDE, POLONIUS, OPHELIA, ROSENCRANTZ,
GUILDENSTERN, and others</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">How fares our cousin Hamlet?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Excellent, i' faith; of the chameleon's dish: I eat</div>
                              <div class="line">the air, promise-crammed: you cannot feed capons so.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I have nothing with this answer, Hamlet; these words</div>
                              <div class="line">are not mine.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">No, nor mine now.</div>
                              <p>To POLONIUS</p>
                              <div class="line">My lord, you played once i' the university, you say?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">That did I, my lord; and was accounted a good actor.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">What did you enact?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I did enact Julius Caesar: I was killed i' the</div>
                              <div class="line">Capitol; Brutus killed me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">It was a brute part of him to kill so capital a calf</div>
                              <div class="line">there. Be the players ready?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, my lord; they stay upon your patience.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                              <div class="line">Come hither, my dear Hamlet, sit by me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">No, good mother, here's metal more attractive.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>To KING CLAUDIUS</span>  O, ho! do you mark that?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Lady, shall I lie in your lap?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Lying down at OPHELIA's feet</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">No, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">I mean, my head upon your lap?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Do you think I meant country matters?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">I think nothing, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">That's a fair thought to lie between maids' legs.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">What is, my lord?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Nothing.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">You are merry, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Who, I?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">O God, your only jig-maker. What should a man do</div>
                              <div class="line">but be merry? for, look you, how cheerfully my</div>
                              <div class="line">mother looks, and my father died within these two hours.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, 'tis twice two months, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">So long? Nay then, let the devil wear black, for</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll have a suit of sables. O heavens! die two</div>
                              <div class="line">months ago, and not forgotten yet? Then there's</div>
                              <div class="line">hope a great man's memory may outlive his life half</div>
                              <div class="line">a year: but, by'r lady, he must build churches,</div>
                              <div class="line">then; or else shall he suffer not thinking on, with</div>
                              <div class="line">the hobby-horse, whose epitaph is 'For, O, for, O,</div>
                              <div class="line">the hobby-horse is forgot.'</div>
                              <p>Hautboys play. The dumb-show enters</p>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter a King and a Queen very lovingly; the Queen
embracing him, and he her. She kneels, and makes
show of protestation unto him. He takes her up,
and declines his head upon her neck: lays him down
upon a bank of flowers: she, seeing him asleep,
leaves him. Anon comes in a fellow, takes off his
crown, kisses it, and pours poison in the King's
ears, and exit. The Queen returns; finds the King
dead, and makes passionate action. The Poisoner,
with some two or three Mutes, comes in again,
seeming to lament with her. The dead body is
carried away. The Poisoner wooes the Queen with
gifts: she seems loath and unwilling awhile, but
in the end accepts his love</p>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">What means this, my lord?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry, this is miching mallecho; it means mischief.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Belike this show imports the argument of the play.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter Prologue</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">We shall know by this fellow: the players cannot</div>
                              <div class="line">keep counsel; they'll tell all.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Will he tell us what this show meant?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, or any show that you'll show him: be not you</div>
                              <div class="line">ashamed to show, he'll not shame to tell you what it means.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">You are naught, you are naught: I'll mark the play.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Prologue</div>
                              <div class="line">For us, and for our tragedy,</div>
                              <div class="line">Here stooping to your clemency,</div>
                              <div class="line">We beg your hearing patiently.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Is this a prologue, or the posy of a ring?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis brief, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">As woman's love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter two Players, King and Queen</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Player King</div>
                              <div class="line">Full thirty times hath Phoebus' cart gone round</div>
                              <div class="line">Neptune's salt wash and Tellus' orbed ground,</div>
                              <div class="line">And thirty dozen moons with borrow'd sheen</div>
                              <div class="line">About the world have times twelve thirties been,</div>
                              <div class="line">Since love our hearts and Hymen did our hands</div>
                              <div class="line">Unite commutual in most sacred bands.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Player Queen</div>
                              <div class="line">So many journeys may the sun and moon</div>
                              <div class="line">Make us again count o'er ere love be done!</div>
                              <div class="line">But, woe is me, you are so sick of late,</div>
                              <div class="line">So far from cheer and from your former state,</div>
                              <div class="line">That I distrust you. Yet, though I distrust,</div>
                              <div class="line">Discomfort you, my lord, it nothing must:</div>
                              <div class="line">For women's fear and love holds quantity;</div>
                              <div class="line">In neither aught, or in extremity.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, what my love is, proof hath made you know;</div>
                              <div class="line">And as my love is sized, my fear is so:</div>
                              <div class="line">Where love is great, the littlest doubts are fear;</div>
                              <div class="line">Where little fears grow great, great love grows there.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Player King</div>
                              <div class="line">'Faith, I must leave thee, love, and shortly too;</div>
                              <div class="line">My operant powers their functions leave to do:</div>
                              <div class="line">And thou shalt live in this fair world behind,</div>
                              <div class="line">Honour'd, beloved; and haply one as kind</div>
                              <div class="line">For husband shalt thou--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Player Queen</div>
                              <div class="line">O, confound the rest!</div>
                              <div class="line">Such love must needs be treason in my breast:</div>
                              <div class="line">In second husband let me be accurst!</div>
                              <div class="line">None wed the second but who kill'd the first.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  Wormwood, wormwood.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Player Queen</div>
                              <div class="line">The instances that second marriage move</div>
                              <div class="line">Are base respects of thrift, but none of love:</div>
                              <div class="line">A second time I kill my husband dead,</div>
                              <div class="line">When second husband kisses me in bed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Player King</div>
                              <div class="line">I do believe you think what now you speak;</div>
                              <div class="line">But what we do determine oft we break.</div>
                              <div class="line">Purpose is but the slave to memory,</div>
                              <div class="line">Of violent birth, but poor validity;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which now, like fruit unripe, sticks on the tree;</div>
                              <div class="line">But fall, unshaken, when they mellow be.</div>
                              <div class="line">Most necessary 'tis that we forget</div>
                              <div class="line">To pay ourselves what to ourselves is debt:</div>
                              <div class="line">What to ourselves in passion we propose,</div>
                              <div class="line">The passion ending, doth the purpose lose.</div>
                              <div class="line">The violence of either grief or joy</div>
                              <div class="line">Their own enactures with themselves destroy:</div>
                              <div class="line">Where joy most revels, grief doth most lament;</div>
                              <div class="line">Grief joys, joy grieves, on slender accident.</div>
                              <div class="line">This world is not for aye, nor 'tis not strange</div>
                              <div class="line">That even our loves should with our fortunes change;</div>
                              <div class="line">For 'tis a question left us yet to prove,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whether love lead fortune, or else fortune love.</div>
                              <div class="line">The great man down, you mark his favourite flies;</div>
                              <div class="line">The poor advanced makes friends of enemies.</div>
                              <div class="line">And hitherto doth love on fortune tend;</div>
                              <div class="line">For who not needs shall never lack a friend,</div>
                              <div class="line">And who in want a hollow friend doth try,</div>
                              <div class="line">Directly seasons him his enemy.</div>
                              <div class="line">But, orderly to end where I begun,</div>
                              <div class="line">Our wills and fates do so contrary run</div>
                              <div class="line">That our devices still are overthrown;</div>
                              <div class="line">Our thoughts are ours, their ends none of our own:</div>
                              <div class="line">So think thou wilt no second husband wed;</div>
                              <div class="line">But die thy thoughts when thy first lord is dead.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Player Queen</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor earth to me give food, nor heaven light!</div>
                              <div class="line">Sport and repose lock from me day and night!</div>
                              <div class="line">To desperation turn my trust and hope!</div>
                              <div class="line">An anchor's cheer in prison be my scope!</div>
                              <div class="line">Each opposite that blanks the face of joy</div>
                              <div class="line">Meet what I would have well and it destroy!</div>
                              <div class="line">Both here and hence pursue me lasting strife,</div>
                              <div class="line">If, once a widow, ever I be wife!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">If she should break it now!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Player King</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis deeply sworn. Sweet, leave me here awhile;</div>
                              <div class="line">My spirits grow dull, and fain I would beguile</div>
                              <div class="line">The tedious day with sleep.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Sleeps</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Player Queen</div>
                              <div class="line">Sleep rock thy brain,</div>
                              <div class="line">And never come mischance between us twain!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Madam, how like you this play?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                              <div class="line">The lady protests too much, methinks.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">O, but she'll keep her word.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Have you heard the argument? Is there no offence in 't?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">No, no, they do but jest, poison in jest; no offence</div>
                              <div class="line">i' the world.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">What do you call the play?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">The Mouse-trap. Marry, how? Tropically. This play</div>
                              <div class="line">is the image of a murder done in Vienna: Gonzago is</div>
                              <div class="line">the duke's name; his wife, Baptista: you shall see</div>
                              <div class="line">anon; 'tis a knavish piece of work: but what o'</div>
                              <div class="line">that? your majesty and we that have free souls, it</div>
                              <div class="line">touches us not: let the galled jade wince, our</div>
                              <div class="line">withers are unwrung.</div>
                              <p>Enter LUCIANUS</p>
                              <div class="line">This is one Lucianus, nephew to the king.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">You are as good as a chorus, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">I could interpret between you and your love, if I</div>
                              <div class="line">could see the puppets dallying.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">You are keen, my lord, you are keen.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">It would cost you a groaning to take off my edge.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Still better, and worse.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">So you must take your husbands. Begin, murderer;</div>
                              <div class="line">pox, leave thy damnable faces, and begin. Come:</div>
                              <div class="line">'the croaking raven doth bellow for revenge.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LUCIANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Thoughts black, hands apt, drugs fit, and time agreeing;</div>
                              <div class="line">Confederate season, else no creature seeing;</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou mixture rank, of midnight weeds collected,</div>
                              <div class="line">With Hecate's ban thrice blasted, thrice infected,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy natural magic and dire property,</div>
                              <div class="line">On wholesome life usurp immediately.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Pours the poison into the sleeper's ears</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">He poisons him i' the garden for's estate. His</div>
                              <div class="line">name's Gonzago: the story is extant, and writ in</div>
                              <div class="line">choice Italian: you shall see anon how the murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">gets the love of Gonzago's wife.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OPHELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">The king rises.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">What, frighted with false fire!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                              <div class="line">How fares my lord?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Give o'er the play.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Give me some light: away!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">All</div>
                              <div class="line">Lights, lights, lights!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt all but HAMLET and HORATIO</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, let the stricken deer go weep,</div>
                              <div class="line">The hart ungalled play;</div>
                              <div class="line">For some must watch, while some must sleep:</div>
                              <div class="line">So runs the world away.</div>
                              <div class="line">Would not this, sir, and a forest of feathers-- if</div>
                              <div class="line">the rest of my fortunes turn Turk with me--with two</div>
                              <div class="line">Provincial roses on my razed shoes, get me a</div>
                              <div class="line">fellowship in a cry of players, sir?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Half a share.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">A whole one, I.</div>
                              <div class="line">For thou dost know, O Damon dear,</div>
                              <div class="line">This realm dismantled was</div>
                              <div class="line">Of Jove himself; and now reigns here</div>
                              <div class="line">A very, very--pajock.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">You might have rhymed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">O good Horatio, I'll take the ghost's word for a</div>
                              <div class="line">thousand pound. Didst perceive?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Very well, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon the talk of the poisoning?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I did very well note him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, ha! Come, some music! come, the recorders!</div>
                              <div class="line">For if the king like not the comedy,</div>
                              <div class="line">Why then, belike, he likes it not, perdy.</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, some music!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                              <div class="line">Good my lord, vouchsafe me a word with you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, a whole history.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                              <div class="line">The king, sir,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, sir, what of him?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                              <div class="line">Is in his retirement marvellous distempered.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">With drink, sir?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                              <div class="line">No, my lord, rather with choler.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Your wisdom should show itself more richer to</div>
                              <div class="line">signify this to his doctor; for, for me to put him</div>
                              <div class="line">to his purgation would perhaps plunge him into far</div>
                              <div class="line">more choler.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                              <div class="line">Good my lord, put your discourse into some frame and</div>
                              <div class="line">start not so wildly from my affair.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">I am tame, sir: pronounce.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                              <div class="line">The queen, your mother, in most great affliction of</div>
                              <div class="line">spirit, hath sent me to you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">You are welcome.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, good my lord, this courtesy is not of the right</div>
                              <div class="line">breed. If it shall please you to make me a</div>
                              <div class="line">wholesome answer, I will do your mother's</div>
                              <div class="line">commandment: if not, your pardon and my return</div>
                              <div class="line">shall be the end of my business.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, I cannot.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                              <div class="line">What, my lord?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Make you a wholesome answer; my wit's diseased: but,</div>
                              <div class="line">sir, such answer as I can make, you shall command;</div>
                              <div class="line">or, rather, as you say, my mother: therefore no</div>
                              <div class="line">more, but to the matter: my mother, you say,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                              <div class="line">Then thus she says; your behavior hath struck her</div>
                              <div class="line">into amazement and admiration.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">O wonderful son, that can so astonish a mother! But</div>
                              <div class="line">is there no sequel at the heels of this mother's</div>
                              <div class="line">admiration? Impart.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                              <div class="line">She desires to speak with you in her closet, ere you</div>
                              <div class="line">go to bed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">We shall obey, were she ten times our mother. Have</div>
                              <div class="line">you any further trade with us?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, you once did love me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">So I do still, by these pickers and stealers.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                              <div class="line">Good my lord, what is your cause of distemper? you</div>
                              <div class="line">do, surely, bar the door upon your own liberty, if</div>
                              <div class="line">you deny your griefs to your friend.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, I lack advancement.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                              <div class="line">How can that be, when you have the voice of the king</div>
                              <div class="line">himself for your succession in Denmark?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, but sir, 'While the grass grows,'--the proverb</div>
                              <div class="line">is something musty.</div>
                              <p>Re-enter Players with recorders</p>
                              <div class="line">O, the recorders! let me see one. To withdraw with</div>
                              <div class="line">you:--why do you go about to recover the wind of me,</div>
                              <div class="line">as if you would drive me into a toil?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                              <div class="line">O, my lord, if my duty be too bold, my love is too</div>
                              <div class="line">unmannerly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">I do not well understand that. Will you play upon</div>
                              <div class="line">this pipe?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, I cannot.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                              <div class="line">Believe me, I cannot.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">I do beseech you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                              <div class="line">I know no touch of it, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis as easy as lying: govern these ventages with</div>
                              <div class="line">your lingers and thumb, give it breath with your</div>
                              <div class="line">mouth, and it will discourse most eloquent music.</div>
                              <div class="line">Look you, these are the stops.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                              <div class="line">But these cannot I command to any utterance of</div>
                              <div class="line">harmony; I have not the skill.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, look you now, how unworthy a thing you make of</div>
                              <div class="line">me! You would play upon me; you would seem to know</div>
                              <div class="line">my stops; you would pluck out the heart of my</div>
                              <div class="line">mystery; you would sound me from my lowest note to</div>
                              <div class="line">the top of my compass: and there is much music,</div>
                              <div class="line">excellent voice, in this little organ; yet cannot</div>
                              <div class="line">you make it speak. 'Sblood, do you think I am</div>
                              <div class="line">easier to be played on than a pipe? Call me what</div>
                              <div class="line">instrument you will, though you can fret me, yet you</div>
                              <div class="line">cannot play upon me.</div>
                              <p>Enter POLONIUS</p>
                              <div class="line">God bless you, sir!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, the queen would speak with you, and</div>
                              <div class="line">presently.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Do you see yonder cloud that's almost in shape of a camel?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">By the mass, and 'tis like a camel, indeed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Methinks it is like a weasel.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">It is backed like a weasel.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Or like a whale?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Very like a whale.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Then I will come to my mother by and by. They fool</div>
                              <div class="line">me to the top of my bent. I will come by and by.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORD POLONIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I will say so.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">By and by is easily said.</div>
                              <p>Exit POLONIUS</p>
                              <div class="line">Leave me, friends.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt all but HAMLET</p>
                              <div class="line">Tis now the very witching time of night,</div>
                              <div class="line">When churchyards yawn and hell itself breathes out</div>
                              <div class="line">Contagion to this world: now could I drink hot blood,</div>
                              <div class="line">And do such bitter business as the day</div>
                              <div class="line">Would quake to look on. Soft! now to my mother.</div>
                              <div class="line">O heart, lose not thy nature; let not ever</div>
                              <div class="line">The soul of Nero enter this firm bosom:</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me be cruel, not unnatural:</div>
                              <div class="line">I will speak daggers to her, but use none;</div>
                              <div class="line">My tongue and soul in this be hypocrites;</div>
                              <div class="line">How in my words soever she be shent,</div>
                              <div class="line">To give them seals never, my soul, consent!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.5.4">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>3. SCENE III.  A room in the castle.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter KING CLAUDIUS, ROSENCRANTZ, and GUILDENSTERN</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I like him not, nor stands it safe with us</div>
                              <div class="line">To let his madness range. Therefore prepare you;</div>
                              <div class="line">I your commission will forthwith dispatch,</div>
                              <div class="line">And he to England shall along with you:</div>
                              <div class="line">The terms of our estate may not endure</div>
                              <div class="line">Hazard so dangerous as doth hourly grow</div>
                              <div class="line">Out of his lunacies.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GUILDENSTERN</div>
                              <div class="line">We will ourselves provide:</div>
                              <div class="line">Most holy and religious fear it is</div>
                              <div class="line">To keep those many many bodies safe</div>
                              <div class="line">That live and feed upon your majesty.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSENCRANTZ</div>
                              <div class="line">The single and peculiar life is bound,</div>
                              <div class="line">With all the strength and armour of the mind,</div>
                              <div class="line">To keep itself from noyance; but much more</div>
                              <div class="line">That spirit upon whose weal depend and rest</div>
