                              <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  A churchyard.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  A hall in the castle.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  A churchyard.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter two Clowns, with spades, &c</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Is she to be buried in Christian burial that</div>
                              <div class="line">wilfully seeks her own salvation?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">I tell thee she is: and therefore make her grave</div>
                              <div class="line">straight: the crowner hath sat on her, and finds it</div>
                              <div class="line">Christian burial.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">How can that be, unless she drowned herself in her</div>
                              <div class="line">own defence?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, 'tis found so.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">It must be 'se offendendo;' it cannot be else. For</div>
                              <div class="line">here lies the point:  if I drown myself wittingly,</div>
                              <div class="line">it argues an act: and an act hath three branches: it</div>
                              <div class="line">is, to act, to do, to perform: argal, she drowned</div>
                              <div class="line">herself wittingly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, but hear you, goodman delver,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Give me leave. Here lies the water; good: here</div>
                              <div class="line">stands the man; good; if the man go to this water,</div>
                              <div class="line">and drown himself, it is, will he, nill he, he</div>
                              <div class="line">goes,--mark you that; but if the water come to him</div>
                              <div class="line">and drown him, he drowns not himself: argal, he</div>
                              <div class="line">that is not guilty of his own death shortens not his own life.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">But is this law?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, marry, is't; crowner's quest law.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Will you ha' the truth on't? If this had not been</div>
                              <div class="line">a gentlewoman, she should have been buried out o'</div>
                              <div class="line">Christian burial.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, there thou say'st: and the more pity that</div>
                              <div class="line">great folk should have countenance in this world to</div>
                              <div class="line">drown or hang themselves, more than their even</div>
                              <div class="line">Christian. Come, my spade. There is no ancient</div>
                              <div class="line">gentleman but gardeners, ditchers, and grave-makers:</div>
                              <div class="line">they hold up Adam's profession.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Was he a gentleman?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">He was the first that ever bore arms.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, he had none.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">What, art a heathen? How dost thou understand the</div>
                              <div class="line">Scripture? The Scripture says 'Adam digged:'</div>
                              <div class="line">could he dig without arms? I'll put another</div>
                              <div class="line">question to thee: if thou answerest me not to the</div>
                              <div class="line">purpose, confess thyself--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Go to.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">What is he that builds stronger than either the</div>
                              <div class="line">mason, the shipwright, or the carpenter?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">The gallows-maker; for that frame outlives a</div>
                              <div class="line">thousand tenants.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">I like thy wit well, in good faith: the gallows</div>
                              <div class="line">does well; but how does it well? it does well to</div>
                              <div class="line">those that do in: now thou dost ill to say the</div>
                              <div class="line">gallows is built stronger than the church: argal,</div>
                              <div class="line">the gallows may do well to thee. To't again, come.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">'Who builds stronger than a mason, a shipwright, or</div>
                              <div class="line">a carpenter?'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, tell me that, and unyoke.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry, now I can tell.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">To't.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Mass, I cannot tell.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter HAMLET and HORATIO, at a distance</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Cudgel thy brains no more about it, for your dull</div>
                              <div class="line">ass will not mend his pace with beating; and, when</div>
                              <div class="line">you are asked this question next, say 'a</div>
                              <div class="line">grave-maker: 'the houses that he makes last till</div>
                              <div class="line">doomsday. Go, get thee to Yaughan: fetch me a</div>
                              <div class="line">stoup of liquor.</div>
                              <p>Exit Second Clown</p>
                              <p>He digs and sings</p>
                              <div class="line">In youth, when I did love, did love,</div>
                              <div class="line">Methought it was very sweet,</div>
                              <div class="line">To contract, O, the time, for, ah, my behove,</div>
                              <div class="line">O, methought, there was nothing meet.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Has this fellow no feeling of his business, that he</div>
                              <div class="line">sings at grave-making?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Custom hath made it in him a property of easiness.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis e'en so: the hand of little employment hath</div>
                              <div class="line">the daintier sense.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Sings</span>
                              </div>
                              <div class="line">But age, with his stealing steps,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath claw'd me in his clutch,</div>
                              <div class="line">And hath shipped me intil the land,</div>
                              <div class="line">As if I had never been such.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Throws up a skull</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">That skull had a tongue in it, and could sing once:</div>
                              <div class="line">how the knave jowls it to the ground, as if it were</div>
                              <div class="line">Cain's jaw-bone, that did the first murder! It</div>
                              <div class="line">might be the pate of a politician, which this ass</div>
                              <div class="line">now o'er-reaches; one that would circumvent God,</div>
                              <div class="line">might it not?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">It might, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Or of a courtier; which could say 'Good morrow,</div>
                              <div class="line">sweet lord! How dost thou, good lord?' This might</div>
                              <div class="line">be my lord such-a-one, that praised my lord</div>
                              <div class="line">such-a-one's horse, when he meant to beg it; might it not?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, e'en so: and now my Lady Worm's; chapless, and</div>
                              <div class="line">knocked about the mazzard with a sexton's spade:</div>
                              <div class="line">here's fine revolution, an we had the trick to</div>
                              <div class="line">see't. Did these bones cost no more the breeding,</div>
                              <div class="line">but to play at loggats with 'em? mine ache to think on't.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <p>Sings</p>
                              <div class="line">A pick-axe, and a spade, a spade,</div>
                              <div class="line">For and a shrouding sheet:</div>
                              <div class="line">O, a pit of clay for to be made</div>
                              <div class="line">For such a guest is meet.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Throws up another skull</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">There's another: why may not that be the skull of a</div>
                              <div class="line">lawyer? Where be his quiddities now, his quillets,</div>
                              <div class="line">his cases, his tenures, and his tricks? why does he</div>
                              <div class="line">suffer this rude knave now to knock him about the</div>
                              <div class="line">sconce with a dirty shovel, and will not tell him of</div>
                              <div class="line">his action of battery? Hum! This fellow might be</div>
                              <div class="line">in's time a great buyer of land, with his statutes,</div>
                              <div class="line">his recognizances, his fines, his double vouchers,</div>
                              <div class="line">his recoveries: is this the fine of his fines, and</div>
                              <div class="line">the recovery of his recoveries, to have his fine</div>
                              <div class="line">pate full of fine dirt? will his vouchers vouch him</div>
                              <div class="line">no more of his purchases, and double ones too, than</div>
                              <div class="line">the length and breadth of a pair of indentures? The</div>
                              <div class="line">very conveyances of his lands will hardly lie in</div>
                              <div class="line">this box; and must the inheritor himself have no more, ha?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Not a jot more, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Is not parchment made of sheepskins?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, my lord, and of calf-skins too.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">They are sheep and calves which seek out assurance</div>
                              <div class="line">in that. I will speak to this fellow. Whose</div>
                              <div class="line">grave's this, sirrah?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Mine, sir.</div>
                              <p>Sings</p>
                              <div class="line">O, a pit of clay for to be made</div>
                              <div class="line">For such a guest is meet.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">I think it be thine, indeed; for thou liest in't.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">You lie out on't, sir, and therefore it is not</div>
                              <div class="line">yours: for my part, I do not lie in't, and yet it is mine.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">'Thou dost lie in't, to be in't and say it is thine:</div>
                              <div class="line">'tis for the dead, not for the quick; therefore thou liest.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis a quick lie, sir; 'twill away gain, from me to</div>
                              <div class="line">you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">What man dost thou dig it for?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">For no man, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">What woman, then?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">For none, neither.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Who is to be buried in't?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">One that was a woman, sir; but, rest her soul, she's dead.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">How absolute the knave is! we must speak by the</div>
                              <div class="line">card, or equivocation will undo us. By the Lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">Horatio, these three years I have taken a note of</div>
                              <div class="line">it; the age is grown so picked that the toe of the</div>
                              <div class="line">peasant comes so near the heel of the courtier, he</div>
                              <div class="line">gaffs his kibe. How long hast thou been a</div>
                              <div class="line">grave-maker?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Of all the days i' the year, I came to't that day</div>
                              <div class="line">that our last king Hamlet overcame Fortinbras.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">How long is that since?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Cannot you tell that? every fool can tell that: it</div>
                              <div class="line">was the very day that young Hamlet was born; he that</div>
                              <div class="line">is mad, and sent into England.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, marry, why was he sent into England?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, because he was mad: he shall recover his wits</div>
                              <div class="line">there; or, if he do not, it's no great matter there.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Why?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">'Twill, a not be seen in him there; there the men</div>
                              <div class="line">are as mad as he.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">How came he mad?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Very strangely, they say.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">How strangely?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Faith, e'en with losing his wits.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon what ground?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, here in Denmark: I have been sexton here, man</div>
                              <div class="line">and boy, thirty years.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">How long will a man lie i' the earth ere he rot?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">I' faith, if he be not rotten before he die--as we</div>
                              <div class="line">have many pocky corses now-a-days, that will scarce</div>
                              <div class="line">hold the laying in--he will last you some eight year</div>
                              <div class="line">or nine year: a tanner will last you nine year.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Why he more than another?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, sir, his hide is so tanned with his trade, that</div>
                              <div class="line">he will keep out water a great while; and your water</div>
                              <div class="line">is a sore decayer of your whoreson dead body.</div>
                              <div class="line">Here's a skull now; this skull has lain in the earth</div>
                              <div class="line">three and twenty years.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose was it?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">A whoreson mad fellow's it was: whose do you think it was?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, I know not.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">A pestilence on him for a mad rogue! a' poured a</div>
                              <div class="line">flagon of Rhenish on my head once. This same skull,</div>
                              <div class="line">sir, was Yorick's skull, the king's jester.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">This?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Clown</div>
                              <div class="line">E'en that.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me see.</div>
                              <p>Takes the skull</p>
                              <div class="line">Alas, poor Yorick! I knew him, Horatio: a fellow</div>
                              <div class="line">of infinite jest, of most excellent fancy: he hath</div>
                              <div class="line">borne me on his back a thousand times; and now, how</div>
                              <div class="line">abhorred in my imagination it is! my gorge rims at</div>
                              <div class="line">it. Here hung those lips that I have kissed I know</div>
                              <div class="line">not how oft. Where be your gibes now? your</div>
                              <div class="line">gambols? your songs? your flashes of merriment,</div>
                              <div class="line">that were wont to set the table on a roar? Not one</div>
                              <div class="line">now, to mock your own grinning? quite chap-fallen?</div>
                              <div class="line">Now get you to my lady's chamber, and tell her, let</div>
                              <div class="line">her paint an inch thick, to this favour she must</div>
                              <div class="line">come; make her laugh at that. Prithee, Horatio, tell</div>
                              <div class="line">me one thing.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">What's that, my lord?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Dost thou think Alexander looked o' this fashion i'</div>
                              <div class="line">the earth?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">E'en so.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">And smelt so? pah!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Puts down the skull</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">E'en so, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">To what base uses we may return, Horatio! Why may</div>
                              <div class="line">not imagination trace the noble dust of Alexander,</div>
                              <div class="line">till he find it stopping a bung-hole?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">'Twere to consider too curiously, to consider so.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">No, faith, not a jot; but to follow him thither with</div>
                              <div class="line">modesty enough, and likelihood to lead it: as</div>
                              <div class="line">thus: Alexander died, Alexander was buried,</div>
                              <div class="line">Alexander returneth into dust; the dust is earth; of</div>
                              <div class="line">earth we make loam; and why of that loam, whereto he</div>
                              <div class="line">was converted, might they not stop a beer-barrel?</div>
                              <div class="line">Imperious Caesar, dead and turn'd to clay,</div>
                              <div class="line">Might stop a hole to keep the wind away:</div>
                              <div class="line">O, that that earth, which kept the world in awe,</div>
                              <div class="line">Should patch a wall to expel the winter flaw!</div>
                              <div class="line">But soft! but soft! aside: here comes the king.</div>
                              <p>Enter Priest, &c. in procession; the Corpse of
OPHELIA, LAERTES and Mourners following; KING
CLAUDIUS, QUEEN GERTRUDE, their trains, &c</p>
                              <div class="line">The queen, the courtiers: who is this they follow?</div>
                              <div class="line">And with such maimed rites? This doth betoken</div>
                              <div class="line">The corse they follow did with desperate hand</div>
                              <div class="line">Fordo its own life: 'twas of some estate.</div>
                              <div class="line">Couch we awhile, and mark.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Retiring with HORATIO</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                              <div class="line">What ceremony else?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">That is Laertes,</div>
                              <div class="line">A very noble youth: mark.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                              <div class="line">What ceremony else?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Priest</div>
                              <div class="line">Her obsequies have been as far enlarged</div>
                              <div class="line">As we have warrantise: her death was doubtful;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, but that great command o'ersways the order,</div>
                              <div class="line">She should in ground unsanctified have lodged</div>
                              <div class="line">Till the last trumpet: for charitable prayers,</div>
                              <div class="line">Shards, flints and pebbles should be thrown on her;</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet here she is allow'd her virgin crants,</div>
                              <div class="line">Her maiden strewments and the bringing home</div>
                              <div class="line">Of bell and burial.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                              <div class="line">Must there no more be done?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Priest</div>
                              <div class="line">No more be done:</div>
                              <div class="line">We should profane the service of the dead</div>
                              <div class="line">To sing a requiem and such rest to her</div>
                              <div class="line">As to peace-parted souls.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                              <div class="line">Lay her i' the earth:</div>
                              <div class="line">And from her fair and unpolluted flesh</div>
                              <div class="line">May violets spring! I tell thee, churlish priest,</div>
                              <div class="line">A ministering angel shall my sister be,</div>
                              <div class="line">When thou liest howling.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">What, the fair Ophelia!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweets to the sweet: farewell!</div>
                              <p>Scattering flowers</p>
                              <div class="line">I hoped thou shouldst have been my Hamlet's wife;</div>
                              <div class="line">I thought thy bride-bed to have deck'd, sweet maid,</div>
                              <div class="line">And not have strew'd thy grave.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                              <div class="line">O, treble woe</div>
                              <div class="line">Fall ten times treble on that cursed head,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose wicked deed thy most ingenious sense</div>
                              <div class="line">Deprived thee of! Hold off the earth awhile,</div>
                              <div class="line">Till I have caught her once more in mine arms:</div>
                              <p>Leaps into the grave</p>
                              <div class="line">Now pile your dust upon the quick and dead,</div>
                              <div class="line">Till of this flat a mountain you have made,</div>
                              <div class="line">To o'ertop old Pelion, or the skyish head</div>
                              <div class="line">Of blue Olympus.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Advancing</span>     What is he whose grief</div>
                              <div class="line">Bears such an emphasis? whose phrase of sorrow</div>
                              <div class="line">Conjures the wandering stars, and makes them stand</div>
                              <div class="line">Like wonder-wounded hearers? This is I,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hamlet the Dane.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Leaps into the grave</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAERTES</div>
                              <div class="line">The devil take thy soul!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Grappling with him</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou pray'st not well.</div>
                              <div class="line">I prithee, take thy fingers from my throat;</div>
                              <div class="line">For, though I am not splenitive and rash,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet have I something in me dangerous,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which let thy wiseness fear: hold off thy hand.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Pluck them asunder.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                              <div class="line">Hamlet, Hamlet!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">All</div>
                              <div class="line">Gentlemen,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Good my lord, be quiet.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>The Attendants part them, and they come out of the grave</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Why I will fight with him upon this theme</div>
                              <div class="line">Until my eyelids will no longer wag.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                              <div class="line">O my son, what theme?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">I loved Ophelia: forty thousand brothers</div>
                              <div class="line">Could not, with all their quantity of love,</div>
                              <div class="line">Make up my sum. What wilt thou do for her?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">O, he is mad, Laertes.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                              <div class="line">For love of God, forbear him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">'Swounds, show me what thou'lt do:</div>
                              <div class="line">Woo't weep? woo't fight? woo't fast? woo't tear thyself?</div>
                              <div class="line">Woo't drink up eisel? eat a crocodile?</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll do't. Dost thou come here to whine?</div>
                              <div class="line">To outface me with leaping in her grave?</div>
                              <div class="line">Be buried quick with her, and so will I:</div>
                              <div class="line">And, if thou prate of mountains, let them throw</div>
                              <div class="line">Millions of acres on us, till our ground,</div>
                              <div class="line">Singeing his pate against the burning zone,</div>
                              <div class="line">Make Ossa like a wart! Nay, an thou'lt mouth,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll rant as well as thou.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN GERTRUDE</div>
                              <div class="line">This is mere madness:</div>
                              <div class="line">And thus awhile the fit will work on him;</div>
                              <div class="line">Anon, as patient as the female dove,</div>
                              <div class="line">When that her golden couplets are disclosed,</div>
                              <div class="line">His silence will sit drooping.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Hear you, sir;</div>
                              <div class="line">What is the reason that you use me thus?</div>
                              <div class="line">I loved you ever: but it is no matter;</div>
                              <div class="line">Let Hercules himself do what he may,</div>
                              <div class="line">The cat will mew and dog will have his day.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING CLAUDIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray you, good Horatio, wait upon him.</div>
                              <p>Exit HORATIO</p>
                              <p>To LAERTES</p>
                              <div class="line">Strengthen your patience in our last night's speech;</div>
                              <div class="line">We'll put the matter to the present push.</div>
                              <div class="line">Good Gertrude, set some watch over your son.</div>
                              <div class="line">This grave shall have a living monument:</div>
                              <div class="line">An hour of quiet shortly shall we see;</div>
                              <div class="line">Till then, in patience our proceeding be.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  A hall in the castle.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter HAMLET and HORATIO</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">So much for this, sir: now shall you see the other;</div>
                              <div class="line">You do remember all the circumstance?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Remember it, my lord?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, in my heart there was a kind of fighting,</div>
                              <div class="line">That would not let me sleep: methought I lay</div>
                              <div class="line">Worse than the mutines in the bilboes. Rashly,</div>
                              <div class="line">And praised be rashness for it, let us know,</div>
                              <div class="line">Our indiscretion sometimes serves us well,</div>
                              <div class="line">When our deep plots do pall: and that should teach us</div>
                              <div class="line">There's a divinity that shapes our ends,</div>
                              <div class="line">Rough-hew them how we will,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">That is most certain.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Up from my cabin,</div>
                              <div class="line">My sea-gown scarf'd about me, in the dark</div>
                              <div class="line">Groped I to find out them; had my desire.</div>
                              <div class="line">Finger'd their packet, and in fine withdrew</div>
                              <div class="line">To mine own room again; making so bold,</div>
                              <div class="line">My fears forgetting manners, to unseal</div>
                              <div class="line">Their grand commission; where I found, Horatio,--</div>
                              <div class="line">O royal knavery!--an exact command,</div>
                              <div class="line">Larded with many several sorts of reasons</div>
                              <div class="line">Importing Denmark's health and England's too,</div>
                              <div class="line">With, ho! such bugs and goblins in my life,</div>
                              <div class="line">That, on the supervise, no leisure bated,</div>
                              <div class="line">No, not to stay the grinding of the axe,</div>
                              <div class="line">My head should be struck off.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Is't possible?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Here's the commission: read it at more leisure.</div>
                              <div class="line">But wilt thou hear me how I did proceed?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I beseech you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Being thus be-netted round with villanies,--</div>
                              <div class="line">Ere I could make a prologue to my brains,</div>
                              <div class="line">They had begun the play--I sat me down,</div>
                              <div class="line">Devised a new commission, wrote it fair:</div>
                              <div class="line">I once did hold it, as our statists do,</div>
                              <div class="line">A baseness to write fair and labour'd much</div>
                              <div class="line">How to forget that learning, but, sir, now</div>
                              <div class="line">It did me yeoman's service: wilt thou know</div>
                              <div class="line">The effect of what I wrote?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, good my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">An earnest conjuration from the king,</div>
                              <div class="line">As England was his faithful tributary,</div>
                              <div class="line">As love between them like the palm might flourish,</div>
                              <div class="line">As peace should stiff her wheaten garland wear</div>
                              <div class="line">And stand a comma 'tween their amities,</div>
                              <div class="line">And many such-like 'As'es of great charge,</div>
                              <div class="line">That, on the view and knowing of these contents,</div>
                              <div class="line">Without debatement further, more or less,</div>
                              <div class="line">He should the bearers put to sudden death,</div>
                              <div class="line">Not shriving-time allow'd.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">How was this seal'd?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, even in that was heaven ordinant.</div>
                              <div class="line">I had my father's signet in my purse,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which was the model of that Danish seal;</div>
                              <div class="line">Folded the writ up in form of the other,</div>
                              <div class="line">Subscribed it, gave't the impression, placed it safely,</div>
                              <div class="line">The changeling never known. Now, the next day</div>
                              <div class="line">Was our sea-fight; and what to this was sequent</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou know'st already.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">So Guildenstern and Rosencrantz go to't.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, man, they did make love to this employment;</div>
                              <div class="line">They are not near my conscience; their defeat</div>
                              <div class="line">Does by their own insinuation grow:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis dangerous when the baser nature comes</div>
                              <div class="line">Between the pass and fell incensed points</div>
                              <div class="line">Of mighty opposites.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, what a king is this!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Does it not, think'st thee, stand me now upon--</div>
                              <div class="line">He that hath kill'd my king and whored my mother,</div>
                              <div class="line">Popp'd in between the election and my hopes,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thrown out his angle for my proper life,</div>
                              <div class="line">And with such cozenage--is't not perfect conscience,</div>
                              <div class="line">To quit him with this arm? and is't not to be damn'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">To let this canker of our nature come</div>
                              <div class="line">In further evil?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">It must be shortly known to him from England</div>
                              <div class="line">What is the issue of the business there.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">It will be short: the interim is mine;</div>
                              <div class="line">And a man's life's no more than to say 'One.'</div>
                              <div class="line">But I am very sorry, good Horatio,</div>
                              <div class="line">That to Laertes I forgot myself;</div>
                              <div class="line">For, by the image of my cause, I see</div>
                              <div class="line">The portraiture of his: I'll court his favours.</div>
                              <div class="line">But, sure, the bravery of his grief did put me</div>
                              <div class="line">Into a towering passion.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Peace! who comes here?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter OSRIC</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OSRIC</div>
                              <div class="line">Your lordship is right welcome back to Denmark.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">I humbly thank you, sir. Dost know this water-fly?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">No, my good lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy state is the more gracious; for 'tis a vice to</div>
                              <div class="line">know him. He hath much land, and fertile: let a</div>
                              <div class="line">beast be lord of beasts, and his crib shall stand at</div>
                              <div class="line">the king's mess: 'tis a chough; but, as I say,</div>
                              <div class="line">spacious in the possession of dirt.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OSRIC</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet lord, if your lordship were at leisure, I</div>
                              <div class="line">should impart a thing to you from his majesty.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">I will receive it, sir, with all diligence of</div>
                              <div class="line">spirit. Put your bonnet to his right use; 'tis for the head.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OSRIC</div>
                              <div class="line">I thank your lordship, it is very hot.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">No, believe me, 'tis very cold; the wind is</div>
                              <div class="line">northerly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OSRIC</div>
                              <div class="line">It is indifferent cold, my lord, indeed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">But yet methinks it is very sultry and hot for my</div>
                              <div class="line">complexion.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OSRIC</div>
                              <div class="line">Exceedingly, my lord; it is very sultry,--as</div>
                              <div class="line">'twere,--I cannot tell how. But, my lord, his</div>
                              <div class="line">majesty bade me signify to you that he has laid a</div>
                              <div class="line">great wager on your head: sir, this is the matter,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">I beseech you, remember--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>HAMLET moves him to put on his hat</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OSRIC</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, good my lord; for mine ease, in good faith.</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, here is newly come to court Laertes; believe</div>
                              <div class="line">me, an absolute gentleman, full of most excellent</div>
                              <div class="line">differences, of very soft society and great showing:</div>
                              <div class="line">indeed, to speak feelingly of him, he is the card or</div>
                              <div class="line">calendar of gentry, for you shall find in him the</div>
                              <div class="line">continent of what part a gentleman would see.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, his definement suffers no perdition in you;</div>
                              <div class="line">though, I know, to divide him inventorially would</div>
                              <div class="line">dizzy the arithmetic of memory, and yet but yaw</div>
                              <div class="line">neither, in respect of his quick sail. But, in the</div>
                              <div class="line">verity of extolment, I take him to be a soul of</div>
                              <div class="line">great article; and his infusion of such dearth and</div>
                              <div class="line">rareness, as, to make true diction of him, his</div>
                              <div class="line">semblable is his mirror; and who else would trace</div>
                              <div class="line">him, his umbrage, nothing more.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OSRIC</div>
                              <div class="line">Your lordship speaks most infallibly of him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">The concernancy, sir? why do we wrap the gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">in our more rawer breath?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OSRIC</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Is't not possible to understand in another tongue?</div>
                              <div class="line">You will do't, sir, really.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">What imports the nomination of this gentleman?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OSRIC</div>
                              <div class="line">Of Laertes?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HORATIO</div>
                              <div class="line">His purse is empty already; all's golden words are spent.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">Of him, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OSRIC</div>
                              <div class="line">I know you are not ignorant--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">I would you did, sir; yet, in faith, if you did,</div>
                              <div class="line">it would not much approve me. Well, sir?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OSRIC</div>
                              <div class="line">You are not ignorant of what excellence Laertes is--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HAMLET</div>
                              <div class="line">I dare not confess that, lest I should compare with</div>
